overview: Start by lying flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand. | Hold the dumbbells at chest level with your palms facing forward. | Engage your core and press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended.

name: Dumbbell Chest Fly
overview: Lay on a bench with two dumbbells extended in front of you. | You should have a slight bend in your elbows and maintain that bend. Your shoulder joint should do all the movement. | Bring the dumbbells out to your side. Stop the dumbbells before going behind your body. | Bring the dumbbells back together at the top.

name: Dumbbell Decline Alternating Single Arm Press
overview: Lay on a decline bench with both arms extended in front of you. | Break at one of your arms first bringing that arm to your side while keeping the other arm extended. | Press the dumbbell back to the ceiling. Fully extend that arm before initiating on the other side.

name: Dumbbell Decline Bench Press
overview: Lay on a decline bench with both arms extended in front of you. | Break at the elbows and bring your upper arms to your side. | Once your upper arms have reached your side, press the dumbbells back to the ceiling.

name: Dumbbell Decline Chest Fly
overview: Lay flat on a decline bench press with the dumbbells pointed toward the ceiling. | Maintain a slight bend in your elbows. Bring the dumbbells out to the side, stopping the dumbbells before they pass your torso. | Bring the dumbbells together to finish the rep.

name: Dumbbell Decline Guillotine Bench Press
overview: Lie on the decline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing forward. | Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows flared out. As you lower the dumbbells, exhale deeply. | Once your elbows reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position

name: Dumbbell Decline Neutral Bench Press
overview: Lie on the decline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body. | Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body. | Once the dumbbells reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position. | This variation is much easier on the shoulder joints.

name: Dumbbell Decline Single Arm Bench Press
overview: Start by laying on a decline bench with two dumbbells. | Position the dumbbell above your chest with your elbow bent and shoulder level. | Slowly lower the dumbbell towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and your core engaged while the other dumbbell remains pointed toward the ceiling. | Once the dumbbell reaches your side, pause for a moment and then press the weight back up to the starting position. | Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching to your other arm.

name: Dumbbell Decline Skullcrusher
overview: Start by lying on a decline bench with a dumbbell in each hand. | Hold the dumbbells above your chest with your arms extended and your palms facing each other. This is the starting position. | Slowly lower the dumbbells towards your forehead by bending your elbows. Keep your upper arms stationary and only move your forearms. | Once the dumbbells are close to your forehead, reverse the motion by extending your elbows and returning to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Decline Squeeze Press
overview: Lay flat on a decline bench with two dumbbells pressed to one another. | Break at the elbows and keep your elbows tucked as you bring the dumbbells to your chest. | Continue to press the dumbbells into one another throughout the rep. | Once the dumbbells reach your chest, press back toward the ceiling.

name: Dumbbell Forward Lunge
overview: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing each other. | Take a big step forward with your right foot, lowering your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is hovering just above the floor. | Push through your right heel to straighten your right leg and return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Goblet Bulgarian Split Squat
overview: Holding the dumbbell in a goblet squat place your foot on a bench or box. | Break at the hips and knees. Try to go to the point where your hamstring is parallel with the ground. Or until your back knee taps the floor. | Make sure to keep your back flat and your elbows directly under your fists.

name: Dumbbell Goblet Curtsy Lunge
overview: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and a dumbbell in a goblet position. | Step your left foot behind and to the right of your right foot, crossing it behind your right leg. | Bend your knees and lower your hips down and back, as if you were about to sit in a chair. | Push through your right heel to straighten your right leg and return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Goblet Forward Lunge
overview: Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position. | Step forward with one of your legs while bending at your back leg. Bring your back knee to the floor or close to the floor. | Push through your front leg explosively to get back to your starting position.

name: Dumbbell Goblet Lateral Lunge
overview: Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine. This will help to stabilize your body. Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position. | Take a large step to the side with your right foot, planting it firmly on the ground. | As you step, bend your right knee and lower your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. Your left leg should remain straight. | Push through your right heel to return to the starting position. Repeat on the opposite side by stepping out with your left foot.

name: Dumbbell Goblet Reverse Lunge
overview: Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position. | Take a big step backwards with your left leg, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground and your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle. | Push through your right heel to return to standing, bringing your left leg back to starting position. | Repeat the movement on the other side, stepping backwards with your right leg and lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.

name: Dumbbell Goblet Split Squat
overview: Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position. | Take a large step forward with one leg, and lower your body until your back knee nearly touches the ground. Your front knee should be bent at a 90-degree angle, and your back leg should be straight. | Push through the heel of your front foot to raise your body back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Guillotine Bench Press
overview: Lie on the flat bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing forward. | Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows flared out. As you lower the dumbbells, exhale deeply. | Once your elbows reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position

name: Dumbbell Guillotine Incline Bench Press
overview: Lie on the incline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing forward. | Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows flared out. As you lower the dumbbells, exhale deeply. | Once your elbows reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position

name: Dumbbell Incline Bench Press
overview: Lay flat on the incline bench with your feet on the ground. Raise the dumbbells until you have straight arms. | Lower the dumbbells to your mid chest | Raise the dumbbells until you've locked your elbows.

name: Dumbbell Incline Chest Fly
overview: Lay on an incline bench with two dumbbells extended in front of you. | You should have a slight bend in your elbows and maintain that bend. Your shoulder joint should do all the movement. | Bring the dumbbells out to your side. Stop the dumbbells before going behind your body. | Bring the dumbbells back together at the top.

name: Dumbbell Incline Hammer Curl
overview: Hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip (thumbs facing the ceiling). Seated on an incline bench. | Slowly lift the dumbbell up to chest height | Return to starting position and repeat.

name: Dumbbell Incline Reverse Curl
overview: Lay on an incline bench. | Grab the dumbbells with a pronated (overhand) grip. You can do this exercise thumbless if it's more comfortable on your wrists. | Flex at the elbows until your biceps touch your forearms. Try not to let your elbows flair outward.

name: Dumbbell Incline Zottman Curl
overview: Lay on an incline bench with your palms facing forward. | Flex at the elbows until your forearms touch your biceps. | When you hit the top of the movement, rotate your palms and then lower the dumbbells slowly.

name: Dumbbell Internally Rotated Chest Fly
overview: Lay on a bench with two dumbbells extended in front of you in an overhand grip. | You should have a slight bend in your elbows and maintain that bend. Your shoulder joint should do all the movement. | Bring the dumbbells out to your side. Stop the dumbbells before going behind your body. | Bring the dumbbells back together at the top.

name: Dumbbell Internally Rotated Incline Chest Fly
overview: Lay on an incline bench with two dumbbells extended in front of you. | You should have a slight bend in your elbows and maintain that bend. Your shoulder joint should do all the movement. You should have an overhand grip. | Bring the dumbbells out to your side. Stop the dumbbells before going behind your body. | Bring the dumbbells back together at the top.

name: Dumbbell Lateral Lunge Reach
overview: Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine. This will help to stabilize your body. Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position. | Take a large step to the side with your right foot and reach toward the floor with your single dumbbell. | As you step, bend your right knee and lower your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. Your left leg should remain straight. | Push through your right heel to return to the starting position. Repeat on the opposite side by stepping out with your left foot.

name: Dumbbell Laying 30 Degree Shrug
overview: Lay sideways on a bench letting your arm hang freely. | Pull your shoulder blade and joint toward the ceiling.

name: Dumbbell Laying Reverse Fly
overview: With dumbbells in either hand, lay on an incline bench that's at about 15-30 degrees. | With bent elbows, raise your arms up to shoulder level, pausing at the at the end of the motion. | Slowly lower your arms back to starting position.

name: Dumbbell Laying Reverse Fly Internally Rotated
overview: With dumbbells in either hand and an overhand grip, lay on an incline bench that is roughly 15 - 30 degrees high. | With bent elbows, raise your arms up to shoulder level, pausing at the at the end of the motion. | Slowly lower your arms back to starting position.

name: Dumbbell Laying Silverback Shrug
overview: Lay on an incline bench with your arms hanging freely. | Pull your shoulder blades back toward the ceiling.

name: Dumbbell Neutral Bench Press
overview: Lie on a flat bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body. | Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body. | Once the dumbbells reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position. | This variation is much easier on the shoulder joints.

name: Dumbbell Neutral Incline Bench Press
overview: Lie on an incline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body. | Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body. | Once the dumbbells reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position. | This variation is much easier on the shoulder joints.

name: Dumbbell Neutral Seated Overhead Press
overview: Sit on an upright bench , grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body. | Slowly lower the dumbbells to your shoulder joint, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body. | Once the dumbbells reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position. | This variation is much easier on the shoulder joints.

name: Dumbbell Pullover
overview: Grab a dumbbell and hold with both hands. Point your dumbbell at the ceiling. | Flex at the shoulder joint while keeping your elbows mostly extended. | Flex until you feel a stretch in your lats then bring the dumbbell back to the ceiling.

name: Dumbbell Reverse Lunge
overview: Hold two dumbbells by your side. | Take a big step backwards with your left leg, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground and your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle. | Push through your right heel to return to standing, bringing your left leg back to starting position. | Repeat the movement on the other side, stepping backwards with your right leg and lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.

name: Dumbbell Rolling Tricep Extension
overview: Lay flat on a bench with two dumbbells pointed toward the ceiling. | Break at the elbows until your forearms touch your biceps, then flex at the shoulder joint bringing your upper arms to the sides of your head. | Bring your elbows back up until they are pointed at the ceiling, then extend your elbows.

name: Dumbbell Seated Arnold Press
overview: Begin seated on an upright bench with your palms facing you. | Begin pressing toward the ceiling. As you press, rotate your palms. | As you extend your elbows fully your palms should be facing forward.

name: Dumbbell Squeeze Press
overview: Lay flat on a bench with two dumbbells pressed to one another. | Break at the elbows and keep your elbows tucked as you bring the dumbbells to your chest. | Continue to press the dumbbells into one another throughout the rep. | Once the dumbbells reach your chest, press back toward the ceiling.

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Press
overview: Start by laying on a bench with two dumbbells. | Position the dumbbell above your chest with your elbow bent and shoulder level. | Slowly lower the dumbbell towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and your core engaged while the other dumbbell remains pointed toward the ceiling. | Once the dumbbell reaches your side, pause for a moment and then press the weight back up to the starting position. | Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching to your other arm.

name: Dumbbell Split Squat
overview: Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position. | Take a large step forward with one leg, and lower your body until your back knee nearly touches the ground. Your front knee should be bent at a 90-degree angle, and your back leg should be straight. | Push through the heel of your front foot to raise your body back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Alternating Arnold Press
overview: Start in a standing position

name: Dumbbell Alternating Overhead Press
overview: Start with two dumbbells just above your shoulders. | Press one dumbbell to the ceiling while keeping the other in place. | Let the first dumbbell return to its starting position before pressing the other dumbbell.

name: Dumbbell Alternating Pendlay Row
overview: The dumbbells should be set on the ground. Hinge forward while keeping a flat back. | Pull one elbow back toward the ceiling and then return the dumbbell to the ground softly. | Then pull with the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Arnold Press
overview: Stand with both palms facing you. | Begin to press the dumbbells to the ceiling while rotating your palms. | When you reach elbow extension, your palms should be facing forward.

name: Dumbbell Figure Four Glute Bridge
overview: Lay flat on the ground with one leg crossed over the other and your heel planted on the ground. | Push your hips toward the ceiling and hold for a second.

name: Dumbbell Figure Four Hip Thrust
overview: Put your shoulder blades on a bench and cross one leg over the other. | Start with your hips up. | Drop your hips and then push your hips up toward the ceiling.

name: Dumbbell Front Rack Pause Squat
overview: Place two dumbbells on your shoulders and make sure you force your elbows upward. | Push your hips back and break at the knees. | When you reach parallel (hamstrings parallel with the ground) pause for 1-3 seconds. Then push through your heels back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Front Rack Squat
overview: Place two dumbbells on your shoulders and push your elbows upward. | Push your hips back and break at the knees. | Hit parallel depth and then drive through your heels back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Goblet Pulse Squat
overview: Hold a dumbbell in goblet position. | Squat down to parallel depth and then halfway back up. | Stay in this short range of motion for the duration of the set.

name: Dumbbell Half Kneeling Wood Chopper
overview: Take a half kneeling position. Start with the dumbbell by your knee on the side of the kneeling leg. | Rotate at the upper spine, holding the dumbbell away from your body with nearly extended elbows.

name: Dumbbell Heels Up Goblet Squat
overview: Take a half kneeling stance. The dumbbell should start over your knee that is up. | Rotate at the spine and point the dumbbell to the opposing side.

name: Dumbbell Heels Up Narrow Goblet Squat
overview: Stand with your feet on a plate. Your feet should be very close to one another, but not touching. | Begin your squat by pushing your hips back and breaking at the knees. Try to keep your chest tall while squatting.

name: Dumbbell Hollow Hold
overview: Lay flat on the ground with a dumbbell overhead. | Pull your upper back and legs off the ground. Make a banana shape with your body. | The dumbbell should be held in your hands and your ears should be between your biceps.

name: Dumbbell Kneeling Single Arm Row
overview: Place one hand and one knee on a bench. Make sure you keep a flat back. | Pull the dumbbell toward the ceiling. | Make sure to avoid any jerking or rotating.

name: Dumbbell Kneeling Wood Chopper
overview: Start in a kneeling position with your shoulder blades pulled back. | The dumbbell should begin by one of your hips. | Rotate at the spine and bring the dumbbell from your hip, 180 degrees around your body. The dumbbell should land at eye level.

name: Dumbbell Laying Incline Row
overview: Lay on an incline bench that is between 30-45 degrees high. | Let your arms hang freely. Pull your elbows straight back toward the ceiling.

name: Dumbbell Leg Curl
overview: Lay flat on a bench with a dumbbell between your feet. | Flex your knees and raise the dumbbell until the soles of your shoes are pointed at the ceiling.

name: Dumbbell Leg Extension
overview: Place a dumbbell between your feet. Lean back slightly and hold on to the bench. | Extend your knees until you feel your quads contract hard.

name: Dumbbell Neutral Alternating Overhead Press
overview: Start with two dumbbells near your shoulders with a neutral grip. | Press one of the dumbbells toward the ceiling while keeping the other in position. | Let the first dumbbell return to its starting position before pressing the other.

name: Dumbbell Neutral Overhead Press
overview: Start with both dumbbells near your shoulders in a neutral grip. | Press the dumbbells toward the ceiling. | Make sure you don't arch your back as you fatigue.

name: Dumbbell Offset Squat
overview: Hold a dumbbell over one shoulder. | Initiate the squat by pushing your hips back. | Avoid doing any twisting. Try to keep your shoulders even.

name: Dumbbell Overhead Press
overview: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand. | Bring the dumbbells to your shoulders, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent. | From this starting position, extend your arms upwards so that the dumbbells are overhead. | Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.

name: Dumbbell Overhead Side Bend
overview: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell overhead. | From this starting position, bend to the side as far as you can while keeping your feet planted and your core engaged.

name: Dumbbell Overhead Tricep Extension
overview: Hold a dumbbell overhead. | Flex at the elbows until the dumbbell is behind your head. | Then extend your elbows until the dumbbell is back in the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Pendlay Row
overview: The dumbbells should be placed on the floor. | Hinge forward with a flat back and grab the dumbbells. | Pull both dumbbells back and your elbows toward the ceiling. | Return the dumbbells back to the floor softly on each rep.

name: Dumbbell Push Press
overview: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand. | From this starting position, dip your knees slightly and then quickly extend them as you press the dumbbells upwards. | Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement. | Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Renegade Row
overview: Start by getting into a plank position with a dumbbell in each hand. Your feet should be shoulder-width apart and your hands should be placed on the dumbbells, with your palms facing each other. | From this starting position, row one dumbbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and your core engaged. | Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position, and repeat on the other side. | Make sure to keep your body straight and your hips level throughout the movement.

name: Dumbbell Seated Calf Raise
overview: Start by sitting on a bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and a dumbbell in each hand placed on each leg. | From this starting position, raise your heels as high as you can by pushing up through your toes. | Slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position, and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Extension
overview: Start by hinging over with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand. | Bring the dumbbells to your sides, with your palms facing forward and your elbows slightly bent. | Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.

name: Dumbbell Side Plank Up Down
overview: Start by lying on your side with your feet stacked on top of each other and a dumbbell on your hip. | Place your bottom elbow on the ground beneath your shoulder and engage your core to raise your hips off the ground. | Your hips will do all the moving. Think, "hips up, hips down."

name: Dumbbell Silverback Shrug
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding dumbbells with both hands in front just past shoulder width. | Bend forward at the hips with a slight bend in your knees, keeping your back straight. | Engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together.

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Arnold Press
overview: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand. | Bring the dumbbell to your shoulder, with your palm facing you and your elbow bent. | From this starting position, extend your arm upwards so that the dumbbell is directly above your head. | As you extend your arm, rotate your palm to face away from your body.

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Neutral Overhead Press
overview: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand. | Bring the dumbbell to your shoulder, with your palm facing your body and your elbow bent. | From this starting position, press the dumbbell upwards so that it is directly above your shoulder.

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Overhead Press
overview: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand. | Bring the dumbbell to your shoulder, with your palm facing forward and your elbow bent. | From this starting position, extend your arm upwards so that the dumbbell is overhead. | Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Row
overview: Start by standing in front of a flat bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand. | Place your other hand on the bench for support, and bend at the waist so that your chest is parallel to the ground. | From this starting position, row the dumbbell up towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blade together as you do so. | Make sure to keep your elbow close to your body and your core engaged throughout the movement.

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Row Knee
overview: Start by placing your elbow on one knee. | Hold a dumbbell in your other hand, with your palm facing inwards towards your body. | From this starting position, row the dumbbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and your core engaged.

name: Dumbbell Single Leg Glute Bridge
overview: Start by lying on your back with your feet flat on the ground and a dumbbell on your hips. | Lift one leg off the ground and engage your glutes to raise your hips up towards the ceiling. | From this starting position, slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Single Leg Hip Thrust
overview: Start by lying on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and a dumbbell on your hips. | Lift one leg off the ground and engage your glutes to raise your hips up towards the ceiling. | From this starting position, slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Single Leg Single Arm Deadlift
overview: Start by standing on one leg with a dumbbell in one hand. | Slowly bend at the hips and lower the dumbbell towards the ground while extending your free leg behind you. | Keep your core engaged and your back straight as you lower the weight. | Once the dumbbell is close to the ground, push through your heel to return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Single Leg Stiff Leg Deadlift
overview: Start by standing on one leg with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding two dumbbells. | From this starting position, hinge at the hips to lower the dumbbell towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged. | Once you feel a stretch in your hamstring, slowly return to the starting position. | Make sure to keep your standing leg slightly bent and avoid rounding your back as you lower the dumbbell.

name: Dumbbell Staggered Deadlift
overview: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand. | Place one foot slightly behind the other, with the heel of your back foot elevated on a step or weight plate. | From this starting position, bend at the hips and knees to lower the dumbbells towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged. | Once the dumbbells are below your knees, drive through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Staggered Glute Bridge
overview: Start by lying on your back with your feet on the ground and a dumbbell in each hand. | Place one foot on the ground and the other slightly in front, with your knees bent. | From this starting position, raise your hips up off the ground by pushing through your heels and squeezing your glutes.

name: Dumbbell Staggered Hip thrust
overview: Start by lying on your back on a bench with your feet on the ground and a dumbbell on your hips. | Place one foot on the ground and the other slightly in front, with your knees bent. | From this starting position, raise your hips up off the ground by pushing through your heels and squeezing your glutes.

name: Dumbbell Sumo Squat
overview: Start by standing with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand. | Place the dumbbells on the ground between your feet. | From this starting position, bend your knees and lower your body down into a squat. | Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.

name: Dumbbell Swing
overview: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in both hands. | Bend your knees slightly and hinge at the hips to swing the dumbbell between your legs. | From this starting position, explosively extend your hips and swing the dumbbell up to chest height. | Allow the momentum of the swing to carry the dumbbell back down between your legs, and then repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Thruster
overview: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand. | Bring the dumbbells to your shoulders, with your palms facing inward and your elbows bent. | From this starting position, dip your knees slightly and then quickly extend them as you press the dumbbells upwards. | As you press the dumbbells upwards, also push your hips forward to help generate additional power. | Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Tricep Kickback
overview: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand. | Bend at the waist and place your opposite hand on your knee for support. | From this starting position, extend your arm backwards so that the dumbbell is behind your body. | Make sure to keep your elbow close to your body and your core engaged throughout the movement.

name: Dumbbell Hand Side Plank
overview: Start by lying on your side with your feet stacked on top of each other and a dumbbell on your hip. | Place your bottom hand on the ground beneath your shoulder and engage your core to raise your hips off the ground. | From this starting position, hold the side plank position for the desired amount of time, making sure to keep your body straight and your hips level.

name: Dumbbell Elbow Side Plank
overview: Beginner | Hold | - | Isolation

name: Lawnmower Row
overview: Stand with feet staggered and one hand on a bench/box. Hold a dumbbell in the opposing hand. | Hinge forward at the hips, keeping the back flat,  and eyes facing forward. The weight should hang directly below the shoulders. | Start with an overhand grip, as you pull rotate the dumbbell. When your upper arm reaches your side your palm should be facing forward.

name: Dumbbell Crunch
overview: Start by lying flat on your back with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent. | Hold a dumbbell over your clavicle. | Engage your core muscles and lift your torso off the floor until your shoulders are a few inches off the ground. | Lower yourself back down to the starting position, but avoid resting completely on the floor between reps.

name: Dumbbell Elevated Pushup
overview: Start by placing two dumbbells on the floor, about shoulder-width apart. | Position yourself in a plank position with your hands on top of the dumbbells, keeping your arms straight. | Keep your feet together, with your toes resting on the floor. | Engage your core and lower your body towards the floor by bending your arms, until your chest nearly touches the dumbbells. | Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms and engaging your chest, triceps and shoulders.

name: Dumbbell Feet Elevated Figure Four Glute Bridge
overview: Start by lying flat on your back with your feet resting on top of a box, the dumbbell placed over your hips, and cross one leg over the other. | Push through your heels and raise your hips towards the ceiling, keeping your feet flat on the box. | Engage your glutes at the top of the movement, pause briefly and then lower your hips back down to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Feet Elevated Glute Bridge
overview: Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet on top of a sturdy box, bench or elevated surface. Place a dumbbell over your hips. | Drive through your heels to lift your hips off the floor, making sure to keep your feet and knees pointing forward.

name: Dumbbell Feet Elevated Single Leg Glute Bridge
overview: Start by lying flat on your back with your feet resting on top of a box, the dumbbell placed over your hips. Raise one leg up and off the box. | Push through your heels and raise your hips towards the ceiling, keeping your feet flat on the box. | Engage your glutes at the top of the movement, pause briefly and then lower your hips back down to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Feet Elevated Staggered Glute Bridge
overview: Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet in a staggered position on the box. | Drive through your heels to lift your hips off the floor, making sure to keep your feet and knees pointing forward.

name: Dumbbell Knee Lawnmower Row
overview: Stand with feet staggered and one hand on your knee. Hold a dumbbell in the opposing hand. | Hinge forward at the hips, keeping the back flat, and eyes facing forward. The weight should hang directly below the shoulders. | Start with an overhand grip, as you pull rotate the dumbbell. When your upper arm reaches your side your palm should be facing forward.

name: Laying Lateral Raise
overview: Lay on your side on a bench or box. Place one hand on the floor and the other hand is holding the dumbbell. | While keeping your elbow mostly extended, raise the dumbbell to the side. | The end of the range of motion is when the dumbbell is pointed toward the ceiling. | Make sure you don't flex and extend your elbow.

name: Dumbbell Long Lever Russian Twist
overview: Start by sitting on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Hold a dumbbell in both hands with your arms extended straight in front of you. | Twist your torso to the right, bringing the dumbbell towards the ground, then return to the center. Repeat on the left side, twisting to the left and bringing the dumbbell towards the ground. | Continue this twisting motion, alternating sides, for the desired number of repetitions. Keep your core engaged and avoid swinging your arms to generate momentum.

name: Dumbbell Overhead Squat
overview: Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and hold two dumbbells overhead with both hands, using an overhand grip. | Begin the squat by bending at the hips and knees, keeping your core tight and the dumbbells balanced overhead. | Lower your body as far as you can while keeping the dumbbells overhead, then push back up to the starting position. | Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, making sure to keep your back straight, chest lifted, and the dumbbells stable overhead throughout the entire movement.

name: Plank IYTW
overview: Start in a plank position. Hold one dumbbell. | Raise the dumbbell straight out in front of you (I), at a 45 degree angle (Y), out to the side (T), and then bend at the elbow while raising (W). | Going through IYTW counts as one rep. | Make sure to keep your hips stable. If you're unable to, try performing this exercise from the knees.

name: Pushup to Renegade Row
overview: Start in a high plank position with a pair of dumbbells positioned under your shoulders. Your hands should grip the dumbbells, palms facing each other. | Keep your core engaged and your back straight as you row one dumbbell up towards your hip, keeping your elbow close to your body. | Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

name: Dumbbell Side Bend
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart and place your right hand on the right hip. | Hold a dumbbell with the left hand. Bend at the hips to the side. | Make sure you don't start to lean forward to try and force a longer range of motion.

name: Single Arm Overhead Squat
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a dumbbell in your right hand, extending it overhead. | Inhale and begin to squat down, keeping the dumbbell overhead and your back straight. | Go down as far as you can while still maintaining control, then exhale and return to standing position, keeping the dumbbell overhead. Repeat for desired reps and then switch to the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Overhead Tricep Extension
overview: Stand tall with a single dumbbell extended overhead. | Flex at the elbow letting the dumbbell travel behind your body. | Try not to let your elbow flare outward.

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Upright Row
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand with an overhand grip. | Keep your back straight and chest lifted, engage your core to maintain balance. | Begin the movement by lifting the dumbbell straight up towards your chin, keeping your elbow close to your body and the weight in line with your shoulder. | Continue to lift the weight until it reaches the chin or neck level, keeping the elbow high and close to the body. | Lower the weight back down to the starting position with control.

name: Dumbbell Upright Row
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding 2 dumbbells in each hand. | Keep your back straight and chest lifted, engage your core to maintain balance. | Begin the movement by lifting the dumbbells straight up towards your chin, keeping your elbow close to your body and the weight in line with your shoulder. | Continue to lift the weight until it reaches the chin or neck level, keeping the elbow high and close to the body.

name: Dumbbell Standing Hip Abduction
overview: Stand with a dumbbell held on the side of your leg. | Raise that leg laterally as high as your hip range of motion allows for.

name: Dumbbell Suitcase Crunch
overview: Lay flat on the ground with a dumbbell. Point the soles of your shoes at the ceiling as well as the dumbbell. | Reach for your feet with the dumbbell before bringing your spine back to the floor.

name: Dumbbell Superman
overview: Lay flat on the ground on your stomach with your arms extended overhead. Hold a dumbbell with a neutral grip. | Lift your legs and chest off the ground simultaneously and hold for a 1 count at the top. | Relax your lower back and lower your legs and chest back to the floor.

name: Dumbbell Supinated Row
overview: Grab both dumbbells and hinge forward at the hips. Make sure you keep a flat back. | The closer your torso is to parallel with the ground the longer the range of motion will be at your shoulder. The better the results you'll get from the exercise. | Let your arms hang freely, maintain an underhand grip, and then pull your elbow joint straight back toward the ceiling.

name: Dumbbell Tate Press
overview: Lay flat on a bench with two dumbbells extended toward the ceiling. | Maintain an overhand grip. Flex at the elbows. | The dumbbells will land on your upper chest/clavicle. | Extend your elbows bringing the dumbbells back into their starting position. | *Named after Dave Tate*

name: Dumbbell Seated Tibialis Raise
overview: Sit on a box or bench, place your heels on a step or plate, and place dumbbells on your quads. | Raise your toes straight toward the ceiling.

name: Dumbbell Superman Hold
overview: Lie face down on a mat. | Hold dumbbells out in front | Lift arms and legs simultaneously, squeezing lower back.

name: Internally Rotated Seated Rear Delt Fly
overview: Sit with your chest in your lap, dumbbells in hands, arms bent, internally rotate shoulders. | Raise dumbbells out to sides, squeeze rear delts. | Lower weights, repeat for reps.

name: Seated Lateral Raise
overview: Sit upright on bench or box. | Hold dumbbells at sides | Lift arms to shoulder height.

name: Dumbbell Standing Tibialis Raise
overview: Place your heels on a step or plate, and hold dumbbells to your side. | Raise your toes straight toward the ceiling. | Hold at the top for extra benefit. Slowly return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Bench Wrist Curl
overview: Grip the dumbbell with your palm facing upwards with your forearm rested against the bench. | Slowly curl your wrist upwards in a semicircular motion. | Return to starting position and repeat.

name: Dumbbell Bench Wrist Extension
overview: Grab two dumbbells with an overhand grip and lay your forearms across a bench. | Let your wrists flex fully, then extend your wrists.

name: Dumbbell Bent Arm Lateral Raise
overview: Stand tall with a 90 degree bend at your elbows. | Lateral raise your arms straight out to the side until your arms are about parallel with the ground.

name: Dumbbell Cross Body Romanian Deadlift
overview: Stand with a shoulder width stance holding one dumbbell. Push your butt back while leaving your knees MOSTLY extended. | Reach toward the opposing leg. You should feel a stretch in your hamstrings. When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward to complete the rep. | Do not push your hips all the way forward. This will hyperextend your spine. Just go to a normal standing position.

name: Dumbbell High Incline Bench Press
overview: Position the bench between 45 and 60 degrees. | Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. | Lower the bar to your mid chest | Raise the dumbbells (slowly and controlled) until you've locked your elbows.

name: Dumbbell Incline Skullover
overview: Lay flat on an incline bench with two dumbbells pointed toward the ceiling. | Break at the elbows until your forearms touch your biceps, then flex at the shoulder joint bringing your upper arms to the sides of your head. | Bring your elbows back up until they are pointed at the ceiling, then extend your elbows.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder External Rotation
overview: Sit on a bench with one foot on the bench. | Place the elbow on the inside of your elbow and use it for leverage. | Point your fist toward the wall andthen toward the ceiling. Rotating a total of 90 degrees.

name: Dumbbell Standing Bayesian Lateral Raise
overview: Stand tall on lean slightly forward. | Lateral raise your arms straight out to the side until your arms are about parallel with the ground.

name: Dumbbell Figure Four Heels Elevated Hip Thrust
overview: Start by lying flat on your back with your feet resting on top of a box, the barbell placed over your hips, and cross one leg over the other. | Push through your heels and raise your hips towards the ceiling, keeping your feet flat on the box. | Engage your glutes at the top of the movement, pause briefly and then lower your hips back down to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Heels Elevated Hip Thrust
overview: Sit on the ground with a bench behind you. Place both feet on a plate or low box. Have the dumbbell over your legs just above your hips. | Lean back against the bench so that your shoulders are resting upon it, stretch your arms out to either side using the bench as support. | Raise the weight by driving through your feet and extending your hips upwards. Support the weight with your shoulders and feet. | Slowly extend as far as you can, and then slowly return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Single Leg Heels Elevated Hip Thrust
overview: Start by lying on a bench with your foot on a plate or low box and a dumbbell on your hips. | Lift one leg off the ground and engage your glutes to raise your hips up towards the ceiling. | From this starting position, slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Floor Press
overview: Bring your elbows to the floor, rest for a second to remove all the momentum from the rep, then press to a lockout.

name: Dumbbell Seated Rear Delt Row
overview: Sit on a bench. Put your chest in your lap. Try to get your torso as close to parallel with the ground as your mobility will allow for. | Let your arms hang in front of you. Pull your elbows back towards the ceiling while flaring your elbows outward.

name: Dumbbell Internally Rotated Rear Delt Fly
overview: Sit with hinged over position, dumbbells in hands, arms slightly bent, internally rotate shoulders. | Raise dumbbells out to sides, squeeze rear delts. | Lower weights, repeat for reps.

name: Dumbbell Goblet Side Step Up
overview: Begin by standing beside a sturdy box or bench that is about knee-height, holding a dumbbell with a goblet grip. | Place your right foot on the box and push through the heel to lift your body up and onto the box. | Step back down with your right foot.

name: Dumbbell Side Step Up
overview: Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart, with a dumbbell in your hands. Your feet should be slightly pointed outward, and your shoulders should be down and relaxed. | Place a step or box beside you, and step up onto it with one foot. Your other foot should remain on the ground. | Push off your grounded foot, raising your body up onto the step. | Step back down with the same foot, returning to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Goblet Step Up
overview: Begin by standing in front of a sturdy box or bench that is about knee-height, holding a dumbbell with a goblet grip. | Place your right foot on the box and push through the heel to lift your body up and onto the box. | Step back down with your right foot.

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Front Rack Step Up
overview: Stand in front of a step or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold one dumbbell on your shoulder with an overhand grip. | Step up onto the bench with your right foot, pushing off your foot to raise your body up onto the bench. | Bring your left foot up onto the bench and stand up straight, keeping the barbell at your shoulders. | Step back down with your left foot, followed by your right foot, to return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Front Rack Step Up
overview: Stand in front of a step or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold two dumbbells at your shoulders with an overhand grip. | Step up onto the bench with your right foot, pushing off your foot to raise your body up onto the bench. | Bring your left foot up onto the bench and stand up straight, keeping the barbell at your shoulders. | Step back down with your left foot, followed by your right foot, to return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Step Up
overview: Stand in front of a step or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold one dumbbell on your side with a neutral grip. | Step up onto the bench with your right foot, pushing off your foot to raise your body up onto the bench. | Bring your left foot up onto the bench and stand up straight, keeping the barbell at your shoulders. | Step back down with your left foot, followed by your right foot, to return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Step Up
overview: Stand in front of a step or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold two dumbbells on your side with a neutral grip. | Step up onto the bench with your right foot, pushing off your foot to raise your body up onto the bench. | Bring your left foot up onto the bench and stand up straight, keeping the barbell at your shoulders. | Step back down with your left foot, followed by your right foot, to return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Bench Wrist Curl
overview: Drape one arm over a bench while holding a dumbbell. Point your palm toward the ceiling. | Extend and curl your wrist against resistance.

name: Dumbbell Wrist Supinations Pronations
overview: Sit by a bench or table and lean your arm on it. | Hold a dumbbell/weight/lever on one end. | Rotate the wrist so the palm faces down and up in succession.

name: Dumbbell Box Squat
overview: Stand in front of a box or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart with a dumbbell in a goblet position. | Lower your body into a squat position, sitting back onto the box and pausing for a moment before standing back up. | Push through your heels to return to the standing position.

name: Dumbbell Kickstand Squat
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart, one foot slightly behind. Hold dumbbell in a goblet position. | Lower into a squat, keeping weight on front heel. | Return to standing, engaging glutes and core.

name: Dumbbell Swing Lunge
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder-width. Dumbbells at your side. | Step forward with your right foot and bend both knees to lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. | Push off your right foot to return to the starting position. | Step back with the same leg until the back knee taps the floor.

name: Dumbbell Goblet Alternating Curtsy Lunge
overview: Hold a dumbbell at your chest, feet hip-width apart. | Step one leg diagonally back into a lunge. | Alternate legs, keeping your chest up and core engaged.

name: Dumbbell Alternating Lateral Lunge
overview: Hold one dumbbell with one or both hands, feet hip-width apart. | Step out to one side, bending the knee. | Push off, return to center, then switch sides.

name: Dumbbell Alternating Reverse Lunge
overview: Hold two dumbbells by your side. | Take a big step backwards with your left leg, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground and your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle. | Push back up and switch legs, alternating each rep.

name: Dumbbell Alternating Forward Lunge
overview: Stand tall, holding dumbbells by your sides, feet hip-width apart. | Step forward with one leg, lowering until both knees form 90° angles. | Push through front foot, return to start, and switch legs.

name: Dumbbell Assisted Bulgarian Split Squat
overview: Grab a stick of some sort or hold onto something stable (rack, bench). | Grab a box that is knee height or slightly lower. | Hold the stick in your right arm, dumbbell in the other and put your right leg on the box. | Begin your squat by breaking at the knees. Get your knee close to the floor or all the way to the floor. Make sure to keep your chest tall.

name: Dumbbell Weighted Pull Ups
overview: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended. | Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar. | Lower your body back to starting position.

name: Dumbbell Weighted Chin Ups
overview: Grab the bar shoulder width apart with a supinated grip (palms facing you). Use a dip belt and the let the weight hang between your legs. | With your body hanging and arms fully extended, pull yourself up until your chin is past the bar. | Slowly return to starting position. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Weighted Dip
overview: Use a dip belt to attach a dumbbell to yourself. Grip bars with arms straight, shoulders above hands. Keep legs straight or bent. | Lower slowly until elbows are at 90 degrees. | Push back up to start position, extending arms fully.

name: Dumbbell Internal Rotation
overview: Lay flat on the ground with your elbow on the floor and dumbbell pointed toward the ceiling. | Lower the dumbbell until your knuckles get close to the ground. Then back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell External Rotation
overview: Hold a dumbbell in one hand,  elbow bent at 90 degrees while resting on your inner thigh/ knee. | Rotate your arm outward, keeping your elbow stable.

name: Dumbbell Half Kneeling Single Arm Overhead Press
overview: Take a half kneeling position while holding one dumbbell. | Drive the dumbbell upwards.

name: Dumbbell Half Kneeling Overhead Press
overview: Take a half kneeling position while holding two dumbbells. | Drive the dumbbells upwards.

name: Dumbbell Reverse Grip Bench Press
overview: Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. With straight arms unrack the bar with a reverse grip. | Lower the dumbbells to your lower chest. | Raise the bar until you've locked your elbows.

name: Dumbbell Head On Bench Rear Delt Fly
overview: With dumbbells in either hand, bend your knees with your feet slightly bowed out. Arch your back above your knees, place your head on the top of an incline bench, and start with the weights touching in front of your chest. | With bent elbows, raise your arms up to shoulder level, pausing at the at the end of the motion. | Slowly lower your arms back to starting position.

name: Dumbbell Incline Front Raise
overview: Grab two dumbbells while sitting on an incline bench upright with the dumbbells at your side. | Raise the two dumbbells with your elbows being fully extended until the dumbbells are eye level. | Lower the weights in a controlled manner to the starting position and repeat.

name: Dumbbell Seated Single Arm Arnold Press
overview: Start by sitting on an incline bench and holding a dumbbell in one hand. | Bring the dumbbell to your shoulder, with your palm facing you and your elbow bent. | From this starting position, extend your arm upwards so that the dumbbell is directly above your head. | As you extend your arm, rotate your palm to face away from your body.

name: Dumbbell Seated Y Press
overview: Sit on an upright bench , grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body. | Press the dumbbells outward into a y shape.

name: Dumbbell Alternating Rear Delt Fly
overview: With dumbbells in either hand, bend your knees with your feet slightly bowed out. Arch your back above your knees, and start with the weights touching in front of your chest. | With bent elbows, raise your arms up to shoulder level, pausing at the at the end of the motion. | Slowly lower your arms back to starting position.

name: Dumbbell Farmer Walk
overview: Grab a dumbbell in each hand, arms straight down. | Walk forward with a straight posture.

name: Dumbbell Y Press
overview: Stand tall, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body. | Press the dumbbells outward into a y shape.

name: Dumbbell Cuban Press
overview: Perform an upright row until elbows are bent at 90 degrees and arms parallel to the ground. | Rotate your shoulders, raising the dumbbells overhead. Then press overhead.

name: Dumbbell Six Way Lateral Raise
overview: Perform a front raise, then bring dumbbells out to your side, then raise the dumbbells over head.

name: Dumbbell Full Lateral Raise
overview: Stand up straight with dumbbells at either side, palms facing your hips. | Raise your arms on either side with a slight bend in your elbow until they are over head. Pause at the top of the motion. | Slowly return your arms down to starting position.

name: Dumbbell Full Front Raise
overview: Stand tall with an overhand grip on the dumbbell. Raise your arms until your fists are pointed toward the ceiling. | Return to the start under control. This exercise is prone to using momentum when you begin to fatigue.

name: Dumbbell Front Rack Deficit Reverse Lunge
overview: Stand on a platform, dumbbells in front rack position, feet hip-width apart. | Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged. | Push through front foot, return to start

name: Dumbbell Goblet Deficit Reverse Lunge
overview: Stand on a platform, dumbbell in a goblet position, feet hip-width apart. | Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged. | Push through front foot, return to start.

name: Dumbbell Deficit Reverse Lunge
overview: Stand on a platform, dumbbells in both hands, feet hip-width apart. | Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged. | Push through front foot, return to start, keeping bar stable throughout.

name: Dumbbell Laying Incline Lateral Raise
overview: Lay on your side on an incline bench. Brace yourself by holding onto the bench. | While keeping your elbow mostly extended, raise the dumbbell to the side. | The end of the range of motion is when the dumbbell is pointed toward the ceiling. | Make sure you don't flex and extend your elbow.

name: Dumbbell Staggered Waiters Bow
overview: Set up a bar at mid way up your quad. Place the working leg against the bar. | Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time. | Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring. | When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.

name: Dumbbell Waiters Bow
overview: Place a barbell at about midway up your thigh. Press your quads into the barbell. | Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. | When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

name: Dumbbell Tricep Guillotine Press
overview: Lay flat on a bench. | Push your elbows forward until your biceps touch your forearms. Then extend your elbows until back at the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Bench Braced Single Arm Overhead Tricep Extension
overview: Lay sideways on an incline bench and press the elbow of the working arm into the bench. | Use your free arm to pull your upper body into the bench. | Break at the elbow until your elbow is fully flexed, then extend your elbow until the dumbbell is pointed at the ceiling.

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Bench Braced Reverse Incline Curl
overview: Lay off the side of a bench and place the back off your arms on the edge of your bench. Keep your hips lowered toward the floor. | Take an overhand grip. Fully extend your elbows and then flex the elbows.

name: Dumbbell Bench Braced Reverse Incline Curl
overview: Lay off the side of a bench and place the back off your arms on the edge of your bench. Keep your hips lowered toward the floor. | Take an overhand grip. Fully extend your elbows and then flex the elbows. | Lay off the side of a bench and place the back off your arms on the edge of your bench. Keep your hips lowered toward the floor. | Take an overhand grip. Fully extend your elbows and then flex the elbows.

name: Dumbbell Quad Stomp
overview: Place your front foot on a low box and take a split stance. Put all of your weight on your front foot. | Break at the knees and lower yourself until your calves touch your hamstrings. | Push yourself back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Single Leg Calf Raise
overview: Standing straight with a dumbbell in one hand, lift the same foot as the side without the dumbbell off the floor. Hold onto something for balance. | Raise your heel upwards while keeping your knees stationary. | Pause when your heels are fully extended and then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Dumbbell Curtsy Deficit Lunge
overview: Stand on a platform, dumbbells in both hands, feet hip-width apart. | Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged. | Push through front foot, return to start, keeping bar stable throughout.

name: Dumbbell Front Rack Curtsy Deficit Lunge
overview: Stand on a platform, dumbbells in front rack, feet hip-width apart. | Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged. | Push through front foot, return to start, keeping bar stable throughout.

name: Dumbbell Goblet Curtsy Deficit Lunge
overview: Stand on a platform, dumbbell in goblet squat position, feet hip-width apart. | Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged. | Push through front foot, return to start, keeping bar stable throughout. | Stand on a platform, dumbbell in goblet squat position, feet hip-width apart. | Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged. | Push through front foot, return to start, keeping bar stable throughout.

name: Stability Ball Goblet Wall Squat
overview: Place a stability ball against a wall at about hip height. | Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position. | Break at the hips and knees until you hit parallel or just below, then squat back up.

name: Dumbbell Stability Ball Wall Squat
overview: Place a stability ball against a wall at about hip height. | Hold two dumbbells in each hand. | Break at the hips and knees until you hit parallel or just below, then squat back up.

name: Dumbbell Front Rack Stability Ball Wall Squat
overview: Place a stability ball against a wall at about hip height. | Hold two dumbbells in front rack position. | Break at the hips and knees until you hit parallel or just below, then squat back up.

name: Dumbbell Half Kneeling Romanian Deadlift
overview: Place one knee on a bench and hold a dumbbell. | Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. | When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

name: Dumbbell Half Kneeling Goblet Romanian Deadlift
overview: Place one knee on a bench and hold a dumbbell in a goblet position. | Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. | When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

name: Box Dips
overview: Hold your body with arms locked above the equipment | Lower your body slowly while leaning forward, flare out your elbows | Raise your body above the bars until your arms are locked.

name: Bench Dips
overview: Grip the edge of the bench with your hands, Keep your feet together and legs straight. | Lower your body straight down. | Slowly press back up to the starting point. | TIP: Make this harder by raising your feet off the floor and adding weight.

name: Pull Ups
overview: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended. | Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar. | Lower your body back to starting position.
instructions: Setup | Grab the Pull Up bar with an overhand grip. If you get wrist pain from gripping a Pull Up bar, try using a thumbless grip. It won't affect your grip strength too much, but will give your wrists a little more room to move. Also, make sure the bars are set very deeply in your hand. Your palms should be making contact with the bar. | Next, if you are using a bench or box to reach the Pull Up bars, step off of the step, and hold for a second, in a dead hang position. If you begin initiating the Pull Up before the dead hang, you might swing too much to perform a proper strict Pull Up. If you can reach the Pull Up bars without having to stand on anything, take your grip and then pull your feet slightly off the floor. Still hold for a second to prevent any swinging from happening. | Pull your shoulder blades down. This will engage your mid and lower traps and force your lats to do most of the work. Also, before beginning the first rep, make sure your elbows are extended. | Lower body | Angle your legs forward slightly, push your hips back, and point your toes. This will force you to flex your abdominals and keep you more stable throughout the rep. (This will massively help you keep the reps strict). | Performing | Once you are in the proper position, begin to pull. Imagine trying to pull your elbows not just down, but inward toward your spine. This cue will help you engage one of the lats’ more overlooked functions, vertical adduction. | Get your chin over the bar before beginning the eccentric portion of the rap. Your elbows should fully extend at the bottom of each rep. | Step by Step Progression | Decide on a rep range. For example, 6 to 10. Once you are able to perform 10 reps with strict form, then it is time to progress. Do not be shy or hesitant to start adding weight to your Pull Up early on. Even if it is only 5 pounds. Progress is progress! From there, progress the Pull Up, like it would any other exercise. Once you hit the top end of the rep range, add some more weight. | The best way to get better at doing Pull Ups is to do Pull Ups. But if you can't do them in the first place, then what should you do?

name: Glute Bridge
overview: Lie down with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor. | Push your hips up so that your butt is elevated and your back straight. | Tense your glutes and raise your hips towards the ceiling. | Once you are at the highest point you can manage, hold the position for a few seconds, and then slowly return to the starting position

name: Crunches
overview: Lay flat on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground, about a foot from your lower back. | Place your fingertips on your temples with your palms facing out. | Draw your belly into the base of your spine to engage the muscles, then raise your head and shoulders off the floor. Return to starting position and repeat.

name: Laying Leg Raises
overview: Lay on your back with your arms palms down on either side. | Keep your legs together and as straight as possible. | Slowly raise your legs to a 90° angle, pause at this position, or as high as you can reach your legs, and then slowly lower your legs back down. | Duration of these movements should be slow so that you do not utilize momentum, enabling you to get the most out of the exercise.

name: Bulgarian Split Squat
overview: Stand with your back to a bench (or raised surface) and place one of your feet on the bench. | Squat down until your front leg is about parallel to the floor. | Go back to the starting position. After completing the desired amount of reps, switch legs and repeat.

name: Single Leg Glute Bridge
overview: Tense your glutes and raise your hips towards the ceiling. | Once you are at the highest point you can manage, hold the position for a few seconds, and then slowly return to the starting position. | Push your hips up, so that your butt is elevated and your back straight. | Lie down with one knee bent and and one with a slight bend.

name: Push Up
overview: Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders. | Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body | Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body | Exhale as you push back to the starting position.

name: Inverted Row
overview: Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip. | Pull your body straight up to the bar. | Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.

name: Chin Ups
overview: Grab the bar shoulder width apart with a supinated grip (palms facing you) | With your body hanging and arms fully extended, pull yourself up until your chin is past the bar. | Slowly return to starting position. Repeat.

name: Incline Push Up
overview: Stand facing bench or sturdy elevated platform. | Place hands on edge of bench or platform, slightly wider than shoulder width. | Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the bench. | Push body up until arms are extended.

name: Decline Push Up
overview: Use a bench to elevate your feet. | Put your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width. | Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the ground | Raise your body until you almost lock your elbows.

name: Elevated Pike Shoulder Shrug
overview: Use a bench or an object like a chair to elevate your feet. | Slowly lower your body (scapula) while keeping your elbows locked (this is key) | Slowly raise your body back to the start position.

name: Side Lunges
overview: Take a slow, lateral step to the right. | Extend the left knee, and drive your weight into your right side. | Flex your knee and lower your body. | Push back to the starting position.

name: Forward Lunges
overview: Step forward with one leg. | Lower your body until your rear knee nearly touches the ground. | Ensure you remain upright, and your front knee stay above the front foot. | Push off the floor with your front foot until you return to the starting position. Switch legs.

name: Jump Squats
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. | Start by doing a regular squat, then engage your core and jump up explosively. | When you land, lower your body back into the squat position.

name: Bodyweight Squat
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. | flex your knees and hips and sit back into the squat while lowering your body | Continue down to full depth | Return to starting position.

name: Diamond Push Ups
overview: Position your index fingers and thumbs so they are touching, forming a diamond shape | Use a standard push up position | Lower your chest towards your hands, keep your elbows close to your body | Stop just before your chest touches the floor, then push back up to the starting position.

name: Good Mornings
overview: Stand with your feet a little past shoulder width apart with a slight bend at your knee. Place your hands behind the back of your head. | Keeping your back straight, rotate your hips to bring your shoulders down towards the floor. Stop when your chest is parallel with the floor.

name: Supermans
overview: Lie face down on the floor with your arms fully extended in front of you. | Simultaneously raise your arms, legs and chest off of the floor and hold the position. | Slowly lower your arms, legs and chest back to the starting position. Repeat.

name: Kickbacks
overview: Get down on all fours and position your hands under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. | Kick back with one leg and squeeze your glutes. | Slowly return to starting position by bending your knee and lowering your leg. | Switch Legs. Repeat.

name: Single Legged Romanian Deadlifts
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent and raise one leg. | Without changing the bend in your knee, bend at your hips, and lower your torso until it's almost parallel to the floor. | Tense your glutes and then bring yourself back to the starting position.

name: Elevated Pike Press
overview: Use a bench or an object to elevate your feet. | Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows | Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position. | Repeat

name: Tip Toe Walking
overview: Point your toes into the floor. | Slowly walk forwards and backward | Keep your heels in the air as long as possible while walking. | It may be beneficial to do this last at the end of your workout.

name: Calf Raises
overview: Balance on the balls of your feet on the platform or plates, leaning forward to use the wall to assist with balance. | Lower the heels of your feet towards the ground and pause, then push through the balls of your feet like you are standing tip toe, pausing at the apex of the motion. | Repeat as necessary.
tips: ©2025 MuscleWiki SEZC Some rights reserved. | ©2025 MuscleWiki SEZC Some rights reserved.. | ©2025 MuscleWiki SEZC Some rights reserved.

name: Forearm Plank
overview: Place forearms on the ground with your elbows bent at a 90° angle aligned beneath your shoulders, with your arms parallel at shoulder-width. | Your feet should be together, with only your toes touching the floor. | Lift your belly off the floor and form a straight line from your heels to the crown of your head and hold.

name: Hanging Knee Raises
overview: Grab the bar and hang, your body still and your legs straight. | Slowly draw your knees up to your chest | Once you have raised your knees as high as possible, lower your legs and repeat. Duration of these movements should be slow so that you do not utilize momentum, enabling you to get the most out of the exercise. | Duration of these movements should be slow so that you do not utilize momentum, enabling you to get the most out of the exercise.

name: Walking Calf Raises
overview: Walk forward and push your toe into the ground | Lift you heel off the ground each step and tense your calf muscle | Repeat on each leg and walk forward slowly

name: Nordic Hamstring Curl
overview: Go to your knees and ask someone to hold your ankles. | Put your hands in front of you | With a slight bend in your knees slowly bring your body to the ground (slower is better) | Push up and reset to the starting position.

name: Bodyweight Russian Twist
overview: Hover your heels just off the ground. | Stick your chest out and maintain a flat back. Make all the movement happen at your mid and upper spine. | Point your chest to the left, then rotate at the spine until your chest is pointed right.

name: Side Plank Up Down
overview: Start with your elbow and hip on the ground. Either neutral fist or flat hand on the ground. | Begin in a side plank position, and then drop your hips to the floor. | Pull your hips back to the ceiling to finish the rep.

name: Side Plank Reach Through
overview: Begin in an elbow side plank position. | Reach for the ceiling with your off hand. | Rotate at the mid and upper spine and reach through the open space between the floor and your torso. | Reach backwards, and then rotate back into the starting position.

name: Long Lever Plank
overview: Start in a hand plank position and walk your hands further out until your ears are between your biceps. | Hold in this position for the allotted amount of time. | Make sure you keep a flat back for the whole set.

name: Elbow Side Plank
overview: Press your elbow into the floor. | Pick your hips up off the ground and maintain this position for the allotted amount of time. | Make sure you don't let your chest fall forward or backward.

name: Hand Side Plank
overview: Press your hand into the ground and pick up your hip off the ground. | Open your chest and maintain this position for the allotted amount of time.

name: Hand Plank
overview: Start in a kneeling position with your hands planted on the ground. | Pick your knees up off the ground. Hold in this position with a flat back.

name: Hollow Hold
overview: Lay flat on the ground with your arms extended over head. | Pick your upper back and your legs off the ground. Your body should be in a banana shape. | Hold in this position.

name: Bodyweight Reverse Step Up
overview: Start with a box or bench behind you and one of your feet on the box/bench. | The balls of your feet should be planted on the box/bench. | Drive through the ball of your foot extending your knees until you're upright and standing on the box.

name: Assisted Bulgarian Split Squat
overview: Grab a stick of some sort or hold onto something stable (rack, bench). | Grab a box that is knee height or slightly lower. | Hold the stick in your right arm and put your right leg on the box. | Begin your squat by breaking at the knees. Get your knee close to the floor or all the way to the floor. Make sure to keep your chest tall.

name: Curtsy Lunge
overview: Step your left foot diagonally behind your right leg, crossing it behind your body. Bend your knees and lower your hips until your left thigh is parallel to the floor and your right knee is hovering just above the ground. | Push through your right foot to straighten your legs and return to the starting position. | Repeat the movement with your other leg.

name: Forward Lunge
overview: Step forward with one leg and lower your body until your front thigh is parallel to the floor and your back knee almost touches the ground. Keep your chest up and your front foot flat on the floor. | Push through your front foot to straighten your legs and return to the starting position. | Repeat the movement with your other leg.

name: Heels Up Squat
overview: Place your heels on a plate or very low step. | Keep your chest tall and initiate the squat by pushing your hips back and breaking at the knees. | You should notice yourself able to squat lower than normal.

name: Lateral Lunge
overview: Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine. This will help to stabilize your body. | Take a large step to the side with your right foot, planting it firmly on the ground. | As you step, bend your right knee and lower your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. Your left leg should remain straight. | Push through your right heel to return to the starting position. Repeat on the opposite side by stepping out with your left foot.

name: Bodyweight Reverse Lunge
overview: Take a big step backwards with your left leg, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground and your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle. | Push through your right heel to return to standing, bringing your left leg back to starting position. | Repeat the movement on the other side, stepping backwards with your right leg and lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.

name: Split Squat
overview: Take a split stance. Make sure to keep your chest tall. | Bring your rear knee to the floor or close to it. | Drive through your front heel and your rear foot back to the starting position.

name: Mountain Climber
overview: To perform a bodyweight mountain climber, start in a plank position with your hands placed directly under your shoulders. | Bring your right knee towards your chest, keeping your foot close to your hand. Quickly switch legs, bringing your left knee towards your chest. | Continue this movement, alternating legs, at a quick pace for a set amount of time or repetitions.

name: Burpee
overview: Start standing with your feet hip-width apart. Lower your body into a squat position, placing your hands on the ground in front of you. | Quickly jump your feet back into a plank position, keeping your body in a straight line from your head to your toes. | Perform a push-up, keeping your core tight and your elbows close to your body. | Jump your feet back towards your hands, and then jump up into the air, reaching your arms overhead. | Land softly and immediately lower your body back into the squat position to repeat the movement.

name: Bodyweight Feet Elevated Figure Four Glute Bridge
overview: Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet on top of a sturdy box, bench or elevated surface. | Drive through your heels to lift your hips off the floor, making sure to keep your feet and knees pointing forward.

name: Bodyweight Feet Elevated Glute Bridge
overview: Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet on top of a sturdy box, bench or elevated surface. | Drive through your heels to lift your hips off the floor, making sure to keep your feet and knees pointing forward.

name: Bodyweight Feet Elevated Single Leg Glute Bridge
overview: Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet on top of a sturdy box, bench or elevated surface. Lift one leg off the box. | Drive through your heel to lift your hips off the floor, making sure to keep your feet and knees pointing forward.

name: Bodyweight Feet Elevated Staggered Glute Bridge
overview: Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet in a staggered position on the box. | Drive through your heels to lift your hips off the floor, making sure to keep your feet and knees pointing forward.

name: Box Jump
overview: Stand in front of a box. | *Start with a low box if this is your first time* | Sink into a quarter of half squat and then pop your hips forward. | Try to land in the middle of the box as softly as possible to minimise impact on your joints.

name: Depth Jump
overview: Stand on top of a box. Step off of the box and land on the floor. | Land as softly as possible. Squat as you land to minimise impact on your joints. | Go straight into another hop after you've landed. This will help you learn to absorb impact.

name: Seated Box Jump
overview: Setup two boxes. One to jump on and one to sit. | Go from a seated position and pop your hips forward forcefully. | Jump and land on the box softly.

name: Single Leg Box Jump
