overview: Stand with a shoulder width stance. | Jump onto your box and land with one foot. | Try to land in the middle of the box and land as softly as possible.

name: Seated Tibialis Raise
overview: Sit on a box or bench, place your heels on a step or plate. | Raise your toes straight toward the ceiling.

name: Bicycle Crunch
overview: Lie on your back. | Bend knees, hands behind head. | Twist torso, touch elbow to opposite knee. Repeat.

name: Bird Dog
overview: Start on hands and knees. | Extend right arm and left leg. | Hold for a few seconds, then switch sides.

name: Dead Bug
overview: Lie on your back, arms extended upward, legs raised with knees bent. | Lower opposite arm and leg to floor, keeping back pressed against ground. | Alternate sides, maintain core engagement, and repeat for desired reps or time.

name: Hand Side Plank Reach Through
overview: Start in a side plank position. | Reach your top arm under your body. | Return to the plank position.

name: Long Lever Forearm Plank
overview: Start in a hand plank position and walk your elbows further out until your ears are between your biceps. | Hold in this position for the allotted amount of time. | Make sure you keep a flat back for the whole set.

name: Situp
overview: Lie flat, knees bent. | Lift upper body. | Lower back down

name: Reverse Crunch
overview: Sit in a v position. | Pull legs and torso together. | Extend back into the starting position.

name: Backward Arm Circle
overview: Hold your arms out to your sides. | Rotate your arms backwards in small circles.

name: Bodyweight Alternating Jump Lunge
overview: Start in a standing position. | Lunge forward, switch legs mid-air. | Land and repeat.

name: Bodyweight Figure Four Heels Elevated Hip Thrust
overview: Start by lying on a bench with your foot resting on top of a box,  and cross one leg over the other. | Push through your heels and raise your hips towards the ceiling, keeping your feet flat on the box. | Engage your glutes at the top of the movement, pause briefly and then lower your hips back down to the starting position.

name: Bodyweight Heels Elevated Hip Thrust
overview: Put your shoulder blades on a bench. Both feet on a low box or a plate. | Start with your hips up. | Drop your hips and then push your hips up toward the ceiling.

name: Bodyweight Lateral Lunge Jump
overview: Start with a shoulder width stance. | Jump laterally and fall into a squat. Tap the ground. | Jump the opposite direction

name: Bodyweight Pulse Squat
overview: Hold a dumbbell in goblet position. | Squat down to parallel depth and then halfway back up. | Stay in this short range of motion for the duration of the set.

name: Bodyweight Single Leg Heels Elevated Hip Thrust
overview: Start by lying on a bench with your foot on a plate or low box. | Lift one leg off the ground and engage your glutes to raise your hips up towards the ceiling. | From this starting position, slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.

name: Bodyweight Swing Lunge
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder-width. | Step forward with your right foot and bend both knees to lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. | Push off your right foot to return to the starting position. | Step back with the same leg until the back knee taps the floor.

name: Bodyweight Swingthrough Lunge
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder-width. | Step forward with your right foot and bend both knees to lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. | Push off your right foot to return to the starting position. | Step back with the same leg until the back knee taps the floor.

name: Forward Arm Circle
overview: Hold your arms out to your sides. | Rotate your arms forward in small circles.

name: In And Out Jump Squat
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. | Start by doing a regular squat, then engage your core and jump up explosively. | Narrow your stance while in the air, and land softly. Go directly into another rep.

name: Pole Overhead Squat
overview: Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and hold a pole overhead, using an overhand grip. | Begin the squat by bending at the hips and knees, keeping your core tight and the dumbbells balanced overhead. | Lower your body as far as you can while keeping the dumbbells overhead, then push back up to the starting position. | Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, making sure to keep your back straight, chest lifted, and the dumbbells stable overhead throughout the entire movement.

name: Bodyweight Pop Squat
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. | Start by doing a regular squat, tap the floor, then engage your core and jump up explosively. | Bring your feet mostly together, tap your toes back to the floor, then bring your feet back their original width.

name: Bodyweight Alternating Curtsy Lunge
overview: Place the barbell on your back | Step your foot back and around while simultaneously bringing the weight down. | Return to start and repeat on other leg.

name: Bodyweight Alternating Lateral Lunge
overview: Stand tall, feet hip-width apart. | Step right, lunge to side. | Return, then lunge left.

name: Bodyweight Alternating Reverse Lunges
overview: Stand with feet together. | Step back with right foot. | Return to starting position, then lunge with left foot.

name: Bodyweight Clapping Push Up
overview: Start in a push-up position. | Lower your chest, explode up, clap hands. | Land softly, repeat for reps.

name: Bodyweight Diamond Knee Push Ups
overview: Begin in a push-up position with your hands forming a diamond shape under your chest. | Lower your body, keeping elbows close. | Push back up to the starting position.

name: Bodyweight Elevated Push Up
overview: Start by placing two plates or low boxes on the floor, about shoulder-width apart. | Position yourself in a plank position with your hands on top of the boxes/plates, keeping your arms straight. | Keep your feet together, with your toes resting on the floor. | Engage your core and lower your body towards the floor by bending your arms, until your chest nearly touches the dumbbells. | Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms and engaging your chest, triceps and shoulders.

name: Bodyweight Explosive Push Up
overview: Start in a push-up position. | Lower your chest, explode up. | Land softly, repeat for reps.

name: Bodyweight Hip Abduction
overview: Abduct at the hips and raise your leg out to the side. | Return to the starting position and stop just short of your foot touching back to the ground (to keep tension on the muscle).

name: Bodyweight Incline Knee Push Up
overview: Start by placing two boxes (or one) on the floor, about shoulder-width apart. | Position yourself in a plank position with your hands on top of the box, keeping your arms straight. | Put your knees on the floor. | Engage your core and lower your body towards the floor by bending your arms, until your chest nearly touches the box. | Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms and engaging your chest, triceps and shoulders.

name: Bodyweight Knee Plank Up Down
overview: Start from a kneeling plank position. | Go to one elbow then the other. Try to avoid rocking back and forth.

name: Bodyweight Knee Push Ups
overview: Begin in a push-up position on your knees. Break at the elbow and shoulder joint. | Lower your body, keeping elbows close. | Push back up to the starting position.

name: Bodyweight Knee Tricep Extension
overview: Begin in kneeling position. Hands shoulder width apart. Break at the elbows while letting your elbows fall to the floor. | Extend your elbows until you are back in the starting position.

name: Bodyweight Pike Press
overview: Start in a plank position. Push your hips up toward the ceiling. | Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows | Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position. | Repeat

name: Bodyweight Pike Shrug
overview: Start in a plank position and raise your hips toward the ceiling. | Slowly lower your body (scapula) while keeping your elbows locked (this is key) | Slowly raise your body back to the start position.

name: Bodyweight Plank Up Down
overview: Start from a plank position. | Go to one elbow then the other. Try to avoid rocking back and forth.

name: Bodyweight Tricep Extension
overview: Begin in a plank position. Hands shoulder width apart. Break at the elbows while letting your elbows fall to the floor. | Extend your elbows until you are back in the starting position.

name: Bodyweight Box Assisted Dips
overview: Grip the edge of the boxes with your hands, Keep your feet together and legs straight. | Lower your body straight down. | Slowly press back up to the starting point. | TIP: Make this harder by raising your feet off the floor and adding weight.

name: Bodyweight Step Up Knee Drive
overview: Begin by standing in front of a sturdy box or bench that is about knee-height. | Place your right foot on the box and push through the heel to lift your body up and onto the box, bring your off leg all the way through until your leg is parallel with the ground. | Step back down with your right foot, lowering your left foot to the ground.

name: Plank Saw
overview: Support your weight on forearms and toes. | Ensure you maintain a neutral lower back (do not poke the bum into the air). | Point your toes to push your bodyweight forward then drive the elbows into the ground to push your bodyweight back.

name: Single Leg Slider Hamstring Curl 2
overview: Lie on your back with bent knees and heels on a slider. | Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back on the ground). | Press the heels into the ground to raise your hips off it. | Extend and bend the working leg.

name: Slider Hamstring Curl Single Leg
overview: Lie on your back keeping both knees bent. | Have a slider under the heel of the working leg. | Extend and bend the working lag applying gentle downwards pressure.

name: Bodyweight Standing Hamstring Curl
overview: Stand up straight using a balancing aid. | Shift your weight on one leg. | Bend and extend the non-weight bearing leg. | Knees should remain aligned.

name: Slider Hamstring Curl
overview: Lie on your back with slightly bent knees and heels on sliders. | Pull your heels towards your glutes to lift your hips off the ground. | Extend knees to starting position, but do not rest hips on ground.

name: Bodyweight Standing Hamstring Curl Isometric
overview: Stand up straight using a balancing aid. | Shift your weight on one leg. | Bend the non-weight bearing leg and hold. | Knees should remain aligned.

name: Slider Hamstring Curl Eccentric
overview: Bend your knees so your feet are flat on the floor with heels under knees and toes raised. | Place sliders under your heels. Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back against the ground). | Push through your heels into the ground, lifting your hips up to the point where there is a straight line from your chest to your knees. | Extend your legs in a slow, controlled manner, to lower your bum to the ground. | Casually bend knees before repeating.

name: Hamstring Bridge With Elevated Legs Box Unilateral
overview: Lie on your back. Place one heel on a box or bench, having a 90° angle at hip and knee. | Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back against the ground). | Push through your heel into the box, lifting your hips up to the point where there is a straight line from your chest to your knees.

name: Hamstring Bridge With Elevated Legs Box Bilateral
overview: Lie on your back. Place your heels on a box or bench, having a 90° angle at hips and knees. | Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back against the ground). | Push through your heels into the box, lifting your hips up to the point where there is a straight line from your chest to your knees.

name: Hamstring Bridge Isometric Open Angle
overview: Lie on your back with knees slightly bent and heels dug in. | Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back on the ground). | Press the heels into the ground to raise your hips off it. | Hold the position for the specified duration.

name: Glute Bridge Isometric Hold Single Alternate
overview: Lie on your back. Bend your knees so your feet are flat on the floor with heels under knees | Push through your heels into the ground, lifting your hips up to the point where there is a straight line from your chest to your knees. Squeeze your bum at the top of the movement | Maintain the top position and extend one leg at the time.

name: Glute Bridge Eccentric Unilateral
overview: Lie down with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor. | Push your hips up so that your butt is elevated and your back straight. | Tense your glutes and raise your hips towards the ceiling. | Once you are at the highest point you can manage, hold the position for a few seconds, and raise one leg off the ground. | Lower slowly to the start position.

name: Bodyweight Alternating Forward Lunge
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. | Step forward with your right foot and bend both knees to lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. | Push off your right foot to return to the starting position. Then switch legs.

name: Walking Lunge
overview: Take a step forward shifting your weight onto the front leg. | Bend the knee of the front leg so the knee of the back leg comes close to the ground. | Stand up and go into lunging with the opposite leg.

name: Parallel Bar Dips
overview: Grip bars with arms straight, shoulders above hands. Keep legs straight or bent. | Lower slowly until elbows are at 90 degrees. | Push back up to start position, extending arms fully.

name: Bodyweight Box Squat
overview: Stand in front of a box or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart. | Lower your body into a squat position, sitting back onto the box and pausing for a moment before standing back up. | Push through your heels to return to the standing position.

name: Alternating Heel Touch
overview: Lie on your back, knees bent, feet flat. | Reach right hand to right heel. | Switch sides, left hand to left heel. Repeat.

name: Bodyweight Donkey Calf Raise
overview: Hold on to something for balance. | Hinge forward and maintain that position. Calf raise until you feel a contraction in your calfs.

name: Bodyweight Kickstand Squat
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart, one foot slightly behind. | Lower into a squat, keeping weight on front heel. | Return to standing, engaging glutes and core.

name: Reverse Crunch Kick Up
overview: Perform a reverse crunch and then kick your legs up toward the ceiling. | Flex at the hips and knees until your hips land back on the bench, then kick your legs back out to the starting position.

name: Eccentric Dragonflag
overview: Perform a reverse crunch and then kick your legs up toward the ceiling. | With your hips and knees extended, lower yourself slowly back to the start position.

name: Laying Alternating Leg Raise
overview: Lie on your back, arms by sides, legs straight. | Lift one leg to a 45-degree angle. | Lower leg, lift opposite leg; alternate smoothly.

name: Laying Bent Leg Raise
overview: Lie on your back, knees bent, feet flat on the floor. | Raise both knees towards your chest. | Lower back down without touching the floor; repeat for desired reps.

name: Alternating Bent Leg Raise
overview: Lie on your back, legs bent and lifted off the ground. | Lower one leg to the ground until your foot taps the ground, keep your other leg up. | Alternate sides for the prescribed amount of reps.

name: Scissor Kick
overview: Lie on your back, hands under your buttocks or on the ground for support. | Lift legs off the ground, alternate crossing them in a scissor motion.

name: Sideways Scissor Kick
overview: Lift both legs off the ground. | Bring both legs outward, then cross both legs over one another. | Alternating which leg goes on top.

name: Windshield Wiper
overview: Lie on back, arms out, legs together. | Lift legs to 90 degrees. | Rotate legs side to side, keeping shoulders grounded.

name: Reach And Catch
overview: Lay flat on your back with both hands over one leg. | Reach toward your knee flexing your abs and obliques. | Do the prescribed amount of reps, then switch sides.

name: Oblique Crunch
overview: Lie on your side, knees bent, hands behind head. | Bring your elbow towards your knees and flex your obliques.

name: Oblique Jackknife
overview: Lie on your side, legs straight, hand behind head. | Lift both legs and upper body simultaneously. | Squeeze obliques, then lower back down. Repeat on both sides.

name: Frog Crunch
overview: Lie on your back, knees bent, hands behind head. | Crunch up, flexing the spine and your abs.

name: Frog Sit Up
overview: Lay on your back with knees bent and your feet together. | Keep your arms extended overhead. Swing your arms to generate some momentum and sit up.

name: Elbow Plank Mountain Climber
overview: Begin in an elbow plank position with your core engaged. | Bring your right knee towards your right elbow. | Return to plank, then switch legs quickly. Repeat.

name: Slow Tempo Mountain Climber
overview: To perform a bodyweight mountain climber, start in a plank position with your hands placed directly under your shoulders. | Bring your right knee towards your chest, keeping your foot close to your hand. Quickly switch legs, bringing your left knee towards your chest. | Continue this movement, alternating legs, at a slow pace for a set amount of time or repetitions.

name: Switch Jump Mountain Climber
overview: Start in a plank position with hands under shoulders. | Jump one foot forward, switch legs mid-air. | Alternate legs quickly, maintaining a steady plank.

name: Slalom Mountain Climber
overview: Start in a plank position with hands directly under shoulders. | Drive knees toward left elbow. | Go back to starting position, then drive knees to right elbow, mimicking a zigzag slalom motion.

name: Jumping Mountain Climber
overview: Begin in a plank position, hands under shoulders, feet together. | Jump feet forward, landing outside hands in a low squat. | Explode back to plank, repeat continuously for desired reps.

name: Ring Standing Pushup
overview: Start by setting up the rings to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them. | Stand facing the rings grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders. | Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line. | Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.

name: Ring Row
overview: Set up rings at a high point. | Grip rings and lean back, arms extended. | Pull chest to rings, keeping body straight.

name: Ring Standing Archer Pushup
overview: Position rings shoulder-width apart, grasp handles, extend legs behind. | Lower chest to rings, bend one elbow, while extending your other arm out to the side. Push yourself back to the start. | Then switch arms and repeat.

name: Ring Standing Chest Fly
overview: Start by adjusting the rings straps to chest height. Stand facing the rings with your feet shoulder-width apart. | Grasp the rings' handles with both hands, keeping your arms extended and your shoulders away from your ears. | Lean forward, keeping your arms extended and your core engaged. Your body should form a slight diagonal line from your ankles to your head. | Slowly bring your arms towards each other, in front of your chest, while keeping your core engaged and your body in a stable position.

name: Ring Rear Delt Fly
overview: Stand facing rings and grab the handles. | Step forward so that your body is in a plank position, with your arms straight and your body in a straight line from your head to your heels. | Keeping your arms straight, slowly lift your arms out to the side, keeping them at the same height as your shoulders. Your body should form a "T" shape.

name: Ring Skullcrusher
overview: Attach the ring straps to a high point. Stand on your tip toes. | Your arms should be extended in front of you. | Break at the elbows until your forearms touch your biceps. Then extend your elbows back to the start.

name: Ring Standing Roll Out
overview: Grasp the rings, keeping your arms extended and your shoulders away from your ears. | Keep your abs engaged, roll forward onto your toes, and extend your arms in front of you. | Slowly lower your body down toward the ground, keeping your arms straight and your abs engaged. | When your head gets between your arms, pause for a moment and then use your abs to pull your body back up to the starting position.

name: Bodyweight Assisted Pull Up
overview: Grasp the chin-up bar with an overhand grip, shoulder-width apart. | Place your feet on the ground, legs bent slightly. | Use your legs to assist as you pull your chin above the bar.

name: Bodyweight Assisted Chin Up
overview: Grasp the chin-up bar with an underhand grip, shoulder-width apart. | Place your feet on the ground, legs bent slightly. | Use your legs to assist as you pull your chin above the bar.

name: Bodyweight Assisted Gironda Chin Up
overview: Grasp the chin-up bar with an underhand grip, shoulder-width apart. | Place your feet on the ground, legs bent slightly. | Use your legs to assist as you pull your chest to the bar.

name: Bodyweight Assisted Mixed Grip Pullup
overview: Grasp the chin-up bar with a mixed grip, shoulder-width apart. | Place your feet on the ground, legs bent slightly. | Use your legs to assist as you pull your chin above the bar.

name: Bodyweight Hanging L Sit
overview: Grip bar, hang with arms extended, body straight. | Engage core, lift knees towards chest. | Hold that position for the specified amount of time.

name: Bodyweight Hanging Knee Tuck
overview: Grip bar, hang with arms extended, body straight. | Engage core, lift knees towards chest. | Lower legs back down, maintain controlled movement.

name: Bodyweight Underhand Inverted Row
overview: Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with an underhand grip. | Pull your body straight up to the bar. | Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.

name: Bodyweight Overhand Inverted Row
overview: Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip. | Pull your body straight up to the bar. | Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.

name: Bodyweight Standing Inverted Row
overview: Grab a door frame or a rack and place your feet near the frame. | Start with your elbows extended, row your body towards your hands. | Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.

name: Bodyweight Butterfly Stretch
overview: Sit on your butt with your knees bent and feet touching each other. | Grab your feet and lean forward until you feel a stretch in your groin.

name: Bodyweight Ninety Ninety Hip Stretch
overview: Sit with one leg in front of you flat on the ground. | While the other leg is to your side, also flat on the ground with your foot pointed backwards. | Hold this position for the prescribed amount of time then change sides.

name: Bodyweight Thoracic Spine Rotation
overview: Start on all fours then bring your chest to the ground. Place one hand on the ground in front of you. The other hand behind your head/ear. | On the side of the hand that is behind your head, rotate until your elbow is pointed at the ceiling and then hold this position.

name: Bodyweight Single Leg Balance Stable
overview: Hold on to something stable and pull the leg on the opposing side straight up. Hold this position.

name: Bodyweight Hands Up Push Ups
overview: Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders. | Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body | Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body. Bring chest all the way to the floor and raise hands off the ground. | Exhale as you push back to the starting position.

name: Bodyweight Single Leg Squat
overview: Stand on one leg, extend the other forward for balance. | Lower into a squat, keeping your chest up and core tight. | Press through your heel to stand back up, repeat.

name: Bodyweight Plank Jack
overview: Start in a plank position, hands under shoulders, body straight. | Jump feet wide, then back together, like a jumping jack. | Keep core tight, maintain plank form, repeat for desired time or reps.

name: Bodyweight Plank Arm Lift
overview: Start in a plank position. | Raise your arm out in front of you. | Return to the starting position, then raise the opposing arm. | Make sure to keep your hips stable. If you're unable to, try performing this exercise from the knees.

name: Wall Sit
overview: Press your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart. | Lower into a squat position, thighs parallel to the floor, knees above ankles. | Hold the position, maintaining tension in your core and legs.

name: Leg Raised Push Up
overview: Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders. | Flatten your back so your entire body is straight, raise one leg off the ground,  and slowly lower your body | Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body | Exhale as you push back to the starting position.

name: L Sit Chin Up
overview: Grab the bar shoulder width apart with a supinated grip (palms facing you) | With your body in an "L" position and arms fully extended, pull yourself up until your chin is past the bar. | Slowly return to starting position. Repeat.

name: L Sit Pull Up
overview: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended. Pull your legs up until you're in an "L" position. | Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar. | Lower your body back to starting position.

name: Hanging L Sit
overview: Hang from a bar with arms fully extended. | Lift legs to form an "L" shape. | Hold for allotted amount of time keeping your abs flexed.

name: Dead Hang
overview: Grip a pull-up bar with palms facing forward. | Hang with arms fully extended. | Hold for recommended amount of time, keeping your core engaged.

name: Bodyweight Deficit Reverse Lunge
overview: Stand on a platform, feet hip-width apart. | Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged. | Push through front foot, return to start.

name: Bodyweight Staggered Waiters Bow
overview: Set up a bar at mid way up your quad. Place the working leg against the bar. | Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time. | Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring. | When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.

name: Bodyweight Waiters Bow
overview: Place a barbell at about midway up your thigh. Press your quads into the barbell. | Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. | When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

name: Bodyweight Quad Stomp
overview: Place your foot on a plate or a low box. | Put all of your weight on your front foot and lean forward. | Lower until your calves touch your hamstrings and then extend back up.

name: Bodyweight Single Leg Calf Raise
overview: Hold onto something for balance. Raise one foot off the ground. | Raise your heel upwards while keeping your knees stationary. | Pause when your heels are fully extended and then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Stability Ball V Up Pass
overview: Lie on your back, holding a stability ball between your feet, arms extended overhead. | Engage your core, lift your legs and arms, passing the ball from feet to hands. | Lower arms and legs back down, then repeat, passing the ball back to feet.

name: Bodyweight Curtsy Deficit Lunge
overview: Stand on a platform, feet hip-width apart. | Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged. | Push through front foot, return to start, keeping bar stable throughout.

name: Stability Ball Sissy Squat
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart, stability ball behind your back against a wall. | Lean back onto the ball, bend knees forward, lowering slowly while keeping hips extended. | Push through toes, straighten legs, and return to standing while maintaining balance and control.

name: Stability Ball Single Leg Hip Thrust
overview: Lie on the ball, one foot on the ground. | Lift one leg off the ground and engage your glutes to raise your hips up towards the ceiling. | From this starting position, slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.

name: Stability Ball Windshield Wiper
overview: Lie on your back, legs extended, stability ball between your feet, arms out for support. | Engage your core, lift your legs, and rotate them side to side in a controlled motion. | Keep your upper body stable, move slowly, and return to center before switching directions.

name: Stability Ball Straight Leg Glute Bridge
overview: Lie on your back, heels on a stability ball, legs straight, arms by your sides. | Press through your heels, lift hips, engage glutes and core, forming a straight line. | Slowly lower hips, maintaining control, then repeat for reps.

name: Stability Ball Hamstring Curl
overview: Lie on your back, heels on a stability ball, arms flat, and core engaged. | Lift hips, curl the ball toward you using your hamstrings, keeping control and balance. | Extend legs back to start while keeping hips lifted, then repeat for desired reps.

name: Stability Ball Glute Bridge
overview: Start by lying flat on your back with your feet resting on top of a ball. | Push through your heels and raise your hips towards the ceiling, keeping your feet flat on the bar. | Engage your glutes at the top of the movement, pause briefly and then lower your hips back down to the starting position.

name: Stability Ball Hip Thrust
overview: Sit on the floor, place upper back on a stability ball, feet flat, knees bent. | Drive hips upward by squeezing glutes, forming a straight line from shoulders to knees. | Lower hips slowly without touching the floor, maintaining core engagement, then repeat.

name: Stability Ball Side Crunch
overview: Lie sideways on a stability ball, feet anchored, hands behind head, core engaged. | Crunch sideways by contracting obliques, bringing your upper body toward your hip.

name: Stability Ball Atomic Push Up
overview: Place feet on a stability ball, hands on the floor in a push-up position. | Lower your chest toward the floor, then push up while tucking knees toward your chest. | Extend legs back to starting position, maintaining control and stability throughout the movement.

name: Stability Ball Push Up
overview: Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders. Place your feet on the stability ball. | Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body | Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body | Exhale as you push back to the starting position.

name: Stability Ball Pike
overview: Place your feet on the ball and get in to a plank position. | Pull your hips straight up toward the ceiling. | Lower your hips until you're back in a plank position.

name: Stability Ball Knee Tuck
overview: Start in a plank position with your feet on a stability ball and hands on the floor. | Engage your core and tuck your knees toward your chest, rolling the ball forward carefully. | Extend your legs back to the starting position, maintaining balance and control throughout the movement.

name: Stability Ball Reverse Hyperextension
overview: Lie face down on a stability ball, hands on the floor, legs extended straight. | Engage glutes and lower back, raising legs until aligned with your torso. | Slowly lower legs back down without touching the ground, maintaining core engagement. Repeat.

name: Stability Ball Stir The Pot
overview: Kneel behind a stability ball, place forearms on top, and engage your core muscles. | Lift knees, balance on toes, and slowly move forearms in small controlled circles. | Maintain a stable torso, avoid excessive movement, and reverse direction after several rotations.

name: Bodyweight Stability Ball Crunch
overview: Start by lying flat on your back on a ball with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent. | Engage your core muscles and flex your spine until you feel your abs contract.

name: Bodyweight Stability Ball Hyperextension
overview: Lie face-down on a stability ball, hips centered, feet anchored, hands behind your head. | Engage your core, lift your upper body until aligned with legs, keeping your neck neutral. | Lower your torso slowly back to the starting position, maintaining control and steady breathing.

name: Stability Ball Wall Squat
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, placing a stability ball between your lower back and wall. | Slowly squat down by bending knees to 90 degrees, keeping back straight and core engaged. | Press through heels, straighten legs, and return to standing while maintaining balance and control.

name: Half Kneeling Hip Hinge
overview: Place one knee on a bench. | Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. | When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

name: Gironda Chin Up
overview: Grab the bar shoulder width apart with a supinated grip (palms facing you) | With your body hanging and arms fully extended, pull yourself up and lean backwards. Try to touch your chest to the bar. | Slowly return to starting position. Repeat.

name: Ring Chin Up
overview: Grab the rings shoulder width apart with a supinated grip (palms facing you) | With your body hanging and arms fully extended, pull yourself up until your chin is past the rings. | Slowly return to starting position. Repeat.

name: Ring Twisting Chin Up
overview: Grab the rings shoulder width apart with a pronated grip (palms facing away). | With your body hanging and arms fully extended, pull yourself up and rotate your fists until your chin is past the rings. | Slowly return to starting position. Repeat.

name: Ring Pull Up
overview: Grasp the rings with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended. | Pull your body up until your chin is above the rings. | Lower your body back to starting position.

name: Machine Leg Press
overview: Place your legs on the platform with your feet at shoulder width. | Release the weight and extend your legs fully, without locking your knees. | Lower the weight until your legs are at a 90° angle (but DO NOT allow your butt and lower back to rise off of the pad. This will put your lower back in a rounded position, which is very dangerous.) | Raise the weight back to starting position.

name: Machine Leg Extension
overview: Sit on the machine with your back against the cushion and adjust the machine you are using so that your knees are at a 90 degree angle at the starting position. | Raise the weight by extending your knees outward, then lower your leg to the starting position. Both movements should be done in a slow, controlled motion.

name: Machine Cable V Bar Push Downs
overview: Grip the pulley bar with palms facing down at shoulder width. | Stand straight with a small forward incline. Keep your upper arms close to your body, and slowly bring the pulley bar down until your arms are fully extended. | Pause when you are at the contracted position of the motion, then slowly raise the pulley bar back to the starting point.

name: Machine Pulldown
overview: Grip the bar with the palms facing forward, your hands need to be spaced out at a distance wider than shoulder width. | As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar, bring your torso back around 30 degrees while sticking your chest out. | Pull the bar down to about chin level or a little lower in a smooth movement whilst squeezing the shoulder blades together. | After a second of squeezing, slowly raise the bar back to the starting position when your arms are fully extended.

name: Machine Seated Cable Row
overview: Sit with your back straight on the machine and grip the handles. | Pull the handles back using your arms. Your legs and torso should be at a 90° angle. Push out your chest. | Pull the handles towards your body until your hands are beside your abdomen.

name: Machine Hamstring Curl
overview: Lay down on the machine, placing your legs beneath the padded lever. Position your legs so that the padded lever is below your calve muscles. | Support yourself by grabbing the side handles of the machine, and slowly raise the weight with your legs, toes pointed straight. | Pause at the apex of the motion, then slowly return to starting position.

name: Machine Standing Calf Raises
overview: Adjust the machine in accordance with your height and place your shoulders underneath the padded lever. | The balls of your feet should be supporting your weight on the calve block, your heels extending off of it. | Extend your heels upwards while keeping your knees stationary, and pause at the contracted position. | Slowly return to the starting position. Repeat.

name: Machine Seated Calf Raises
overview: Get comfortable on the machine, then place your lower thighs beneath the padded lever. Place your toes and the balls of your feet onto the foot supports. | Prevent the weight from slipping forward by gripping the handles, and release the safety bar. Lower the weight until your calves are extended. | Push your heels up to lift the padded lever and hold the contracted position, then slowly lower back down to the starting position. Repeat.

name: Machine 45 Degree Back Extension
overview: Position your thighs on the padding and hook your feet on the platform supports. | Keeping your back straight, slowly bend at your waist until your legs and back are at a 45° angle. | Slowly raise your body to the starting position.

name: Smith Machine Standing Shrugs
overview: Place the bar on a lower rung so that when gripped your arms are fully extended and your back is straight. | Grip at shoulder width, raise the bar with your shoulders and pause at the contracted position. | Slowly lower the bar back to starting position.

name: Machine Roll Outs
overview: Hold the Ab Roller with both hands and kneel on the floor with your feet up and crossed. | Slowly roll the ab roller straight forward, stretching your body into a straight position. | After a pause at the stretched position, start pulling yourself back to the starting position. This should be a slow and controlled movement.

name: Glute Ham Raise
overview: Position yourself on a glute ham raise machine or find a suitable substitute like a stability ball or bench. | Adjust the equipment to fit your body by setting the footplate at an appropriate height and making sure your feet are securely anchored. | Begin the movement by slowly lowering your upper body towards the ground while keeping your torso and legs aligned. | Once you reach the lowest point where your body is parallel to the ground or as far as you can comfortably go, pause briefly. | Engage your glutes and hamstrings again as you push yourself back up to the starting position, using the strength of your posterior chain muscles.

name: Narrow Pulldown
overview: Use the Straight Bar attachment. | Hold the attachment as you sit on the machine and put your legs under the leg pads. | Pull the bar to your clavicle, then raise back up until your arm are extended.

name: Neutral Chest Press
overview: Sit on the machine and grab the handles with a neutral grip. | Adjust the machine to get the longest range of motion possible. | Press until your elbows are not extended but not hyperextended.

name: Neutral Pulldown
overview: Use the V Bar attachment. | Hold the attachment as you sit on the machine and put your legs under the leg pads. | Pull the bar to your clavicle, then raise back up until your arm are extended.

name: Seated Leg Curl
overview: Sit on the machine. Adjust the back pad to where the leg pad is just above your knees. | Adjust the leg pad that goes on your lower leg until it's on your achilles. | Use the two handles to push your self back in the chair. Curl your legs as far as possible, and then extend your knees. (Do not hyperextend)

name: Underhand Pulldown
overview: Use the Straight Bar attachment. Hold with an underhand grip. | Hold the attachment as you sit on the machine and put your legs under the leg pads. | Pull the bar to your clavicle, then raise back up until your arm are extended.

name: Machine Sissy Squat
overview: Place the sissy squat pad just behind the knees and the front pad all the way up against your ankles. | Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position. | Sit straight back into a squat. Then push your calves into the back of the pad and extend your knees back to the original position.

name: Machine Goblet Sissy Squat
overview: Place the sissy squat pad just behind the knees and the front pad all the way up against your ankles. | Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position. | Sit straight back into a squat. Then push your calves into the back of the pad and extend your knees back to the original position.

name: Rower Knee Tuck
overview: Place your feet on the rower seat and get in to a hand plank position. | Pull your knees to your chest and flex your abs.

name: Rower Pike
overview: Place your feet on the rower seat and get in to a plank position. | Pull your hips straight up toward the ceiling. | Lower your hips until you're back in a plank position.

name: Machine Seated Leg Curl
overview: Sit back in the seat. Use the two handles to push yourself back into the chair. | Flex your ankles and point your toes upward. | Flex your knee bringing the pad backward, extend your knee without allowing the weight to touch back down.

name: Machine Assisted Parallel Bar Dips
overview: Grip bars with arms straight, shoulders above hands. Place knees on pad. | Lower slowly until elbows are at 90 degrees. | Push back up to start position, extending arms fully.

name: Machine Assisted Pull Up
overview: Adjust weight for assistance. Stand on platform, grip handles above shoulder-width. Knees on pad if available. | Slowly pull up until chin is above the bar. Keep elbows close, core engaged. | Lower back with control. Pause at bottom. Repeat for reps.

name: Machine Assisted Narrow Pull Up
overview: Adjust weight for assistance. Stand on platform, grip handles above shoulder-width. Knees on pad if available. | Slowly pull up until chin is above the bar. Keep elbows close, core engaged. | Lower back with control. Pause at bottom. Repeat for reps.

name: Machine Assisted Neutral Chin Up
overview: Adjust weight for assistance. Stand on platform, grip handles above shoulder-width. Knees on pad if available. | Slowly pull up until chin is above the bar. Keep elbows close, core engaged. | Lower back with control. Pause at bottom. Repeat for reps.

name: Machine Assisted Chin Up
overview: Adjust weight for assistance. Stand on platform, grip handles above shoulder-width. Knees on pad if available. | Slowly pull up until chin is above the bar. Keep elbows close, core engaged. | Lower back with control. Pause at bottom. Repeat for reps.

name: Machine Hip Thrust
overview: Adjust the machine for your height, sit with your back against the pad, knees bent, feet flat on the platform. | Brace your core, push through your heels, and extend your hips upwards, lifting the weight while squeezing your glutes. | Lower the weight slowly back to the starting position, ensuring controlled movement; repeat for desired reps and sets.

name: Machine Hack Squat
overview: Position yourself in the hack squat machine with your back against the pad and shoulders under the shoulder pads. | Place feet shoulder-width apart on the platform. Keep your back straight, and slowly lower into a squat position. | Press through your heels to return to the starting position, keeping your core engaged. Repeat for desired reps and sets.

name: Machine Horizontal Sissy Leg Press
overview: Place your feet at the bottom the platform at shoulder width. Lift your heels up. | Press against the platform and extend your legs fully, without locking your knees. | Lower the weight until your legs are at a 90° angle (but DO NOT allow your butt and lower back to rise off of the pad. This will put your lower back in a rounded position, which is very dangerous.) | Raise the weight back to starting position.

name: Machine Horizontal Leg Press Calf Jump
overview: Start with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent. | Shift your weight onto the balls of your feet and raise stay flat footed. Using your calf muscles, mimic a jumping motion but don't leave the platform. | Explode onto your toes and hold for a second.

name: Machine Horizontal Leg Press Calf Raise
overview: Adjust the machine in accordance with your height. | The balls of your feet should be supporting your weight on the bottom of the platform, your heels extending off of it. | Extend your heels upwards while keeping your knees stationary, and pause at the contracted position. | Slowly return to the starting position. Repeat.

name: Machine Horizontal Leg Press
overview: Place your legs on the platform with your feet at shoulder width. | Release the weight and extend your legs fully, without locking your knees. | Lower the weight until your legs are at a 90° angle (but DO NOT allow your butt and lower back to rise off of the pad. This will put your lower back in a rounded position, which is very dangerous.) | Raise the weight back to starting position.

name: Machine Hip Adduction
overview: Sit in the machine with your legs apart, pads against your outer thighs. Adjust the seat and pad position comfortably. | Slowly squeeze your legs together, focusing on using your inner thigh muscles. Pause when the pads are close together. | Slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control. Avoid letting the weights slam. Repeat for desired reps and sets.

name: Machine Hip Abduction
overview: Adjust machine settings to fit your height. Sit with back flat against pad, legs together. | Slowly press legs apart against resistance. Pause at peak. | Slowly return legs to starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

name: Machine Reverse Fly
overview: Sit on machine and press your chest into the pad. | Grab the handles with an overhand grip. Keep your elbows mostly extended. | Bring your arms backwards and squeeze your scapula together.

name: Machine Pec Fly
overview: Adjust seat height so handles align with chest. Sit and grip handles with elbows slightly bent. | Slowly bring handles together in front, keeping tension. Focus on squeezing chest muscles. | Return handles to starting position with controlled motion. Keep chest up throughout. Repeat for reps.

name: Machine Overhand Overhead Press
overview: Adjust the seat to match your height. | Press your back into the back pad. | Press upwards until your elbows are nearly extended. But not fully extended. | Lower until the plates nearly touch back down.

name: Machine Neutral Overhead Press
overview: Adjust the seat to match your height. | Press your back into the back pad. | Press upwards until your elbows are nearly extended. But not fully extended. | Lower until the plates nearly touch back down.

name: Machine Hip And Glute Adduction
overview: Stand on the platform and set the pad just over the hip of the working leg. | Place the working leg over the pad. | Press your leg inward. Aim to get the longest range of motion possible.

name: Machine Hip And Glute Abduction
overview: Stand on the platform and set the pad just over the opposing hip of the working leg. | Place the working leg over the pad. | Press your leg outward. Aim to get the longest range of motion possible.

name: Machine Hip And Glute Kickback
overview: Stand on the platform and sideways on the machine. | Place the pad at just above hip height. Place the working leg over the pad. | Extend the working leg backwards and flex your glute at the end of each rep.

name: Machine Chest Press
overview: Sit on the machine and grab the handles with an overhand grip. | Adjust the machine to get the longest range of motion possible. | Press until your elbows are not extended but not hyperextended.

name: Machine Underhand Row
overview: Sit on the machine, feet flat, and grab the handles with palms facing up, keeping your back straight. | Pull handles towards your lower abdomen, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Keep elbows close to your body. | Slowly return to the starting position, fully extending your arms without locking elbows. Repeat for desired reps.

name: Machine Neutral Row
overview: Sit on the machine, feet flat, and grab the handles with palms facing each other, keeping your back straight. | Pull handles towards your lower abdomen, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Keep elbows close to your body. | Slowly return to the starting position, fully extending your arms without locking elbows. Repeat for desired reps.

name: Machine Overhand Row
overview: Sit on the machine, feet flat, and grab the handles with palms facing down, keeping your back straight. | Pull handles towards your lower abdomen, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Keep elbows close to your body. | Slowly return to the starting position, fully extending your arms without locking elbows. Repeat for desired reps.

name: Stretcher
overview: Place your foot on the leg pad for leverage and grab the attachment. | Start with your arms extended and your head between your arms. | Begin to pull. As you pull, lean backwards until the attachment touches your chest.

name: Machine Plate Loaded Crunch
overview: Place your feet under the foot pads and grab the handles with your hands. | Flex your spine and bring your upper and lower body together.

name: Machine Plate Loaded Incline Chest Press
overview: Adjust the seat pad to match your height. | Press the weight forward until your elbows are nearly extended. Return to the starting position with out letting the weight rest at the bottom until finishing your set.

name: Machine Plate Loaded Decline Chest Press
overview: Adjust the seat pad to match your height. | Press the weight forward until your elbows are nearly extended. Return to the starting position with out letting the weight rest at the bottom until finishing your set.

name: Machine Plate Loaded Low Incline Bench Press
overview: Adjust the seat pad to match your height. | Press the weight forward until your elbows are nearly extended. Return to the starting position with out letting the weight rest at the bottom until finishing your set.

name: Machine Bent Arm Pec Fly
overview: Adjust seat height so handles align with chest. Put your elbows on the pads. | Slowly bring pads together in front, keeping tension. Focus on squeezing chest muscles. | Return pads to starting position with controlled motion. Keep chest up throughout. Repeat for reps.

name: Machine Plate Loaded Front Military Press
overview: Novice | Push | Overhand: Pronated | Compound

name: Machine Chest Supported T Bar Row
overview: Lay on the chest pad and grab the handles. Lift the bar out of the holding hook. | Pull the bar to your chest and then fully extend your elbows at the bottom of each rep.

name: Machine Plate Loaded Pulldown
overview: Grip the handles with the palms facing down. | Sit on the machine and press your knees into the knee pad. | Pull the handles until your upper arm is even with your torso, or just behind your torso. | Extend until your elbows are fully extended before initiating the next rep.

name: Machine Rear Deltoid Row
overview: Place your chest against the pad and grab the handles with an overhand grip. | Pull your elbows straight back and keep your elbows flared throughout the rep.

name: Machine Pullover
overview: Adjust the seating pad for your height. | Place your elbows on the elbow pad. Pull the bar forward until it nearly touches your stomach.

name: Machine Seated Shrug
overview: Have a seat on the machine, and grab each handle. | Pull your shoulder blades straight up toward the ceiling.

name: Machine Standing Shrug
overview: Grab both handles and stand upright. Make sure you keep a flat back while lifting to the starting position. | Pull your shoulder blades straight up toward the ceiling.

name: Machine Back Extension
overview: Sit on the machine and place your upper back on the rolling pad. | Extend your hips and lower back. Make sure not to hyperextend your spine.

name: Machine Standing Lateral Raise
overview: Grab the two handles and raise the arms straight out to your sides.

name: Machine Overhead Tricep Extension
overview: Adjust the pad to suit your height. | Grab the v bar (or other attachment) and extend your elbows until they are almost fully extended. | Flex your elbows and look to feel a stretch at the bottom of each rep.

name: Machine Reverse Hyperextension
overview: Lay on the pad and grab the handles. | Slip your legs into the belt loop. | Push your legs back until they are horizontal with the ground. | Lower back to the starting position.

name: Machine Pendulum Squat
overview: Position yourself in the pendulum squat machine with your back against the pad and shoulders under the shoulder pads. | Place feet shoulder-width apart on the platform. Keep your back straight, and slowly lower into a squat position. | Press through your heels to return to the starting position, keeping your core engaged. Repeat for desired reps and sets.

name: Machine Single Leg Leg Press
overview: This particular leg press has two separate foot plates. There are holding pins on both sides. Engage the pin on one side. | Lower the weight but stop before your lower back begins to round. | Press back to the starting position.

name: Machine Squat Press
overview: Place your legs on the platform with your feet at shoulder width. | Release the weight and extend your legs fully, without locking your knees. | Lower the weight until your legs are at a 90° angle (but DO NOT allow your butt and lower back to rise off of the pad. This will put your lower back in a rounded position, which is very dangerous.) | Raise the weight back to starting position.

name: Machine Donkey Calf Raise
overview: Adjust the machine to fit your height. Place your elbows on the pad, grab the handles. The vertical pad should be resting on your lower back. | Raise your heels toward the ceiling.

name: Machine 45 Degree Calf Raise
overview: Adjust the machine in accordance with your height and sit. | The balls of your feet should be supporting your weight on the calve block, your heels extended off of it. | Extend your heels upwards while keeping your knees stationary, and pause at the contracted position. | Slowly return to the starting position. Repeat.

name: Machine Plate Loaded Hip Thrust
overview: Adjust the machine for your height, sit with your back against the pad, knees bent, feet flat on the platform. | Brace your core, push through your heels, and extend your hips upwards, lifting the weight while squeezing your glutes. | Lower the weight slowly back to the starting position, ensuring controlled movement; repeat for desired reps and sets.

name: Machine Plate Loaded Low Row
overview: Press your chest into the chest pad and grab the horizontal handles with an overhand grip. | Pull the handles toward you, make sure your elbows stay flared out.

name: Machine Plate Loaded Seal Row
overview: Lay on the chest after adjusting the height off the bar holding hooks to match your arm length. | Remove the bar from the hooks, then initiate the set. | Pull the bar straight back, then lower to the start position. Fully extend your elbows at the bottom of each rep. | Lay on the chest after adjusting the height off the bar holding hooks to match your arm length. | Remove the bar from the hooks, then initiate the set. | Pull the bar straight back, then lower to the start position. Fully extend your elbows at the bottom of each rep.

name: Machine Plate Loaded T Bar Row
overview: Hinge forward while keeping your back flat. | Grab the handles and pull the weight toward your chest. | Make sure to fully extend your elbows at the bottom of each rep. Also make sure to not use momentum.

name: Machine Plate Loaded Row
overview: Sit on the machine, feet flat, and grab the handles. | Pull handles towards your lower abdomen, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Keep elbows close to your body. | Slowly return to the starting position, fully extending your arms without locking elbows. Repeat for desired reps.

name: Machine Tricep Pushdown
overview: Sit on the machine and place the back of your upper arm on the bench. | Extend your elbows until you feel a contraction in your triceps. | Bring the weight back to the starting position.

name: Machine Dips
overview: Sit on the machine and grab the handles. | Press the handles down until your elbows are nearly extended.

name: Machine Standing Hamstring Curl
overview: Press yourself into the pads and put your calves against the lower pads. | Flex your knee until you feel a contraction in your hamstring, then lower back to the start.

name: Machine Plate Loaded Kneeling Hamstring Curl
overview: Lay down on the machine, placing your working leg beneath the padded lever. Position your leg so that the padded lever is below your calve muscle. | Support yourself by grabbing the side handles of the machine, and slowly raise the weight with your legs. | Pause at the apex of the motion, then slowly return to starting position.

name: Horizontal Hack Squat
overview: Position yourself in the hack squat machine with your back against the pad and shoulders under the shoulder pads. | Place feet shoulder-width apart on the platform. | Press through your heels to the starting position, keeping your core engaged. Repeat for desired reps and sets.

name: Machine Crunch
overview: Place your feet under the foot pads and grab the handles with your hands. | Flex your spine and bring your upper and lower body together.

name: Machine Glute Kickback
overview: Grab the handles, place one knee on the pad, and the foot of the working leg on the foot plate. | Push your working leg back until you feel your glute contract, then return to the starting position without resting the weights.

name: Machine Plate Loaded Calf Raise
overview: Sit on the machine and press your back into the back pad. | Place the balls of your feet on the edge of the foot plate. | Let your heels lower until you feel a stretch in your calves, then press back up until you feel a contraction.

name: Gluteator
overview: Sit on the seat upright with your knees placed on the pads and your feet on the foot pads. | Push your legs outwards and backwards and flex your glutes.

name: Vertical Leg Press
overview: Lay on the pad and place your feet on the foot plate. | Lift the plate up and disengage the holding hook. | Lower the weight. Stop before your lower back rounds off the pad. | Press the weight back to the starting position.

name: Machine Belt Squat
overview: Put the belt around your waist and hook the end of the belt onto the machines. | Stand up to disengage the holding mechanism. Hold the arms while you squat. | Once you've completed your set, reset the holding mechanism.

name: Machine Plate Loaded Leg Extension
overview: Sit on the machine with your back against the cushion and adjust the machine you are using so that your knees are at a 90 degree angle at the starting position. | Raise the weight by extending your knees outward, then lower your leg to the starting position. Both movements should be done in a slow, controlled motion.

name: Machine Seated Hamstring Curl
overview: Adjust the back pad and ankle pad to suit your height. | Disengage the knee pad and lower it as far as you can. | Flex your knees against resistance, then extend until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.

name: Medicine Ball Chest Press Partner Toss
overview: Stand tall, partner tosses medicine ball to chest. | Catch ball and press it back to partner. Repeat.

name: Medicine Ball Chest Press Slam
overview: Hold medicine ball at chest, feet shoulder-width apart. | Extend arms forward, slamming ball to the ground. | Catch the ball on the rebound and repeat for reps.

name: Medicine Ball Chest Press Toss
overview: Stand in front of a wall holding a medicine ball. | Press the ball forward, extending arms and tossing it. | Catch the ball and return to the starting position.

name: Medicine Ball Clean And Press Slam
overview: Hold the medicine ball with an overhand grip. | Lift the ball explosively, clean it to shoulder height. | Press the ball overhead, then slam it to the ground.

name: Medicine Ball Half Kneeling Wood Chopper
overview: Kneel with one knee down, holding a medicine ball. | Rotate torso and until the medicine ball is pointed the opposite direction. | Repeat the movement on the other side.

name: Medicine Ball Halo
primary_muscle: Abdominals, Shoulders, Front Shoulders, Rear Shoulders
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hold a medicine ball. | Circle the ball around your head, maintaining control. | Complete the desired number of repetitions in both directions.

name: Medicine Ball Ball Headlock Squat
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding medicine ball close. | Squat down, keeping ball close to head and chest. | Stand back up, squeezing glutes. Repeat for desired reps.

name: Medicine Ball Hip Abduction
overview: Stand tall with a medicine ball held against one hip. | Lift the leg on the opposite side laterally. | Lower the leg and repeat on the other side.

name: Medicine Ball Kneeling Wood Chopper
overview: Kneel, holding a medicine ball. | Rotate torso and slam the ball diagonally down and across. | Repeat the movement on the other side.

name: Medicine Ball Lateral Lunge Slam
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a medicine ball. | Step laterally, performing a lunge, then slam the ball. | Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

name: Medicine Ball Ball Offset Squat
overview: Hold medicine ball at one shoulder, feet shoulder-width apart. | Squat down, keeping ball on same side throughout movement. | Stand back up, squeezing glutes. Repeat on other side.

name: Medicine Ball Overhead Reverse Lunge
overview: Hold medicine ball overhead. | Step back into lunge position. | Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.

name: Medicine Ball Overhead Squat
overview: Hold medicine ball overhead. | Squat down, keeping back straight. | Stand back up. Repeat for desired reps.

name: Medicine Ball Partner Side Toss
overview: Stand facing partner, side by side. | Toss medicine ball to partner's side. | Catch and repeat toss on other side.

name: Medicine Ball Partner Situp Toss
overview: Lie facing partner, knees bent. | Sit up, toss medicine ball to partner. | Catch and lower down. Repeat for desired reps.

name: Medicine Ball Plank
overview: Place forearms on medicine ball, extend legs. | Maintain straight body position for desired time.

name: Medicine Ball Press Jack
overview: Hold medicine ball at chest. | Jump, extending arms overhead. | Return to starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

name: Medicine Ball Pushup
overview: Place hands on medicine ball, in push-up position. | Perform push-up, maintaining proper form.

name: Medicine Ball Rainbow Slam
overview: Lift medicine ball overhead. | Slam ball down to one side. | Catch and repeat slam to the other side.

name: Medicine Ball Reverse Lunge
overview: Hold medicine ball at chest. | Step back into lunge position. | Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.

name: Medicine Ball Reverse Lunge Twist
overview: Hold medicine ball at chest. | Step back into lunge position, extend your arms, twist torso. | Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.

name: Medicine Ball Russian Twist
overview: Sit with knees bent, feet off ground. | Twist torso side to side, touching medicine ball to ground.

name: Medicine Ball Self Toss
overview: Toss medicine ball up, catch with both hands. | Repeat toss and catch for desired reps.

name: Medicine Ball Single Leg Deadlift
overview: Hold medicine ball while standing on one leg. | Hinge forward on one leg, extending other leg behind. | Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.

name: Medicine Ball Slam
overview: Lift medicine ball overhead. | Slam ball down to ground with force.

name: Medicine Ball Squat Reach
overview: Hold medicine ball at chest. | Squat down, reach ball to one side. | Stand up and repeat reach on other side.

name: Medicine Ball Walkover Pushup
overview: Place one hand on medicine ball, other on ground. | Perform push-up, walking hands to switch positions.

name: Medicine Ball Wall Ball
overview: Hold medicine ball at chest, facing wall. | Squat down, then throw ball at wall. | Catch and repeat for desired reps.

name: Medicine Ball Wood Chopper
overview: Hold medicine ball with both hands and arms extended. | Swing ball diagonally across body, engaging core.

name: Medicine Ball Wood Chopper Toss
overview: Stand sideways next to a wall. | Swing medicine ball across your body and toss off the wall. | Catch and repeat toss on the other side.

name: Medicine Ball Hollow Hold
overview: Lie on your back, holding a medicine ball overhead. | Lift your shoulders and legs off the ground, engaging core. | Hold the position while maintaining stability.

name: Medicine Ball Dead Bug
overview: Lie on your back, place a medicine ball between your extended arms and bent knees. | Lower opposite arm and leg to floor, keeping back pressed against ground and medicine ball in place. | Alternate sides, maintain core engagement, and repeat for desired reps or time.

name: Kettlebell Skull Crusher
overview: Lie on your back with knees in the air and soles of your feet flat on the floor. | Hold the kettlebell in both hands directly above your chest. | Keeping your upper arms in place, bend your elbows to slowly bring the kettlebell in front of your forehead. | Return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Situp
overview: Lay flat on your back with straight legs and hold the kettle bell above your chest at arms length. | Draw your belly into the base of your spine to engage the muscles, then raise your head and shoulders off the floor with the kettlebell raised at arms length above your chest. | Return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Russian Twist
overview: Sit on the floor with your legs bent, knees together and feet raised slightly off the floor. | Starting on one side and sitting up straight with your core muscles engaged, lift the kettlebell off the floor with both hands and bring it across your body to the other side, rotating your chest towards the floor as you do so. | Tap the kettlebell lightly on the floor and bring the kettlebell back across your body to the starting position, rotating your chest towards the floor. | Repeat, keeping the legs bent and feet raised throughout the exercise.

name: Kettlebell Wood Chopper
overview: Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart and hold the kettle bell with both hands against your hip. | Keeping your arms straight, swing the kettlebell upwards and across your body towards your shoulder, raising the kettlebell to head height rotating your hips as you do so. | Return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Windmill
overview: Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart. Hold the kettlebell in one hand and extend your arm above your head. | Keeping your legs straight and the kettlebell above your head, lower the relaxed arm towards the ground, twisting your body towards the side of the raised arm. | Return to the starting potion, tilt your pelvis forward and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Leg Calf Raise
overview: Standing straight with a kettlebell in one hand, lift the same foot as the side without the kettlebell off the floor. | Raise your heel upwards while keeping your knees stationary. | Pause when your heels are fully extended and then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Calf Raise
overview: Standing straight with a kettlebell in each hand, raise your heels upwards while keeping your knees stationary. | Pause when your heels are fully extended and then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Seated Calf Raise
overview: Sitting comfortably on a chair with your core stomach muscles engaged, place your feet on the floor. | Place the kettlebell on your legs, just above the knees and raise your heels upwards off the floor. | Pause when your heels are fully extended and then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Chest Press (Single)
overview: Laying on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, hold the kettlebell at your chest with both hands. | Fully extend your arms, raising the kettlebell until your elbows are locked. | Lower the kettlebell to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Chest Fly
overview: Lie on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, with your arms to the side of your body. | Holding a kettlebell in one hand, keeping your arm fully extended with a slight bend in the elbow and your forearms facing upwards, lift the kettlebell above your chest. | Lower the kettlebell to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Press
overview: Laying on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, leave one arm resting to the side of the body. | Using the other arm, hold the kettlebell at arms length directly upwards of your shoulder. | Lower your arm until your upper arm to elbow is resting on the floor. | Return to starting position.

name: Kettlebell Walkover Pushup
overview: Starting in a press up position with feet wide and one hand resting on the kettlebell, complete a full press up, lowering your chest towards the ground while keeping your body straight and returning to the starting position. | Swap hands on the kettlebell, placing the hand originally on the kettlebell underneath your shoulder, complete another press up. | Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Farmers Carry
overview: Hold two kettlebells in each hand. | Keep your shoulders blades pulled back and walk for a specified duration.

name: Kettlebell Wrist Extension
overview: Stand up straight with a kettlebell in both hands in front of your pelvis, with your forearms facing inwards. | Flex your wrist upwards until wrists are fully extended. | Lower to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Wrist Curl
overview: Stand up straight with a kettlebell in both hands in front of your pelvis, with your forearms facing outwards. | Flex your wrist towards your body until the kettlebell is level with your stomach. | Lower to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Glute Bridge
overview: Laying on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, rest the kettlebell on your pelvis. | Pushing through the legs and keeping the core muscles engaged, raise your pelvis off the floor until your stomach, pelvis and thighs make a straight line. | Slowly lower to the ground to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Leg Glute Bridge
overview: Laying on the floor with one knee bent with the foot firmly on the floor and one leg extended, rest the kettlebell on your pelvis. | Pushing through the bent leg and keeping the core muscles engaged, raise your pelvis and the extended leg off the floor until your stomach, pelvis and thighs make a straight line. | Slowly lower to the ground to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Hip Thrust
overview: Sitting on the floor with your knees bent and feet planted firmly on the floor, lean your back against the bench. | Resting the kettlebell on your pelvis, raise your pelvis until your stomach, pelvis and thighs are in line. | Slowly lower until you are in the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Leg Hip Thrust
overview: Sitting on the floor with one knee bent with the foot firmly on the floor and one leg extended, lean your back against the bench. | Resting the kettlebell on your pelvis, raise your pelvis until your stomach, pelvis and thighs are in line. | Slowly lower until you are in the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Deadlift (Single)
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs. | Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | Return to standing position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Swing
overview: Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell between your legs, with your knees slightly bent. | Keeping your back straight, swing the kettlebell upwards until the kettlebell is level with your chest and carefully lower. | Repeat

name: Kettlebell Row (Single)
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs. | Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Leg Deadlift
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, lifting one foot off the floor behind you. Hold the kettlebell in the same arm as the lifted leg. | Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you extend your lifted leg behind you, keeping your back straight - holding out your arm to the side for balance. | Return to the upright position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Shoulder Extension
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart bending forward at the hips as far as comfortable. Place off-hand on the same side thigh for stability. | Hold the kettlebell in one hand, straight armed and pointing towards the floor. | Keeping your arm straight, swing the kettlebell behind you as far as comfortable. | Return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Staggered Deadlift (Single)
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, shifting one foot behind you. Hold the kettlebell in both hands in front of your thighs. | Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees and keep your back straight. | Return to the upright position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Goblet Good Morning
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your chest. | Bend forward at the hips keeping your back and knees straight and the kettlebell close to your chest. | Return to standing position and thrust your pelvis forward.

name: Kettlebell Rear Delt Row
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs. | Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your upper chest and then lower the kettlebell- repeat.

name: Kettlebell Front Raise
overview: Stand up straight with feet shoulder width apart, holding the kettlebell in front of your pelvis. | Keeping arms straight, raise the kettlebell slightly higher than head level. | Return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Rear Delt Fly
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs. | Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | Bring one arm behind you and rest this arm on your back. With the other arm, hold the kettlebell at arms length close to the floor. | Swing the kettlebell out and up towards the side of your body and then return to centre. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Standing Tricep Extension
overview: Stand with legs shoulder width apart. | Hold the kettlebell in both hands behind your head. | Straighten arms bringing kettlebell above your head. | Return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Decline Skull Crusher
overview: Lie on the floor with your upper back and soles of feet on the floor, knees bent, and pelvis and lower back suspended in the air. | Hold the kettlebell in both hands directly above your chest. | Keeping your upper arms in place, bend your elbows to bring the kettlebell to the floor above your head. | Return the kettlebell to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Row
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, shifting one foot behind you. Hold the kettlebell in the same hand as the leg shifted backwards. | Bend forwards at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knee, keeping your back straight. | Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.

name: Kettlebell Pullover
overview: Rest your upper back on the bench and place soles of your feet firmly on the floor keeping torso and thighs suspended and parallel to the floor. | Hold the kettlebell with both hands above your chest, keeping your arms straight. | Keeping your arms straight, move the kettlebell in the direction of your head until your arms are parallel to the floor. | Return to starting to position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Long Lever Lateral Raise
overview: Stand with feet shoulder width apart holding a kettlebell with one hand at your side. | Keeping your arm straight, swing the kettlebell up and out, away from your body to around head height, holding on to the kettlebell firmly so it does not change position in your hand. | Return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Lateral Raise
overview: Stand with feet shoulder width apart holding a kettlebell with one hand at your side. | Keeping your arm straight, swing the kettlebell up and out, away from your body to around head height. | Return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Shrug (Single)
overview: Standing up straight with feet shoulder width apart. | Holding the kettlebell in both hands in front of your pelvis, engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. | Release the shrug and repeat

name: Kettlebell Upright Row
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs. | Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.

name: Kettlebell Silverback Shrug (Single)
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs. | Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | Holding the kettlebell in both hands engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. Release the shrug.

name: Kettlebell Incline Shrug
