overview: Leaning across the back section of the bench, with feet firmly on the floor and with arms hanging to the sides. | Holding the kettlebell in both hands engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. Release the shrug.

name: Kettlebell Step Up
overview: Standing up straight, using a bench as a step, raise one foot onto the bench and hold the kettlebell in the same arm as the straight leg. | Stand and bring both feet onto the bench. Slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position. | Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Goblet Squat
overview: Hold the weight tucked into your upper chest area, keeping your elbows in. Your feet should be slightly wider than your shoulders. | Sink down into the squat, keeping your elbows inside the track of your knees. | Push through your heels while keeping your chest up and return to the starting position.

name: Kettlebell Heels Up Goblet Squat
overview: Hold the weight tucked into your upper chest area, keeping your elbows in. Your feet should be slightly wider than your shoulders and the heels slightly raised on a surface. | Sink down into the squat, keeping your elbows inside the track of your knees. | Push through your heels while keeping your chest up and return to the starting position.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Reverse Lunge
overview: Stand straight with your feet slightly apart and hold a kettlebell in one hand. | Bring the same leg as the arm holding the kettlebell behind you, squat down until your back knee touches the ground, keeping your back straight. | Return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Forward Lunge
overview: Stand straight with your feet slightly apart and hold a kettlebell in one hand. | Bring the same leg as the arm holding the kettlebell in front of you, squat down until your thigh is parallel to the ground, keeping your back straight. | Return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Lateral Lunge (Single)
overview: Stand straight with your feet shoulder width apart. Keep your back straight and hold the kettlebell in front of your pelvis. | Take a large step to one side, holding the kettlebell low and lunge into the bent leg. | Return to the starting position and repeat

name: Kettlebell Tate Press
overview: Lie flat on your back. Keeping your arm straight, hold the kettlebell above your chest with your palm facing away from your body. | Bend your arm, touching the kettlebell to the top of the shoulder opposite to the arm being worked. | Return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Hollow Hold
overview: Grab a kettlebell. | Lie on your back, lift legs & shoulders off floor. | Hold kettlebell above your head, engage core, and maintain position.

name: Kettlebell Superman
overview: Begin by lying face down on the floor with a kettlebell in each hand, arms extended. | Lift your chest and legs off the ground simultaneously while squeezing your glutes and raising the kettlebells. | Lower your body and kettlebells back to the floor, then repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: Kettlebell Superman Hold
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart, kettlebell in one hand, arm fully extended, and hinge at hips. | Lift opposite leg straight behind you, forming a straight line from head to heel. | Hold for 15-30 seconds, switch sides, and repeat for a balanced kettlebell superman hold.

name: Kettlebell Alternating Row
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell in one hand. | Bend at hips, row kettlebell to chest. | Alternate hands for each row.

name: Kettlebell Alternating Swing
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell between legs. | Hinge at hips, swing kettlebell between legs. | Swing kettlebell up, switch hands at the top, and repeat in a fluid motion.

name: Kettlebell Bench Press
overview: Lie on a bench, hold kettlebells above chest. | Lower them to chest, then push up. | Repeat for desired reps, maintaining form.

name: Kettlebell Clean And Press
overview: Start with kettlebells between legs. | Swing kettlebells up to shoulder. | Press kettlebells overhead.

name: Kettlebell Conventional Deadlift (Double)
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart. | Bend at hips and knees to lift kettlebells. | Stand tall, then lower.

name: Kettlebell Snatch (Double)
overview: Begin with a two kettlebells between your legs, hinge at hips, then swing it upwards explosively. | As they rise, lock out arm overhead, wrist straight. | Control the descent, then repeat.

name: Kettlebell Swing (Double)
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebells outside legs | Hinge at hips, swing kettlebells forward, then back. | Thrust hips to swing kettlebells upward, keeping arms straight.

name: Kettlebell Figure Four Hip Thrust
overview: Begin seated, kettlebell on hips. | Lift hips, form figure four leg shape. | Lower, repeat thrusts.

name: Kettlebell Forward Lunge (Double)
overview: Hold kettlebell at your side. | Step forward, lunge, and return. | Repeat with opposite leg.

name: Kettlebell Front Rack Curtsy Lunge (Double)
overview: Hold kettlebells in front rack. | Step back and lunge diagonally.

name: Kettlebell Front Rack Forward Lunge (Double)
overview: Start with kettlebells in front rack. | Step forward into lunge. | Return to starting position.

name: Kettlebell Front Rack Lateral Lunge (Double)
overview: Hold kettlebell in front rack. | Step sideways into a lunge position. | Return to start position. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Front Rack Reverse Lunge (Double)
overview: Start with kettlebell in front rack. | Step back into lunge. | Return to start position.

name: Kettlebell Front Rack Single Arm Lateral Lunge
overview: Hold kettlebell in front rack. | Step sideways, lunge.

name: Kettlebell Front Rack Squat
overview: Hold kettlebells close to chest. | Squat down, keeping chest up. | Stand up, extending hips fully.

name: Kettlebell Full Swing
primary_muscle: Lower back, Glutes, Hamstrings, Shoulders, Front Shoulders
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell between legs. | Hinge at hips, grip kettlebell, and swing it overhead. | Extend hips and knees, lock out arms at the top.

name: Kettlebell Gorilla Row
overview: Stand with kettlebell between legs. | Hinge at hips, grab kettlebell, pull to chest and rotate at the torso

name: Kettlebell Guillotine Bench Press
overview: Lie on bench, hold kettlebell with both hands over chest. | Lower kettlebells, elbows flared. | Press kettlebells upward, fully extending arms. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Lateral Lunge
overview: Hold kettlebells in front of you. | Step sideways, lunge down and let the kettlebells land between your legs. | Push off, return to start. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Pec Fly
overview: Lie flat on a bench, holding a kettlebell in each hand above your chest. | Slowly lower the kettlebells outwards, then lift them back up to the starting position.

name: Kettlebell Push Press
overview: Start with kettlebell in rack position. | Dip at knees and hips. | Explosively push kettlebell overhead, fully extending arms.

name: Kettlebell Rear Delt Row (Double)
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart, kettlebell in each hand, hinge at hips. | Pull kettlebells while flaring your elbows, squeezing shoulder blades. Keep back flat.

name: Kettlebell Reverse Curl
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart. | Hold kettlebell with palms facing down. | Lift kettlebell toward shoulders, squeezing biceps, then lower with control.

name: Kettlebell Reverse Lunge
overview: Hold kettlebells at your side. | Step backward, lower body.

name: Kettlebell Romanian Deadlift
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding kettlebells in front. | Hinge at hips, keeping back straight, and lower kettlebells towards ground. | Return to start position, squeezing glutes at the top.

name: Kettlebell Row
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hold a kettlebell in each hand. | Hinge at hips, keep back straight, and pull both kettlebells to hips.

name: Kettlebell Shrug
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart, hold one kettlebell in each hand at your sides. | Lift your shoulders upward while keeping arms straight. | Lower shoulders back down, repeat for desired reps.

name: Kettlebell Silverback Shrug
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart, hold one kettlebell in each hand at your sides, and lean forward. | Lift your shoulders backward while keeping arms straight. | Lower shoulders back down, repeat for desired reps.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Clean And Press
overview: Begin with the kettlebell between your legs. | Hinge at your hips, and lift to shoulder, then press overhead.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Front Rack Forward Lunge
overview: Hold kettlebell in front rack position. | Step forward, lunge. Bringing your back knee to the floor. | Extend your knee and return to the starting position.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Front Rack Reverse Lunge
overview: Hold kettlebell in front rack position. | Step backward, lunge. Bring your back knee to the floor. | Extend your knee back into the starting position.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Snatch
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell between legs. | Squat, grip kettlebell, explode hips, and lift kettlebell overhead. | Lower kettlebell safely to start position.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Swing
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell between legs, grip with one hand, hinge at hips. | Swing kettlebell forcefully forward, using hip thrust, arm straight. | Swing kettlebell back between legs, repeat for desired reps.

name: Kettlebell Staggered Deadlift
overview: Begin with feet hip-width apart, one foot forward, kettlebell between feet. | Hinge at hips, grip kettlebell, and stand tall. | Lower kettlebell with control, then repeat.

name: Kettlebell Staggered Swing
overview: Lower kettlebell with control, then repeat. | Explosively thrust hips forward, swing kettlebell to chest height. | Repeat for desired reps, keeping core engaged and maintaining a staggered stance for balance.

name: Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift
overview: Stand with feet wide apart, toes pointing slightly outward, and kettlebell on the floor between your feet. | Bend at hips and knees, keeping back straight, and grip the kettlebell handle. | Lift the kettlebell by extending hips and knees, stand up straight, and return to the starting position.

name: Swing To Upright Row
primary_muscle: Lower back, Glutes, Hamstrings, Shoulders, Traps, Front Shoulders
overview: Start with a kettlebell between your legs, hinge at hips, swing it upward. | Lift kettlebell to chest level, elbows high, engaging shoulders. | Lower kettlebell back down, maintaining control. Repeat for desired reps.

name: Kettlebell Upright Row
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs. | Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.

name: Kettlebell High Incline Bench Press
overview: Position the bench between 45 and 60 degrees. | Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. | Lower the kettlebells to your mid chest | Raise the kettlebells (slowly and controlled) until you've locked your elbows.

name: Kettlebell Incline Bench Press
overview: Position the bench between 30 and 45 degrees. | Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. | Lower the kettlebells to your mid chest | Raise the kettlebells (slowly and controlled) until you've locked your elbows.

name: Kettlebell Seated Overhead Press
overview: There should be a straight line from your elbow to fist (vertical forearms). | Sit tall and try not to arch your spine as you're pressing. | Press until your elbows are extended and push your head forward slightly.

name: Kettlebell Step Up Double
overview: Standing up straight, using a bench as a step, raise one foot onto the bench and hold the kettlebell in the same arm as the straight leg. | Stand and bring both feet onto the bench. Slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position. | Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Front Rack Step Up
overview: Stand in front of a step or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a kettlebell at one shoulder. | Step up onto the bench with your right foot, pushing off your foot to raise your body up onto the bench.

name: Kettlebell Front Rack Step Up
overview: Stand in front of a step or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold kettlebells at your shoulders. | Step up onto the bench with your right foot, pushing off your foot to raise your body up onto the bench.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Step Up Balance
overview: Begin by standing in front of a sturdy box or bench that is about knee-height, holding a kettlebell in one hand | Place your right foot on the box and push through the heel to lift your body up and onto the box, keeping your left foot off the ground. | Step back down with your right foot, lowering your left foot to the ground.

name: Kettlebell Windmill Bottom Hand
overview: Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart. Hold the kettlebell in your bottom hand and extend the other arm above your head. | Keeping your legs straight and the kettlebell inside your thigh, lower the kettlebell towards the ground, twisting your body towards the side of the raised arm. | Return to the starting position, tilt your pelvis forward and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Farmers March
overview: Stand tall holding two kettlebells in each hand. | March in place for the desired amount of reps or time.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Farmers March
overview: Standing straight with a kettlebell in one hand, lift the knee of one leg off the floor to knee height. | Bring the leg back to standing and repeat with the other leg, keeping the kettlebell on the same side. | Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Walking Farmers March
overview: Standing straight with kettlebells, start walking towards a set point. Pulling your knee up toward the ceiling. | Make sure to keep your chest tall and shoulder blades pulled back. | Try to keep your stride distance roughly the same.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Calf Raise
overview: Stand tall with your feet on the ground. You can put the the balls of your feet on top of a plate to extend the range of motion. | Imagine you have a string attached to your heels and pull your heels up toward the ceiling.

name: Kettlebell Goblet Calf Raise
overview: Standing straight with a kettlebell in a goblet position, raise your heels upwards while keeping your knees stationary. | Pause when your heels are fully extended and then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Leg Single Arm Calf Raise
overview: Standing straight with a kettlebell in one hand, lift the opposing foot off the floor. | Raise your heel upwards while keeping your knees stationary. | Pause when your heels are fully extended and then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Reverse Curl
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart. | Hold a kettlebell with palms facing down. | Lift kettlebell toward shoulders, squeezing biceps, then lower with control.

name: Kettlebell Upright Row Single
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs. | Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Row On Bench
overview: Start by standing in front of a flat bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a kettlebell in one hand. | Place your other hand on the bench for support, and bend at the waist so that your chest is parallel to the ground. | From this starting position, row the kettlebell up towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blade together as you do so. | Make sure to keep your elbow close to your body and your core engaged throughout the movement.

name: Kettlebell Seated Calf Raise Double
overview: Start by sitting on a bench with a barbell resting on your knees. Your feet should be flat on the ground, about hip-width apart. | Place your hands on the barbell for support, and lift your heels off the ground. | Hold this position for a moment, then slowly lower your heels back to the ground.

name: Kettlebell Bench Wrist Extension
overview: Grab two kettlebells with an overhand grip and lay your forearms across a bench. | Let your wrists flex fully, then extend your wrists.

name: Kettlebell Bench Wrist Curl
overview: Grip the kettlebells with your palm facing upwards with your forearm rested against the bench. | Slowly curl your wrist upwards in a semicircular motion. | Return to starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Floor Press
overview: Start flat on your back with the kettlebells extended over you. | Bring your elbows to the floor, rest for a second to remove all the momentum from the rep, then press to a lockout.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Floor Press
overview: Start flat on your back with a kettlebell extended over you. | Bring your elbow to the floor, rest for a second to remove all the momentum from the rep, then press to a lockout.

name: Kettlebell Overhead Tricep Extension
overview: Be careful getting the KB into place overhead. Push your elbows forward while keeping your elbows tucked in. | Look for what feels like a stretch in your triceps. Extend your elbows until your fists are pointed at the ceiling.

name: Kettlebell Bottoms Up Single Arm Overhead Press
overview: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding one kettlebell with the bottom of the kettlebell facing up. | Bring the kettlebell to your shoulders, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent. | From this starting position, extend your arms upwards so that the kettlebell are overhead. | Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.

name: Kettlebell Bottoms Up Overhead Press
overview: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a kettlebell in each hand with the bottom of the kettlebell facing up. | Bring the kettlebells to your shoulders, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent. | From this starting position, extend your arms upwards so that the kettlebells are overhead. | Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Farmers Walk
overview: Standing straight with a kettlebell in one hand, walk for a specified distance or duration. | Stay upright and don't lean to one side.

name: Kettlebell Suitcase Deadlift
primary_muscle: Lower back, Glutes, Hamstrings, Obliques, Hands
overview: Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart and holding a kettlebell at one side of your body, with your palms facing your thighs. | Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, bend at the hips and knees to lower the kettlebell down towards the ground. | As the kettlebell reaches the ground, use your legs and glutes to push through your heels and extend your hips and knees to raise your body back to the starting position. | Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat the exercise with the kettlebell on the opposite side of your body.

name: Kettlebell Box Squat
overview: Stand in front of a box or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart with a kettlebell in a goblet position. | Lower your body into a squat position, sitting back onto the box and pausing for a moment before standing back up. | Push through your heels to return to the standing position.

name: Kettlebell Kickstand Squat
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart, one foot slightly behind. Hold kettlebell in a goblet position. | Lower into a squat, keeping weight on front heel. | Return to standing, engaging glutes and core.

name: Kettlebell Incline Guillotine Bench Press
overview: Lie on bench, hold kettlebell with both hands over chest. | Lower kettlebells, elbows flared. | Press kettlebells upward, fully extending arms. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Swing Lunge
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder-width. Kettlebell at your side. | Step forward with your right foot and bend both knees to lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. | Push off your right foot to return to the starting position. | Step back with the same leg until the back knee taps the floor.

name: Kettlebell Alternating Curtsy Lunge
overview: Hold a kettlebell at your chest, feet hip-width apart. | Step one leg diagonally back into a lunge. | Alternate legs, keeping your chest up and core engaged.

name: Kettlebell Alternating Lateral Lunge
overview: Hold one kettlebell with one or both hands, feet hip-width apart. | Step out to one side, bending the knee. | Push off, return to center, then switch sides.

name: Kettlebell Alternating Reverse Lunge
overview: Hold two kettlebells by your side. | Take a big step backwards with your left leg, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground and your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle. | Push back up and switch legs, alternating each rep.

name: Kettlebell Alternating Forward Lunge
overview: Stand tall, holding kettlebells by your sides, feet hip-width apart. | Step forward with one leg, lowering until both knees form 90° angles. | Push through front foot, return to start, and switch legs.

name: Kettlebell Assisted Bulgarian Split Squat
overview: Grab a stick of some sort or hold onto something stable (rack, bench). | Grab a box that is knee height or slightly lower. | Hold the stick in your right arm, kettlebell in the other and put your right leg on the box. | Begin your squat by breaking at the knees. Get your knee close to the floor or all the way to the floor. Make sure to keep your chest tall.

name: Kettlebell Kneeling Bottoms Up Overhead Press
overview: Start by taking a kneeling position and holding a kettlebell in each hand with the bottom of the kettlebell facing up. | Bring the kettlebells to your shoulders, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent. | From this starting position, extend your arms upwards so that the kettlebells are overhead. | Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.

name: Kettlebell Front Rack Deficit Reverse Lunge
overview: Stand on a platform, kettlebells in front rack position, feet hip-width apart. | Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged. | Push through front foot, return to start.

name: Kettlebell Staggered Waiters Bow
overview: Set up a bar at mid way up your quad. Place the working leg against the bar. | Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time. | Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring. | When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.

name: Kettlebell Deficit Reverse Lunge
overview: Stand on a platform, kettlebells in each hand, feet hip-width apart. | Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged. | Push through front foot, return to start.

name: Kettlebell Waiters Bow
overview: Place a barbell at about midway up your thigh. Press your quads into the barbell. | Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. | When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

name: Kettlebell Quad Stomp
overview: Place your foot on a plate or a low box. Hold two kettlebells in each hand. | Put all of your weight on your front foot and lean forward. | Lower until your calves touch your hamstrings and then extend back up.

name: Kettlebell Half Kneeling Romanian Deadlift
overview: Place one knee on a bench and hold a kettlebell. | Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. | When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

name: Kettlebell Half Kneeling Goblet Romanian Deadlift
overview: Place one knee on a bench and hold a kettlebell in a goblet position. | Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. | When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

name: Chest Stretch Variation Four
overview: Raise your arms to shoulder height, fully extended in front of you. | Slowly bring your arms behind your back still at shoulder height. | Pause for a few seconds and then return to starting position.

name: Chest Stretch Variation Three
overview: Place your arms behind your back and clasp your hands together. | Slowly extend your elbows until they are locked then lift them away from you. | Pause in this position for a few seconds and then return them to starting position.

name: Chest Stretch Variation Two
overview: Lay on your side with one hand just in front of you. | With a slight bend in your arm, rotate your arm around your body as slowly as possible. | Return to the starting position and then repeat on the other side.

name: Chest Stretch Variation One
overview: Using a raised wall, place your arm at a 90 degree angle against it. | With a staggered stance, lean into the wall extending your chest. | Pause for a few seconds and then return to starting position and repeat on opposite side.

name: Quads Stretch Variation Four
overview: Lay flat on your belly. Extend one arm out in front of you, placing your palm on the floor. With your other arm, grab the top of your foot. | Keeping your upper leg flat on the floor, pull your foot towards your buttocks to engage the stretch. | Pause for a few seconds, and then repeat the stretch with your other leg.

name: Quads Stretch Variation Three
overview: Lay flat on your belly, with both hands reach back and grab the tops of your feet. | Keeping your upper legs flat on the ground, pull both of your feet towards your buttocks. | Pause at the apex of the stretch, then return to starting position.

name: Quads Stretch Variation Two
overview: Place one foot flat on the ground in front of you at a 90 degree angle. With your other leg, balance upon your knee, placing the tip of your foot against the wall behind you for balance. | Place your hands on your knee in front of you, and lean forward so that your knee extends over your foot. | Pause at the apex of the stretch, and slowly return to starting position. Repeat with your other leg.

name: Quads Stretch Variation One
overview: Stand perpendicular to a wall, using one arm against the wall for balance. With your other arm, grab the top of your foot. | Pull your leg upwards and back to engage your quads, pausing at the apex of the stretch for a few seconds. | Return to starting position and repeat with your other leg.

name: Traps Stretch Variation Three
overview: Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart. | Nod your head forward, bringing your chin to your chest. | You will feel the stretch across your neck.

name: Traps Stretch Variation Two
overview: Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart. | Keeping your chest facing forward, turn your head 90 degrees to the left. Then return to centre point. | Repeat, turning your head in the other direction.

name: Traps Stretch Variation One
overview: Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart. | Place your left hand on your head and gently pull your head down towards your left shoulder. Then return to centre point. | Repeat, using your right hand pulling towards your right shoulder.

name: Triceps Stretch Variation Three
overview: Bend your left arm so your hand is at your shoulder, and hold your elbow with the opposite hand. | Gently push on your elbow so it is raised by your head. | Hold the stretch for a few seconds then repeat with the other arm.

name: Triceps Stretch Variation Two
overview: Hold a band so it is in line with your spine. Hold the top with your right hand and the bottom with your left. | Keeping the top still, pull down on the band. | Hold the stretch for a few seconds then repeat with the other arm.

name: Triceps Stretch Variation One
overview: Raise your left arm above your head, and bend at the elbow so your hand is resting at the top of your back. | Use the opposite hand to gently apply pressure to the elbow. | Hold the stretch for a few seconds then repeat with the other arm.

name: Shoulders Stretch Variation Four
overview: Stand with you feet shoulder width apart. Place one arm across the front of your chest at shoulder height, press the forearm of your other arm above the elbow, hooking the stretching arm with your hand. | Press the arm until it is straight and rotate your upper torso to engage the stretch even deeper. | Repeat with your other arm.

name: Shoulders Stretch Variation Three
overview: Place the top of your hand into the small of your back, your arm at a 90 degree angle. | Hold your elbow with the other arm, and slowly pull the arm forward until you feel your shoulder engaged in the stretch. Pause at the apex of the stretch and return to the starting position. | Return to starting position, and repeat with your other arm.

name: Shoulders Stretch Variation Two
overview: Start with your arms at either side. Begin by pushing your shoulders forward and in towards your chest. | Continue the circular motion with your shoulders, pinching up towards your ears, and then extending your chest outwards while you finish the motion. | Repeat as necessary.

name: Shoulders Stretch Variation One
overview: Reach one arm behind your body, with your elbow pointing upward behind your head. | Assist the stretch with your other hand on your elbow to engage your shoulder. | Pause for a few seconds, then repeat the stretch with your other arm.

name: Lats Stretch Variation Three
overview: Find a wall to lean against, lay your tricep against the wall with your hand behind your back. | Slowly lean into the wall. | Return to starting position, then switch sides.

name: Lats Stretch Variation Two
overview: Stand up right and raise your hand to a full stretch above your head. | Slowly lean across your body and trace the opposite hand down your leg. | Hold at the bottom of the stretch, return to starting position and then switch sides.

name: Lats Stretch Variation One
overview: Place both hands on the wall in front of you. | Slowly lower your body until you feel the stretch. | Hold at the bottom of the stretch, return to starting position.

name: Hamstrings Stretch Variation Four
overview: Sit on the floor with your legs out in front of you. | Reach forward to try and touch your toes. Reach as far forward as you can go. | Hold the stretch for a few seconds then return to starting position.

name: Hamstrings Stretch Variation Three
overview: Sit on the floor with one leg outstretched and the other bent at the knee, foot resting on the opposite inner thigh. | Reach forward to touch the toes of the outstretched leg. | Hold the stretch for a few seconds then return to starting position.

name: Hamstrings Stretch Variation Two
overview: Stand with one foot in front of the other. | Bend your rear leg as much as you can, keeping the front leg straight. | Hold the stretch for a few seconds then return to starting position.

name: Hamstrings Stretch Variation One
overview: Lie down with your legs reaching up the wall. your bum should be slightly off the floor. | Bend one leg and leave the other outstretched. | Push your thigh towards the wall. | Hold the stretch for a few seconds then return to starting position.

name: Glutes Stretch Variation Three
overview: Lay flat and bring your left leg to 90 degrees. | Hold your left leg with both hands and slowly rotate your hips to the right hand side. | Hold at the peak of the stretch, then slowly return to starting position. | Switch sides and repeat.

name: Glutes Stretch Variation Two
overview: Sit on the ground and lay one leg flat and the other over the top. | Hold your leg with the same side arm and slowly rotate your hips and back. | Hold at the peak of the stretch, then slowly return to starting position. | Switch sides and repeat.

name: Glutes Stretch Variation One
overview: On your front, place one leg forward and then stretch out the same side arm across the mat/floor. | Fully extend your leg and arm. | Hold at the peak of the stretch, then slowly return to starting position. | Switch sides and repeat.

name: Forearms Stretch Variation Four
overview: Raise your arm to shoulder height at 90 degrees to your body. | Press lightly on your hand and push towards you. | Rotate the arm across your body. | Switch sides and repeat.

name: Forearms Stretch Variation Three
overview: Place your hands together. | Rotate your arms and hands 180 degrees. | Hold at the peak of the stretch. | Return to starting position.

name: Forearms Stretch Variation Two
overview: Place your hand against a wall, palms facing upward, with finger tips touching. | Slowly lean into your palm. | Hold at the peak of the stretch. | Return to starting position.

name: Forearms Stretch Variation One
overview: Place your palm flush against the wall. | Take one step forward and straighten your arm slowly to extend your bicep. | Hold at the peak of the stretch. | Return to starting position.

name: Calves Stretch Variation Three
overview: Balance the balls of your feet on the platform, leaning forward to use the wall to assist with balance. Engage your calves so that your feet are flat before beginning the stretch. | Lower the heels of your feet towards the ground and pause, then push through the balls of your feet like you are standing tip toe, pausing at the apex of the stretch. | Repeat as necessary.

name: Calves Stretch Variation Two
overview: With both feet flat on the ground, place one leg in front of your shoulder, your other leg should mirror this position behind your other shoulder. In the starting position both of your knees should be straight. | Place the palms of your hands against the wall at shoulder height in front of you, lean towards the wall and bend your front leg at the knee while keeping your back leg straight. | Pause at the apex of the stretch and return to the starting position. Switch the position of your legs and repeat.

name: Calves Stretch Variation One
overview: Place the ball of your foot against the wall with your heel on the ground. Place your hands on the wall in front of your shoulders. | Keeping your knee straight, slowly lean towards the wall, pause for a few seconds when you feel the stretch extending through your calf muscle. | Return to the starting position, and repeat the stretch with your other leg.

name: Abdominals Stretch Variation Four
overview: Lay on a ball or a Bosu ball with your feet firmly planted on the floor. | Lean all the way back until you feel a stretch in your abdomen. | Crunch upwards and hold for a 1-2 count. | Slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Abdominals Stretch Variation Three
overview: Stand upright. | After completing the desired amount of reps with the left arm, switch to the right arm and lean to the left. | Reach up with your left arm and then lean slowly to the right. Lean until a stretch is felt in the obliques.

name: Abdominals Stretch Variation Two
overview: Stand upright. | Reach with both hands upwards until you can interlock your fingers. | With your hands above your head, lean back until a stretch is felt in the abdominals.

name: Abdominals Stretch Variation One
overview: Lay on your stomach on the floor with your forearms flat on the ground. | Extend your elbows and push your upper body upwards. | Push your upper body upwards until you feel a stretch in your abs, then return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Lower back Stretch Variation Four
overview: Lay flat against the ground with your knees at an angle and your feet flat against the floor. | Grab your legs just below the knees, and pull your legs towards your chest. | Pause at the apex of the stretch, then return to the starting position.

name: Lower back Stretch Variation Three
overview: Lay on your back with your arms at either side. | Raise your knees so that they are pointing straight towards the ceiling. Keeping your legs pressed together, rotate your hips to either side. | Repeat this motion as necessary.

name: Lower back Stretch Variation Two
overview: Lay flat on the floor with your arms at either side. | With one leg, hook one foot under the joint of your other leg. | Rotate your hips so that your knees are pointing sideways, keeping your hooked leg flat against the floor. | Pause at the apex of the stretch and repeat with your other leg.

name: Lower back Stretch Variation One
overview: Sit on the floor with the tops of your feet pointed and flat on the ground. Move your arms out in front of you in the diving position, placing your palms flat against the ground. | With your arms fully extended, rest your buttocks on the heels of your feet, you can crawl your hands forward to extend the stretch if need be. | Hold the extended position for a few seconds, and return to starting position.

name: Traps mid back Stretch Variation Two
overview: Sit on the ground and lay one leg flat and the other over the top. | Hold your leg with the same side arm and slowly rotate your hips and back. | Hold at the peak of the stretch, then slowly return to starting position. | Switch sides and repeat.

name: Traps mid back Stretch Variation One
overview: Stand up with your feet shoulder width apart. Place one arm across the front of your chest at shoulder height, press the forearm of your other arm above the elbow, hooking the stretching arm with your hand. | Press the arm until it is straight and rotate your upper torso to engage the stretch even deeper. | Repeat with your other arm.

name: Alternating Pole Rotation
overview: Start with the pole in front of you with an overhand wider than shoulder width grip. | Rotate one arm overhead and behind while keeping the other arm in front of you. | Then rotate the other arm. | Bring the original arm back to the starting position, then the other arm. Repeat.

name: Pole Rotation
overview: Start with the pole in front of you with an overhand wider than shoulder width grip. | Rotate both arms overhead and behind you while leaving your elbows mostly extended.

name: Cable Rope Face Pulls
overview: Facing the pulley, pull the weight towards you while keeping your arms parallel to the ground. | Pull your hands back to both sides of your head and hold the position. | Slowly return weight to starting position. Repeat.

name: Cable Pec Fly
overview: Use a handle attachment set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | Bring both of the handles to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover. | Walk a few steps forward. Then press the weight forward. From there, your shoulders should horizontally abduct and adduct while your elbows stay in a fixed position.

name: Cable Chest Press
overview: Use a handle attachment. The cables should be set to shoulder height. | Bring both of the handles to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover. | Walk a few steps forward. Then press the weight forward. | From there, you should flex and extend at both the shoulders and elbows simultaneously.

name: Cable Goblet Squat
overview: Start with a straight bar or easy bar attachment . | Get your elbows directly underneath the bar, squat straight up and then walk back a few steps. | Break at your knees and hips to initiate the squat. Make sure you maintain a flat back. | Squat all the way back to a standing position.

name: Cable Split Squat
overview: You can use a straight or EZ bar on this exercise. Cable should be set all to the bottom. | Grab the attachment and walk back a few steps. Take a split stance. One leg in front and one behind. | Break at the knees and hips to initiate the split squat. Make sure your back knee touches the floor. | Squat back up into a standing position.

name: Cable Bar Romanian Deadlift
overview: Start with a straight bar or ez bar attachment set to the bottom of the machine. Squat the weight up into a standing position and walk a few steps back | Push your butt back to initiate the movement and then push your butt forward until you're back in a standing position. | To protect yourself from injury, always maintain a flat back on any exercise.

name: Cable Single Leg Deadlift
overview:
Start with a straight bar or easy bar attachment. Squat the weight up into a standing position and walk a few steps back. | Push your butt back to initiate the movement while lifting one of your legs.
Then push your butt forward until you're back in a standing position. | Compete your given amount of reps, then switch to opposite leg. | To protect yourself from injury, always maintain a flat back.

name: Cable Pull Through
overview:
This exercise works best with a rope attachment but can be done with anything. The attachment should be set to the bottom of the machine. | Face away from the cable machine, straddle the cable itself, and grab the attachment.
Walk a few steps away. | Break at the hips while maintaining a flat back and mostly extended knees. | Push hips forward until you are back in a standing position.

name: Cable Standing Hip Abduction
overview: Use an ankle attachment. Cable should be set all the way to the bottom. | Face sideways with the ankle attachment on your outside leg. Walk a few steps away. | Abduct at the hips and raise your leg out to the side. | Return to the starting position and stop just short of your foot touching back to the ground (to keep tension on the muscle).

name: Cable Standing Straight Leg Glute Kickback
overview: Use an ankle attachment. The cable should be set to the bottom of the crossover machine. | Push your ankle straight back, extending at the hip. Hold for a one count when you feel a contraction in your glutes. | Then flex at the hips until you are back into your original position.

name: Cable Hamstring Curl
overview: Use an ankle attachment with the cable set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | Stand upright or try bending slightly forward. | Flex at the knee and pull your ankle straight back.

name: Cable Overhead Press
overview: Use a handle attachment with the cable set to the bottom of the machine. Stand upright making sure to maintain a flat back. Your starting position will have your palms facing forward. | Use both your elbows and shoulders to press the weight directly overhead.

name: Cable Low Single Arm Lateral Raise
overview: Use a handle attachment with the cable set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | You should vertically abduct at the shoulder raising your arm straight out to the side. | Raise until your arm is parallel with the ground and then back to the starting position.

name: Cable High Single Arm Rear Delt Fly
overview: Use a handle attachment or no attachment at all. The cable should be set to the top. | Walk a few steps away with the cable coming from the opposing side of the working arm. | From there, your shoulders should horizontally abduct and adduct, while your elbows stay in a fixed position.

name: Cable Upright Row
overview: Use a handle attachment with the cable set to the bottom of the machine. | Pull your elbows straight up toward the ceiling until the attachment is just below your chin then extend until your elbows are fully extended.

name: Cable Wrist Curl
overview: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support. | Start with your elbow at a 90° angle with your palm facing up. Flex and extend at the wrist.

name: Cable Wrist Extension
overview: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support. | Start with your elbow at a 90 degree angle with your palm facing down. Flex and extend at the wrist.

name: Cable Lat Prayer
overview: You can use any attachment. Cable should be set all the way to the top of the machine. | Grab your attachment and walk a few steps back. Push your butt back to where you are leaning forward. Your ears should be between your arms. | Initiate the movement with your shoulders and not your elbows. As you flex at the shoulder joint push your hips forward until your hips meet the attachment.

name: Cable Bent Over Bar Pullover
overview: You can use any attachment. Cable should be set all the way to the top of the machine. | Grab your attachment and walk a few steps back. Push your butt back to where you are leaning forward somewhat. | Initiate the movement with your shoulders and not your elbows. Imagine trying to pull the attachment through your thighs at the bottom.

name: Cable Pull In
overview: Use a handle attachment set all the way to the top of the cable crossover machine. | Walk a few steps away from the cable machine. Face your body sideways. | Face your palm up toward the ceiling. Then pull your elbow in toward your rib cage.

name: Cable 30 Degree Shrug
overview: Use a handle attachment on both sides of crossover. With cable attachment set all the way to the bottom. | Grab both handles and make sure you are centered in the machine. Let your arms hang freely. | Pull your shoulder blades up and in towards your ears. Let your shoulder blades depress back to the starting position.

name: Cable Silverback Shrug
overview: Use a bar attachment. Cable should be set all the way to the bottom. | Stand up with the attachment in hand, walk a couple of steps back make sure you are standing upright and not leaning backwards. | Retract your shoulder blades and then protract to return to the starting position.

name: Cable Single Arm Bayesian Curl
overview: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | Face away from the cable machine. | Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support. Face your palm forward. Flex at the elbow and extend.

name: Cable Single Arm Reverse Curl
overview: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support. | Face your palm downwards. Flex at the elbow and extend.

name: Cable Rope Pushdown
overview: The cable should be set all the way at the top of the machine. | Make sure to keep your upper arm glued at your side. Extend your elbows until you feel your triceps contract.
instructions: Set Up | Grab onto the rope and take a few steps back. You can start with your elbows in an extended or flexed position. | Push your butt back slightly. This will get your hips out of the way giving your arms enough room to fully extend. | Performing The Cable Pushdown | My favorite cue to use on the Tricep Push Down is, "T-Rex arms." It's extremely important that you keep your upper arm and your elbows glued to your side. Your elbow joint should be causing the movement and your forearm should be the only moving body part. This will keep the stress and tension purely on your triceps and not recruit other body parts. Make sure to fully extend and flex your elbows on each rep. | Be careful of swinging and bouncing on this exercise. It is very common to use too much weight on this exercise. If you find yourself having to use momentum, the weight is too heavy. | Also, if you notice your shoulders beginning to roll forward on the concentric, the weight is too heavy. Your central nervous system is extremely intelligent and will help you get from point A to point B by any means necessary. It will begin trying to recruit your anterior deltoid and pec major by rolling your shoulders forward on top of the rope or straight bar so you can press the weight down instead of performing a strict Triceps Extension.

name: Cable Cross Pushdown
overview: Either use two handles or no attachment at all. Both sides of the cable crossover should be set to the top. | Stand in the center of the machine holding each Cable in the opposing hand. Your upper arm should be at a 45 degree angle with your torso. | Extend your elbows until you feel a contraction and then return to the starting position

name: Cable Rope Skullcrusher
overview: You can use a straight bar, rope, easy bar, or two handles. The cable should be set all the way to the top of the machine. | Face away from the machine with your elbows up and the attachment just behind your head. | Extend at the elbows until you feel a contraction in your triceps and then flex at the elbow back to the starting position.

name: Cable Rope Overhead Tricep Extension
overview: You can use any attachment. The cable should be all the way to the bottom of the machine. Face away from the machine. | Point your elbows straight up toward the ceiling. | From there, extend your elbows until your fists are pointed straight toward the ceiling.

name: Cable Calve Raise
overview: Use a straight bar or ez bar attachment with the cable set all the way to the bottom. | Walk a few steps back. | Pull your heels straight up until you feel a contraction in your calves and then back to original position.

name: Cable Standing Leg Extension
overview: Stand upright facing away from the cable crossover with the cable set to the height of your hips. Use an ankle/wrist attachment. | Extend at the knee against the cable.

name: Cable Wood Chopper
overview: Set the cable at about nipple level. Use a handle attachment. | Face sideways, then rotate your torso with your arms extended against the resistance. | After completing your given number of reps, face the opposite direction and repeat.

name: Cable Standing Crunch
overview: Use a double handle attachment and set the cable all the way to the top. | Face away from the cable tower and walk a few steps forward. | Push your hips back, and flex your abs. | Return to the starting standing position and repeat.

name: Cable Row Bar Kneeling Crunch
overview: Use a double handle attachment and set the cable all the way to the top. | Walk a few steps forward then fall into a kneeling position. | Push your hips back and flex your abs, then push hips forward until in the starting position.

name: Cable Pallof Press
overview: Use a handle attachment, set the cable at nipple level, walk a few steps away, and face sideways. | Start with both hands on the handle and your fists against your chest. | Press the handle forward until your elbows are fully extended, then pull the handle back to your chest.

name: Cable Zercher Squat
overview: Start with a straight bar or easy bar attachment . | Place the bar in your elbows, squat straight up and then walk back a few steps. | Break at your knees and hips to initiate the squat. Make sure you maintain a flat back. | Squat all the way back to a standing position.

name: Cable Tricep Kickback
overview: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set to hip height. | Hinge forward. Make sure to keep your upper arm glued at your side. Extend your elbows until you feel your triceps contract.

name: Cable Row Bar Standing Row
overview: Place the cable at shoulder height. Use a row bar. | Pull the handles back using your arms. Push out your chest. | Pull the handles towards your body until your hands are beside your abdomen.

name: Cable Single Arm Underhand Grip Row
overview: Place the cable at shoulder height. Use a handle attachment. Face your palm upward. | Pull the handle back using your arms. Push out your chest. | Pull the handle towards your body until your hands are beside your abdomen.

name: Cable Single Arm Neutral Grip Row
overview: Place the cable at shoulder height. Use a handle attachment. Face your palm toward the midline of your body. | Pull the handle back using your arms. Push out your chest. | Pull the handle towards your body until your hands are beside your abdomen.

name: Cable Single Arm Rear Delt Row
overview: Use a handle attachment, grab with an overhand grip and take a position with the cable crossing your body. | Pull your elbows back while flaring your elbows outward.

name: Cable Supinating Row
overview: Place the cable at shoulder height. | Start with an overhand grip. As you pull your elbow back, rotate your palm until it faces upward.

name: Cable Archer Row
overview: Place the cable at shoulder height. | On the same side as the working arm, step back and rotate outwards. | Pull your elbow back while flaring your elbow out.

name: Cable Half Kneeling Low To High Wood Chopper
overview: Set the cable at a low position. Take a half kneeling position. Use a handle attachment. | Face sideways, then rotate your torso with your arms extended against the resistance. | After completing your given number of reps, face the opposite direction and repeat.

name: Cable Half Kneeling Wood Chopper
overview: Set the cable at nipple level. Take a half kneeling position. Use a handle attachment. | Face sideways, then rotate your torso with your arms extended against the resistance. | After completing your given number of reps, face the opposite direction and repeat.

name: Cable Half Kneeling High To Low Wood Chopper
overview: Set the cable just over your head. Take a half kneeling position. Use a handle attachment. | Face sideways, then rotate your torso with your arms extended against the resistance. | After completing your given number of reps, face the opposite direction and repeat.

name: Cable Straight Arm Pull In
overview: Use a handle attachment set all the way to the top of the cable crossover machine. | Walk a few steps away from the cable machine. Face your body sideways. | Face your palm forward. Then pull your elbow in toward your rib cage.

name: Cable Rope Lat Prayer
overview: Use a rope attachment. Cable should be set all the way to the top of the machine. | Grab your attachment and walk a few steps back. Push your butt back to where you are leaning forward. Your ears should be between your arms. | Initiate the movement with your shoulders and not your elbows. As you flex at the shoulder joint push your hips forward until your hips meet the attachment.

name: Cable Rope Pullover
overview: Use a rope attachment. Cable should be set all the way to the top of the machine. | Grab your attachment and walk a few steps back. Push your butt back to where you are leaning forward somewhat. | Initiate the movement with your shoulders and not your elbows. Imagine trying to pull the attachment through your thighs at the bottom.

name: Cable Seated Bayesian Reverse Curl
overview: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | Face away from the cable machine and sit on the bench. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support. | Face your palm downwards. Flex at the elbow and extend.

name: Cable Seated Bayesian Curl
overview: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | Sit on a bench facing away from the cable machine. | Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support. Face your palm forward. Flex at the elbow and extend.

name: Cable Single Arm Incline Chest Fly
overview: Place the cable anchor at a lower level than your shoulders. | Sit on the bench, leave your elbows mostly extended. | Bring your arm across your chest and flex your pec.

name: Cable Single Arm Incline Bench Press
overview: Use a handle attachment. Bring a bench over to the cables. The cable should be set fairly low. | Bring the handle across your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover. | From there, you should flex and extend at both the shoulder and elbow simultaneously.

name: Cable Single Arm Bench Chest Fly
overview: Bring a bench over to the cables, set the cable just below shoulder height. | Bring the handle to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover. | Press the weight forward. From there, your shoulder should horizontally abduct and adduct while your elbow stays in a fixed position.

name: Cable Single Arm Bench Press
overview: Use a handle attachment. Bring a bench over to the cables. The cable should be set to shoulder height. | Bring the handle to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover. | From there, you should flex and extend at both the shoulder and elbow simultaneously.

name: Cable Single Arm Decline Bench Chest Fly
overview: Bring a bench over to the cables, set the cable above shoulder height. | Bring the handle to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover. | Press the weight forward. From there, your shoulders should horizontally abduct and adduct while your elbow stays in a fixed position.

name: Cable Decline Single Arm Bench Press
overview: Use a handle attachment. Bring a bench over to the cables. The cable should be set above shoulder height. | Bring one handles to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover. | From there, you should flex and extend at both the shoulders and elbows simultaneously.

name: Cable Incline Chest Fly
overview: Place the cable anchor at a lower level than your shoulders. | Sit on the bench, leave your elbows mostly extended. | Bring your fists together and flex your pecs.

name: Cable Incline Bench Press
overview: Use a handle attachment. Bring a bench over to the cables. The cables should be set fairly low. | Bring both of the handles to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover. | From there, you should flex and extend at both the shoulders and elbows simultaneously.

name: Cable Bench Chest Fly
overview: Bring a bench over to the cables, set the cables just below shoulder height. | Bring both of the handles to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover. | Press the weight forward. From there, your shoulders should horizontally abduct and adduct while your elbows stay in a fixed position.

name: Cable Bench Press
overview: Use a handle attachment. Bring a bench over to the cables. The cables should be set to shoulder height. | Bring both of the handles to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover. | From there, you should flex and extend at both the shoulders and elbows simultaneously.

name: Cable Decline Bench Chest Fly
overview: Bring a bench over to the cables, set the cables above shoulder height. | Bring both of the handles to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover. | Press the weight forward. From there, your shoulders should horizontally abduct and adduct while your elbows stay in a fixed position.

name: Cable Decline Bench Press
overview: Use a handle attachment. Bring a bench over to the cables. The cables should be set above height. | Bring both of the handles to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover. | From there, you should flex and extend at both the shoulders and elbows simultaneously.

name: Cable Seated Leg Curl
overview: Bring a bench over to the cable stack, put the cable at head height (when seated). Use an ankle attachment. | Sit on the bench. | Flex at the knee and pull your ankle straight back.

name: Cable Seated Leg Extension
overview: Use an ankle/wrist attachment. Pull the cable under the bench and attach it at your ankle. | Extend at the knee against the cable.

name: Cable Single Leg Laying Leg Curl
overview: Bring a bench over to the cable stack, put the cable all the way at the bottom. Use an ankle attachment. | Lay on the bench. | Flex at the knee and pull your ankle straight back.

name: Cable Rope Kneeling Face Pull
overview: Start with the cables at the top. Use a rope attachment. Fall to a half kneeling position. | Pull the metal piece in the middle of the rope to the bridge of your nose.

name: Cable Rope Kneeling Oblique Crunch
overview: Use a rope attachment and set the cable all the way to the top. | Walk a few steps forward then fall into a kneeling position. | Push your hips back and flex your abs, then push hips forward until in the starting position.

name: Cable Rope Kneeling Crunch
overview: Use a rope attachment and set the cable all the way to the top. | Walk a few steps forward then fall into a kneeling position. | Push your hips back and flex your abs, then push hips forward until in the starting position.

name: Cable Quadruped Hip Abduction
overview: Use an ankle attachment. Cable should be set all the way to the bottom. | Take a quadruped position with the cable going across your planted leg. | Abduct at the hips and raise your leg out to the side. | Return to the starting position and stop just short of the cables touching back down (to keep tension on the muscle).

name: Cable Incline Bench Straight Leg Kickback
overview: Use an ankle attachment. Bring a bench over to the cables. Put the bench at incline level. The cable should be set to shoulder height. | Push your ankle straight back, extending at the hip. Hold for a one count when you feel a contraction in your glutes. | Then flex at the hips until you are back into your original position.

name: Cable Bench Straight Leg Kickback
overview: Use an ankle attachment. Bring a bench over to the cables. The cable should be set to hip height. | Push your ankle straight back, extending at the hip. Hold for a one count when you feel a contraction in your glutes. | Then flex at the hips until you are back into your original position.

name: Cable Standing Hip Adduction
overview: Bring the cable all the way to the bottom of the stack. Use an ankle attachment. | Keeping your feet together, move your legs out to the sides and then back to the midline of your body. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Cable Standing Mid Kickback
overview: Use an ankle attachment. The cable should be set halfway up the crossover machine. | Start with a bent knee position. Push your ankle straight back, extending at the hip. Hold for a one count when you feel a contraction in your glutes. | Then flex at the hips until you are back into your original position.

name: Cable Standing Straight Leg Mid Kickback
overview: Use an ankle attachment. The cable should be set to halfway up the crossover machine. | Push your ankle straight back, extending at the hip. Hold for a one count when you feel a contraction in your glutes. | Then flex at the hips until you are back into your original position.

name: Cable Standing Glute Kickback
overview: Use an ankle attachment. The cable should be set to the bottom of the crossover machine. | Break at the knee, push your ankle straight back, extending at the hip. Hold for a one count when you feel a contraction in your glutes. | Then flex at the hips until you are back into your original position.

name: Cable Low Bilateral Lateral Raise
overview: Use a handle attachment with the cable set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | You should vertically abduct at the shoulder raising your arms straight out to the side. | Raise until your arms are parallel with the ground and then back to the starting position.

name: Cable Bar Front Raise
overview: Face away from the cables. | With your elbows extended raise your fists straight up to the ceiling until they are at eye level.

name: Cable Zercher Good Morning
overview: Begin by standing with your feet about hip-width apart and holding the bar in the crook of your elbows, with your palms facing towards your body. | Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, bend at the hips and lower your torso forward until it is nearly parallel to the ground. | Push through your heels to extend your hips and raise your body back to the starting position.

name: Cable Bar Staggered Romanian Deadlift
overview: Start with a straight bar attachment set to the bottom of the machine. Squat the weight up into a standing position and walk a few steps back. | Stand with a staggered stance. Push your butt back to initiate the movement and then push your butt forward until you're back in a standing position. | To protect yourself from injury, always maintain a flat back on any exercise.

name: Cable Bar Reverse Grip Curl
overview: Use a bar attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | Face the cable machine. | Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support. Face your palm down. Flex at the elbow and extend.

name: Cable Bar Curl
overview: Use a bar attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | Face the cable machine. | Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support. Face your palm forward. Flex at the elbow and extend.

name: Cable Bar Reverse Grip Pushdown
overview: Use the bar attachment. The cable should be set all the way at the top of the machine. Grab the bar with n overhand grip. | Make sure to keep your upper arm glued at your side. Extend your elbows until you feel your triceps contract.

name: Cable Bar Pushdown
overview: Use the bar attachment. The cable should be set all the way at the top of the machine. | Make sure to keep your upper arm glued at your side. Extend your elbows until you feel your triceps contract.

name: Cable Rope Single Arm Low Lateral Raise
overview: Use a rope attachment with the cable set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | You should vertically abduct at the shoulder raising your arms straight out to the side. | Raise until your arms are parallel with the ground and then back to the starting position.

name: Cable Rope Mid Lateral Raise
overview: Place the cable at the same height as your fist when your arms are at your side and stand with the cable crossing your body. | While keeping your elbow mostly extended, lift your arm until it's parallel with the floor.

name: Cable Single Arm Skullcrusher
overview: Stand facing away from the cable, which is at the top of the cable stack. | Keep your elbow pointed forward, and extend and flex your elbow.

name: Cable Rope Front Raise
overview: Face away from the cables. Use a rope attachment. | With your elbows extended raise your fists straight up to the ceiling until they are at eye level.

name: Cable Single Arm Rope Pushdown
overview: Use the rope attachment. The cable should be set all the way at the top of the machine. | Make sure to keep your upper arm glued at your side. Extend your elbows until you feel your triceps contract.

name: Cable Rope Upright Row
overview: Use a rope attachment with the cable set to the bottom of the machine. | Pull your elbows straight up toward the ceiling until the attachment is just below your chin then extend until your elbows are fully extended.

name: Cable Rope Hammer Curl
overview: Use a rope attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support. | Use a neutral grip thumb facing up pinky-facing down). Flex at the elbow and extend.

name: Cable Elevated Deadlift
overview: Start with handles set to the bottom of the machine. Grab a box, stand on top of the box, squat the weight up into a standing position. | Push your butt back to initiate the movement and then push your butt forward until you're back in a standing position. | To protect yourself from injury, always maintain a flat back on any exercise.

name: Cable High Reverse Fly
overview: Use a handle attachment or no attachment at all. The cable should be set to the top. | Walk a few steps away with the cable coming from the opposing side of the working arm. | From there, your shoulders should horizontally abduct and adduct, while your elbows stay in a fixed position.

name: Cable Single Arm Internally Rotated High Reverse Fly
overview: Use a handle attachment or no attachment at all. The cable should be set to the top. | Walk a few steps away with the cable coming from the opposing side of the working arms. Internally rotate the shoulders. | From there, your shoulder should horizontally abduct and adduct, while your elbows stay in a fixed position.

name: Cable High Internally Rotated Reverse Fly
overview: Use a handle attachment or no attachment at all. The cable should be set to the top. | Walk a few steps away with the cable coming from the opposing side of the working arms. Internally rotate the shoulders. | From there, your shoulders should horizontally abduct and adduct, while your elbows stay in a fixed position.

name: Cable Single Arm Cross Pushdown
overview: Either use a handle or no attachment at all. The cable crossover should be set to the top. | Stand in the center of the machine holding the cable in the opposing hand. Your upper arm should be at a 45 degree angle with your torso. | Extend your elbow until you feel a contraction and then return to the starting position

name: Cable Pallof Press Rotation
overview: Use a handle attachment, set the cable at nipple level, walk a few steps away, and face sideways. | Start with both hands on the handle and your fists against your chest. | Press the handle forward until your elbows are fully extended, then rotate away from the cable stack. | Then pull the handle back to your chest.

name: Cable Oblique Pushdown
overview: Set the cable just over your head. Use a handle attachment. | Face sideways, push the handle down until your elbow is extended. Flex your obliques until you feel a contraction. | After completing your given number of reps, face the opposite direction and repeat.

name: Cable Side Bend
overview: Set the cable at the bottom of the stack. Use a handle attachment. | Face sideways, grab the handle, lean away from the cable. | After completing your given number of reps, face the opposite direction and repeat.

name: Cable Bar Calve Raise
overview: Use a straight bar or ez bar attachment with the cable set all the way to the bottom. | Walk a few steps back. | Pull your heels straight up until you feel a contraction in your calves and then back to original position.

name: Cable Hammer Bayesian Curl
overview: Stand facing away from the cables and grab two handle attachments. | Take a neutral grip, flex your elbows, and extend.

name: Cable Reverse Bayesian Curl
overview: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support. | Face your palm downwards. Flex at the elbow and extend.

name: Cable Bayesian Curl
overview: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine. | Face away from the cable machine. | Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support. Face your palm forward. Flex at the elbow and extend.

name: Cable Single Arm 30 Degree Shrug
overview: Use a handle attachment. With the cable attachment set all the way to the bottom. | Grab one handle and make sure you are centered in the machine. Let your arm hang freely. | Pull your shoulder blade up and in towards your ears. Let your shoulder blade depress back to the starting position.

name: Cable High Bayesian Curl
overview: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set to about elbow height. | Face away from the cable machine. | Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support. Face your palm forward. Flex at the elbow and extend.

name: Cable Single Arm Overhead Tricep Extension
overview: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set to your mid-back. Face away from the machine. | Point your elbows straight up toward the ceiling. | From there, extend your elbows until your fists are pointed straight toward the ceiling.

name: Cable Overhead Tricep Press
overview: You can use any attachment. The cable should be even with your mid-back. Face away from the machine. | Point your elbows straight forward. Press the weight straight toward the ceiling. | As you return to the start, push your elbows forward. Try to touch your biceps to your forearms at the bottom of each rep.

name: Cable Internal Rotation
overview: Stand tall, hold the cable handle with a neutral grip, your elbow should be at a 90 degree angle. | Rotate your shoulder by bringing your forearm across your body.

name: Cable External Rotation
overview: Hold the cable handle in one hand,  elbow bent at 90 degrees going across your torso. | Rotate your arm outward, keeping your elbow stable.

name: Cable Kayak Row
overview: Use a bar attachment. Cable should be set all the way to the top of the machine. | Grab your attachment and walk a few steps back. Push your butt back to where you are leaning forward somewhat. | Initiate the movement with your shoulders and not your elbows. Bring one arm to your side. | You can either alternate sides or do one side at a time.

name: Cable Belt Calf Raise
overview: Put on a dip belt and attach the cable carabiner to the chain/strap. | Take a few steps back and stand tall. Raise up onto the balls of your feet and hold for a 1 count.

name: Cable Belt Split Squat
overview: Put on a dip belt and attach the strap/ chain to the cable's carabiner. | Take a few steps back and take a split stance. | Lower into a split squat, letting the weight pull you forward. As you squat back to the starting position push yourself backwards against the resistance.

name: Cable Belt Squat
overview: Put on a dip belt. Attach the strap/chain to the cable's carabiner. | Take a few steps back. Begin to squat by flexing at the knees and hips. | Let the weight pull you forward as you squat. Then push your toes through the front of your shoes as you squat back to the start position.

name: Band Calf Raise
overview: Attach band to a low anchor point. | Take a few steps away until the band is taut. | Lean back slightly. Raise your heels straight up and down

name: Band Single Arm Pec Fly
overview: Attach the band to an anchor point that is about shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut. | Extend your shoulder joint and bring your arm across your body until you feel a contraction in your pecs.

name: Band Single Arm Chest Press
overview: Attach the band to an anchor point that is about shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut. | Extend your shoulder joint and elbow across your body until your arm is fully extended.

name: Band Wood Chopper
overview: Advanced | Pull | Isolation

name: Band Face Pull
overview: Anchor the band at eye level. Take a few steps away until the band is taut. | Use an overhand grip with both hands. Pull the band to the bridge of your nose flaring your elbows out.

name: Band Spanish Squat
overview: Anchor a band to a stable point. | Place the loops of the band behind your knees. | Perform a normal squat and extend your knees against the band at the top.

name: Band Crunch
overview: Place the band at the highest anchor point you have available. Grab both ends of the band and fall into a kneeling position. | Push your hips back flexing at the spine. | Squeeze your abs and then extend at the hips and spine back to the starting position.

name: Band Front Raise
overview: Stand on the band with one or 2 feet depending on how heavy you want the band to be. | With your elbows extended raise your fists straight up to the ceiling until they are at eye level.

name: Band Good Morning
overview: Anchor the band at hip level. Take a few steps away until the band is taut. | Push your hips back while keeping your back flat until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.

name: Band Bayesian Hammer Curl
overview: Attach band to a low anchor point. Use a neutral grip. | Flex your elbow until you feel your biceps contract. Then fully extend elbows.

name: Band Horizontal Shrug
overview: Anchor the band at shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut. | Retract your shoulder blades straight back in schools. Then protract to the starting position.

name: Band Glute Kickback
overview: Get into a quadruped position. Loop the band around both of your wrists and one of your feet. | Extend your knee and hip straight back until you feel like contraction in the glutes. | Flex at the knee until back in the starting position.

name: Band Kneeling Single Arm Pulldown
overview: Place the band at about eye level. Fall into a kneeling position. | The knee that is on the ground should be the same side as the working arm. Stick your chest out. | And then pull your elbow straight back. Flex your lats and then extend into the starting position.

name: Band Lateral Raise
overview: Grab the band at shoulder width. Raise your arms straight out to the side. | The band should scrape against your shirt.

name: Band Leg Press
overview: Lay flat on the ground with your head by the anchor point of the band, which should be 6 to 12 inches above your head | Place the band around your midfoot and extend at the knees and hip.

name: Band Overhead Tricep Extension
overview: Stand with one or both feet on band. Go up and over your head with the band to the starting position. | Flex and extend your elbows.

name: Band Pallof Press
overview: Place the band at an anchor point that is shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut. | Start with your fingers interlocked around the band and your fists connected to your chest. | Extend at the elbows pressing the band away from your body until your elbows are fully extended.

name: Band Pull Apart
overview: Grab the band with a shoulder width grip. Point your arms straight in front of you. | Retract your shoulder blades and shoulder joint until the band taps your chest.

name: Band Pullover
overview: Place the band just above our level. Take a few steps away until the band is taut. | Push your hips back slightly. Extend and flex at the shoulder joint.

name: Band Pullthrough
overview: Anchor the band to the lowest point possible. Straddle the band and then grab with both hands. | Take a few steps away until the band is taut. | Push your butt back until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings. Then extend the hips back into the starting position.

name: Band Pushdown
overview: Place the band just above eye level. Take a few steps away until the band is taut. | Push your hips back slightly. Extend and flex at the elbows.

name: Band Pushup
overview: Loop the band around your mid-back. The ends of the bands should be around your hands between your thumb and pointer finger. | This exercise can be done from the knees or the toes depending on experience level. | Begin by breaking at the elbows until your upper arm is by your side. Then extend at the elbows back into the top position.

name: Band Romanian Deadlift
overview: Stand on your band with both feet. | Hinge forward at the hips while keeping a flat back. | Hinge until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings. | Push your hips back forward until you are in a standing position.

name: Band Bayesian Reverse Curl
overview: Attach band to a low anchor point. . Point your palms toward your thighs. | Flex your elbow until you feel your biceps contract. Then fully extend elbows.

name: Band Row
overview: Stand on your band with both feet. | Hinge forward at the hips while keeping a flat back. | Let your arms hang freely, then pull your elbows straight back toward the ceiling.

name: Band Single Arm Overhead Press
overview: Loop the band under one of your feet. The other end of the bed should be in your hand between your thumb and pointer finger. | Press the band straight up towards the ceiling. Until your elbow is fully extended.

name: Band Shrug
