overview: Place the band under your feet. Stand upright. | Elevate your shoulder blades and then depress back to the starting position.

name: Band Skullcrusher
overview: Anchor a band to a stable point. | Face away and begin with your elbows bent and fists by your temples. | Extend your elbows until your triceps contract.

name: Band Squat
overview: Stand with a shoulder width grip. Both feet should be on the band with the band loops in each of your hand. | Push your butt back and also break at the knees. | Try to hit parallel depth (bottom of your leg should be parallel with the ground). If you can't tell your squat depth, then try squatting in front of a mirror and watch your form.

name: Band High Reverse Curl
overview: Start with a band attached to a high point, your feet staggered, and an overhand grip. | Flex your elbows pulling your forearms to your biceps. Your fists should land by your forehead.

name: Band Chest Fly
overview: Secure two resistance bands to a sturdy anchor point (e.g. a door anchor, a post, etc.) at chest height. | Stand facing away from the anchor point with feet shoulder-width apart and hold each end of the band in each hand. | Start with arms fully extended and parallel to the floor. | Keeping arms straight, slowly bring your arms together in front of your chest.

name: Band Chest Press
overview:
Stand in the middle of the two bands with feet shoulder-width apart. Step forward with one foot to create tension in the bands. | Hold one band in each hand, palms facing forward.

Start the exercise with your arms extended in front of you, keeping a slight bend in your elbows. | Lower your arms to the sides of your chest, maintaining control of the band. | Push your arms back up to the starting position, keeping your core engaged and maintaining control of the band.

name: Band High Face Pull
overview: Start with a band anchored to a high point. Stagger your stance. | Pull the band to the bridge of your nose.

name: Band Hip Abduction
overview: Attach the band around your ankle. Stand with feet hip-width apart, feet facing forward, and hands on hips. | Lift your right leg away from your body to the side, keeping your knee straight. This is your starting position. | Maintaining proper form, move your right leg as far to the side as you can, keeping your left leg planted firmly on the ground. Hold for a second and then return your right leg to the starting position.

name: Band Hip Adduction
overview: Attach a band to a stable anchor point, such as a door handle or post. | Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and place the band around your ankles. | Keeping your feet together, move your legs out to the sides and then back to the midline of your body. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Band Internally Rotated Chest Fly
overview: Start with both feet hip-width apart and step on the middle of the band with both feet. Hold the handles of the band in each hand and position the band above your chest, with your palms facing down. | Keeping your elbows slightly bent, slowly raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel with the floor. Make sure to internally rotate your shoulder joints by bringing your shoulder blades together and rotating your forearms inward towards your torso. | Hold the position for a few seconds and then slowly lower your arms back to the starting position, keeping the internal rotation of your shoulder joints throughout the movement.

name: Band Leg Curl
overview: Loop the band around a sturdy anchor point such as a weightlifting rack or a door handle. | Lie on your back with your heels placed inside the band. Make sure the band is centered under your heels and your feet are hip-width apart. | Using your hamstrings, curl your heels towards your glutes while keeping your hips on the ground.

name: Band Leg Extension
overview: Anchor a band to something stable and set up a bench. | Run through the band underneath the bench and loop around your feet. | Flex and extend your knees.

name: Band Low Lateral Raise
overview: Anchor a band to a low point and stand with the band crossing your body. | While keeping your elbow mostly extended, lift your arm until it's parallel with the floor.

name: Band Mid Lateral Raise
overview: Anchor a band to a point that is the same height as your fist when your arms are at your side and stand with the band crossing your body. | While keeping your elbow mostly extended, lift your arm until it's parallel with the floor.

name: Band Overhead Press
overview: Stand between the two anchored bands, grasp them with an overhand grip, and position the bands at shoulder level. | Brace your core and push the bands overhead, fully extending your arms. | Lower the bands back to shoulder level, keeping your core engaged and arms straight. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: Band Rapunzel Pushdown
overview: Anchor the band to a high point and face away. Hold the band with both hands, placing your hands shoulder-width apart and keeping your elbows close to your body. | Slowly extend your arms downward, keeping your elbows close to your body. Push the band down as far as you can, feeling the contraction in your triceps.

name: Band Rear Delt Fly
overview: Start by standing between the two anchored bands with your feet shoulder-width apart and the bands positioned at a high point. | Grasp the ends of each band with your hands, keeping your palms facing each other. | Keeping your arms slightly bent and your back straight, slowly pull the bands away from your body until your arms are extended straight out to the sides. Hold for a second, then slowly release back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

name: Band Reverse Curl
overview: Start by standing on the center of the band with both feet, shoulder-width apart. | Hold the band with both hands, palms facing down, arms extended straight in front of you. | Slowly curl your hands towards your shoulders, pulling the band tight, then lower your arms back to the starting position, keeping tension on the band throughout the exercise.

name: Band Single Arm Pushdown
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band with your right hand, with your arm at your side. | Flex and extend your elbow.

name: Single Arm Rapunzel Pushdown
overview: Stand with a band anchored to a high point. Face away from the band. Hold the loop in one hand. | Keep your elbow tucked in to your side. Extend your elbow. When you extend, don't let your upper arm raise. The band should land over your shoulder.

name: Band Single Arm Skullcrusher
overview: Stand facing away from a band which is anchored to a high point. | Keep your elbow pointed forward, and extend and flex your elbow.

name: Banded Side Walks
overview: Place a band either just below or above your knees. | Get into a quarter squat position. | Step side to side without letting there be any slack in the band to keep tension on the band.

name: Band Upright Row
overview: Stand with one or both feet on one end of a band. Take a double overhand roughly shoulder width grip. | Pull your elbows straight up the ceiling. Aim to get the band to chin level or slightly higher.

name: Band Standing Chest Press
overview: Loop the band around your back. The two end loops in each of your hands. | Extend your shoulder joint and elbow across your body until your arm is fully extended.

name: Band Tricep Kickback
overview: Anchor the band to a stable point. | Hinge forward. Extend and flex at the elbow.

name: Band Squat Hold Single Arm Row
overview: Anchor the band to a stable point and take a half squat position. | Hold the band loop in one hand and pull your elbow straight back.

name: Band Squat Hold Row
overview: Anchor the band to a stable point. | Take a half squat position and hold there. | Perform a row while holding the squat position.

name: Band Goblet Squat
overview: Stand with a shoulder width grip. Both feet should be on the band with the band looped over both hands. | Push your butt back and also break at the knees. | Try to hit parallel depth (bottom of your leg should be parallel with the ground). If you can't tell your squat depth, then try squatting in front of a mirror and watch your form.

name: Band Single Arm Pulldown
overview: Anchor the band to a high point. Go into a seated position. | Grab the loop of the band and pull your upper arm to your side.

name: Band Single Arm Row
overview: Anchor band to a stable point. | Step back until there is no slack in the band and hold the end of the band with one hand. | Pull through the elbow straight back.

name: Plate Alternating Deadstop Row
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. Hold each plate to the side of you. | Bend forward at the hips bringing the plates to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | One at a time, lift the plate up. Return the plate to the floor and do the other side.

name: Plate Squat
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a weight plate in front of your chest with both hands. | Keep your back straight, lower your body as if you were sitting back into a chair. | Go as low as you can while keeping your heels flat on the ground, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.

name: Plate Clean And Press
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the feet. | Bend the knees and hips to pick up the plate, keeping the back straight and core engaged. | Stand up, lock the hips and legs, and press the plate overhead with straight arms. | Lower the plate back to the starting position, keeping control of it, and repeat for desired reps.

name: Plate Squat Reach
overview: Stand holding a weight plate at chest height with both hands. | Lower into a squat, extending the plate in front of you at chest height | As you stand back up, pull the plate back into your chest.

name: Plate Clean
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the feet. | Bend the knees and hips to pick up the plate, keeping the back straight and core engaged. | Stand up while pulling the plate towards the chest. | Keep shoulder level while keeping the elbows high and in front of the plate.

name: Plate Curl To Overhead Press
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso, palms facing forward. | Curl the plate up to the front of the shoulder while keeping the elbows close to the body. | Rotate the palms to face forward and press the plate overhead, locking out the arms. | Lower the plate back to the starting position, keeping control of it, and repeat for desired reps.

name: Plate Squat Hold Reach
primary_muscle: Glutes, Shoulders, Triceps, Quads, Front Shoulders
overview: Hold the plate with both hands at chest height. | Keeping your core tight and your chest up, squat down as low as you can go while keeping your feet flat on the ground. | Hold the squat position and reach the plate forward, keeping your arms straight and your back straight. | Return the plate to your chest while you hold the squat position and repeat reaching the plate in front of you

name: Plate Curl To Overhead Press To Tricep Extension
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso, palms facing forward. | Curl the plate up to the front of the shoulder while keeping the elbows close to the body. | Rotate the palms to face forward and press the plate overhead, locking out the arms. | Lower the plate back behind the head to the starting position of a tricep extension. | Push the plate back up overhead, then lower it back to the starting position and repeat for desired reps.

name: Plate Curtsy Lunge
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso. | Step back and across the body with the right foot, bending both legs to lower into a lunge position. | Push through the front foot to return to the starting position. | Repeat on the other side by stepping back and across with the left foot. | Continue alternating sides for desired reps.

name: Plate Deadlift
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart, the plate in front of the feet, and the knees slightly bent. | Bend the hips and knees to grip the plate with palms facing the body. | Keeping the back straight, stand up while lifting the plate off the ground. | Return the plate back to the starting position by bending the hips and knees, keeping control of the plate.

name: Plate Squat Hold Curl
overview: Lower into a squat position, keeping the plate at chest height. | Slowly curl the plate towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body. | Hold for a moment at the top of the curl before lowering the plate back to chest height. | Repeat the curls as you hold the squat position.

name: Plate Single Leg Pinch Grip Deadlift
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and facing forwards. Grip the sides of a weight plate with your palms facing down. | Balance on one foot, as you raise the weight keep your arms and back straight, while you bring your  other foot back towards the ground | Keep four raised leg straight and in alignment with your back as you lower the plate back down to the starting position.

name: Plate Car Driver
overview: Inhale and brace your abdominals | Raise the arms vertically while keeping the elbows slightly bent | Once the arms are parallel with the floor, rotate the plate clockwise and counterclockwise. | Lower the plate back to the starting position.

name: Plate Front Raise
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso, palms facing the thighs. | Keeping the elbows slightly bent, lift the plate up to the front of the body. | Raise the plate up until the arms are fully extended, maintaining control of the plate. | Lower the plate back to the starting position and repeat for desired reps.

name: Plate Good Morning Anterior
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart, the plate held in front of you, and the knees slightly bent. | Bend forward at the hips, keeping the back straight, until the torso is parallel to the floor. | Push through the hips to return to the starting position.

name: Plate Good Morning
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart, the plate held behind the neck and the knees slightly bent. | Bend forward at the hips, keeping the back straight, until the torso is parallel to the floor. | Push through the hips to return to the starting position.

name: Plate Halo
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate held in front of your face with both hands, palms facing each other. | Rotate the plate around the head, keeping the arms extended and moving the plate in a circular motion. | Complete one full circle, then reverse the direction to complete another circle.

name: Plate Lateral Lunge
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart and the plate held in front of the torso. | Take a step to the side with one foot, bending the knee and lowering the hips into a lunge. | Push through the front foot to return to the starting position. | Repeat on the other side by stepping to the other side with the other foot.

name: Plate Forward Lunge
overview: Stand with feet hip-width apart and the plate held in front of the torso. | Take a step forward with one foot, bending the front knee to lower the hips into a lunge. | Push through the front foot to return to the starting position. | Repeat on the other side by stepping forward with the other foot.

name: Plate Single Leg Deadlift
overview: Engage your core and straighten your legs to lift the plate off the ground. | Stand on one leg, keeping the other leg off the ground, while holding the plate in front of your body. | Keep your back straight and maintain a neutral head position while looking straight ahead. | Lower the plate back down to the ground while keeping your balance on one leg.

name: Plate Reverse Lunge Twist
overview: Step back with your right foot into a lunge position, both knees bent at 90 degrees. | Twist your torso to the right, keeping the plate close to your chest. | Push through your front foot to return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

name: Plate Reverse Lunge
overview: Hold the plate at chest height close to your body | Take a big step backwards with your left leg, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground and your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle. | Push through your right heel to return to standing, bringing your left leg back to starting position. | Repeat the movement on the other side, stepping backwards with your right leg and lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.

name: Plate Pinch Grip Side Bend
overview: Stand straight with the plate held at your side | Keep your hips and shoulders facing forward, bend to one side slowly | Return to the upright position. | Switch hands and repeat

name: Plate Pinch Grip Row
overview: Make sure to keep your elbow close to your body and your core engaged throughout the movement. | Bend forward at your hips while maintaining a flat back. | Pull the plate toward your upper abdomen. | Lower the weight in a controlled manner and repeat.

name: Plate Pinch Grip Deadlift
overview: Stand facing the plate with your feet shoulder-width apart and the plate positioned between your feet. | Bend down and grasp the plate from the top edges with both hands, making sure your thumbs and fingers are evenly spaced. | Keep your back straight, chest up and core engaged, and stand up with the plate, keeping it close to your body. | Lower the plate back down to the ground, keeping control and maintaining good posture.

name: Plate Overhead Tricep Extension
overview: Stand or sit with a weight plate in your hands, arms extended straight above your head | Lower the weight plate behind your head by bending at the elbows. | Keep your elbows close to your head and shoulders relaxed. | Push the weight plate back up to starting position, extending your arms fully.

name: Plate Overhead Squat
overview: Hold a weight plate at arm's length overhead, with your arms fully extended. The plate should be directly above your head and your elbows should be locked. | Begin to bend your knees, lowering your body as far as you can while keeping the weight plate overhead. Make sure to keep your back straight and your chest lifted. | Once your thighs are parallel to the ground or as low as you can go, pause for a moment. | Push through your heels to return to a standing position, keeping the weight plate overhead the entire time.

name: Plate Overhead Press To Tricep Extension
overview: Brace your core and press the weight plate overhead until your arms are fully extended. Keep your shoulders down and back. | While your arms are fully extended, lower the weight behind your head to perform the extension | After completing the extension, lower the weight to your chest, and perform the overhead press. Repeat

name: Plate Deficit Lunge
overview: Stand on a plate with both feet. | Step back with one foot to the floor and let your back knee get close to or tap the floor. | Push through your front leg until both feet are back on the plate.

name: Plate Deficit Pushup
overview: Start in a pushup position with both hands on a plate. This will extend your range of motion. | Break at the elbows and shoulders until your upper arm travels behind the body slightly. | Then press back into the original position.

name: Plate Full Lateral Raise
overview: Stand tall holding two plates at your side. | Lateral raise the plates to your side and continue until the plates are pointed at the ceiling. | Let your shoulder joint naturally rotate. At the bottom you should have a neutral or overhand grip. By the time the plates are overhead, your palms should be facing forward.

name: Plate Glute Bridge to Chest Press
overview: Lay flat on the ground with a plate on your chest. | Push your hips up toward the ceiling and maintain that extended position. | With your hips up, press the plate toward the ceiling.

name: Plate Glute Bridge to Pullover
overview: Lay flat on the ground with a plate on your chest. | Push your hips up toward the ceiling and maintain that extended position. | Extend your elbows mostly, break at the shoulder joint while maintaining hip extension and the slight bend in your elbows. | Let the plate tap the floor (or get close) and then pull the plate back into the starting position.

name: Plate Internally Rotated Rear Delt Fly
overview: With plates in either hand, bend your knees with your feet slightly bowed out. Hinge forward with a flat back. | Maintain an overhand grip and internally rotated shoulders. | Raise your arms backward toward the ceiling while maintaining a light band in your elbows.

name: Plate Lateral Raise
overview: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and grip two plates in each hand at your sides. | Keeping your arms straight, raise the plates out to your sides until they are in line with your shoulders. | Lower the plates back to your sides with control. Repeat for desired number of reps.

name: Plate Overhead Carry
overview: Start by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a single weight plate overhead with both hands, keeping your arms extended straight above your head. | Begin walking forward, taking slow and steady steps while maintaining a straight line. Your focus should be on maintaining balance and control of the weight plate overhead. | As you walk, continue to keep your arms extended and the weight plate overhead. Try to maintain good posture and avoid leaning forward or backward, as this could result in losing control of the weight plate. | Continue walking for a set distance or for a certain amount of time, keeping your focus on proper form and technique. When finished, return to the starting position and repeat as desired.

name: Plate Overhead Shrug
overview: Stand tall with a weight plate overhead. | Elevated and depress your scapula. | Avoid leaning forward or backwards to keep pressure off of your lumbar spine.

name: Plate Overhead Walking Lunge
overview: Stand tall with a plate overhead. | Step with one foot forward bringing your back knee to the floor. Gently tap your knee then drive through your front leg. | Go back to a standing position and then step forward with the opposing legs.

name: Plate Pinch Grip Farmer's Carry
overview: Stand tall holding two plates in each hand with a pinch grip. | Walk for the desired distance or time.

name: Plate Rear Delt Fly
overview: Keep your back straight and bend forward slightly at the waist. | With arms extended, raise the weights out to your sides until they are in line with your shoulders. | Pause briefly and then lower the weights back to the starting position.

name: Plate Russian Twist
overview: Start by sitting on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground | Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button toward your spine. | Slowly twist your upper body to the right, keeping your feet flat on the ground and your back straight. | Hold for a second and then twist to the left, holding for another second.

name: Plate Situp
overview: Start by lying on your back on a mat with your legs bent and feet flat on the ground. | Hold a weight plate over your head with both hands, making sure to keep your arms straight. | Engage your core and use your abdominal muscles to sit up, keeping the weight plate towards the ceiling.

name: Plate Squat Hold
overview: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, with a weight plate held in both hands at chest height. | Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight and your weight in your heels. | Go down until your thighs are parallel to the floor, then pause for a moment. | Hold the squat position for the desired amount of time, keeping the weight plate steady and your core engaged.

name: Weighted Forearm Plank
overview: Get into a kneeling position with both forearms pressed into the ground. | Place a weight plate on your back (or have a partner do it for you). | Hold the plank for the allotted amount of time.

name: Plate Staggered Deadlift
overview: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a weight plate. | Place one foot slightly behind the other, with the heel of your back foot elevated. | From this starting position, bend at the hips and knees to lower the plate towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged. | Once the plate is below your knees, drive through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.

name: Plate Staggered Pinch Grip Deadlift
overview: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding two plates with a pinch grip. | Place one foot slightly behind the other, with the heel of your back foot elevated. | From this starting position, bend at the hips and knees to lower the plates towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.

name: Plate Thruster
overview: Start with the plate at chest height. Begin a squat. | Make sure to hit parallel depth. On your way back up, use the momentum you generate with your legs to help push the plate into an overhead position. | Let the plate return to chest height before initiating the next squat.

name: Plate Reach
overview: Start in a standing position with a plate against your chest. | Press the plate away from your body until your elbows are extended.

name: Plate Standing Twist
overview: Stand with a plate extended away from your body. Elbows mostly extended. | Rotate at the upper spine while keeping your lumbar spine in a neutral position. | Do not let the plate go behind your body.

name: Weighted Hand Plank
overview: Start in a kneeling position with your hands planted on the ground. | Place a weight plate on your back or have a friend do it for you. | Pick your knees up off the ground. Hold in this position with a flat back.

name: Plate Hollow Hold
overview: Lay flat on the ground with your arms extended over head holding a weight plate. | Pick your upper back and your legs off the ground. Your body should be in a banana shape.

name: Plate Wood Chopper
overview: Stand with a shoulder width stance. Begin with the plate near one of your quads. | Rotate at your upper spine to engage the obliques. | You can pivot your back foot to keep from generating too much torque at the knee.

name: Plate Superman
overview: Lay flat on the ground on your stomach with your arms extended overhead. Hold a plate with a neutral grip. | Lift your legs and chest off the ground simultaneously and hold for a 1 count at the top. | Relax your lower back and lower your legs and chest back to the floor.

name: Plate Superman Hold
overview: Hold a plate in both hands. | Pull your arms and legs off the ground while and hold that position.

name: Weighted Plank Up Down
overview: Start from a plank position. Place a plate on your back. | Go to one elbow then the other. Try to avoid rocking back and forth.

name: Weighted Push Ups
overview: Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders. Place a plate on your back. | Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body | Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body | Exhale as you push back to the starting position.

name: Weighted Diamond Push Ups
overview: Place a plate on your back. Position your index fingers and thumbs so they are touching, forming a diamond shape. | Use a standard push up position | Lower your chest towards your hands, keep your elbows close to your body | Stop just before your chest touches the floor, then push back up to the starting position.

name: Weighted Knee Push Ups
overview: Begin in a push-up position on your knees. Break at the elbow and shoulder joint. | Lower your body, keeping elbows close. | Push back up to the starting position.

name: Weighted Wall Sit
overview: Press your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart, holding weights at your sides. | Lower into a squat position, thighs parallel to the floor, knees above ankles. | Hold the position, maintaining tension in your core and legs.

name: Plate Weighted Inverted Row
overview: Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip. Place a plate on your chest. | Pull your body straight up to the bar. | Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.

name: Weighted Pull Ups
overview: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended. Weight hanging between your legs. | Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar. | Lower your body back to starting position.

name: Weighted Chin Ups
overview: Grab the bar shoulder width apart with a supinated grip (palms facing you). Use a dip belt and the let the weight hang between your legs. | With your body hanging and arms fully extended, pull yourself up until your chin is past the bar. | Slowly return to starting position. Repeat.

name: Plate Weighted Dip
overview: Use a dip belt to attach a plate to yourself. Grip bars with arms straight, shoulders above hands. Keep legs straight or bent. | Lower slowly until elbows are at 90 degrees. | Push back up to start position, extending arms fully.

name: Plate Weighted Dead Hang
overview: Attach weight to yourself using a dip belt. Grip a pull-up bar with palms facing forward. | Hang with arms fully extended. | Hold for recommended amount of time, keeping your core engaged.

name: Plate Goblet Deficit Reverse Lunge
overview: Stand on a platform, Holding a plate to your chest, feet hip-width apart. | Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged. | Push through front foot, return to start.

name: Plate Staggered Waiters Bow
overview: Set up a bar at mid way up your quad. Place the working leg against the bar. | Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time. | Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring. | When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.

name: Plate Waiters Bow
overview: Place a barbell at about midway up your thigh. Press your quads into the barbell. Hold a plate up to your chest. | Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. | When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

name: TRX Ab Rollout
overview: Grasp the TRX handles with both hands, keeping your arms extended and your shoulders away from your ears. | Keep your abs engaged, roll forward onto your toes, and extend your arms in front of you. | Slowly lower your body down to the ground, keeping your arms straight and your abs engaged. | When your head gets between your arms, pause for a moment and then use your abs to pull your body back up to the starting position.

name: TRX Calf Raise
overview: Hold the TRX straps under your arms and the handles in your armpits. | Lean forward against the straps. | Keep your body straight and initiate the calf raise by raising your heels off the ground.

name: TRX Pec Fly
overview: Start by adjusting the TRX straps to chest height. Stand facing the TRX with your feet shoulder-width apart. | Grasp the TRX handles with both hands, keeping your arms extended and your shoulders away from your ears. | Lean forward, keeping your arms extended and your core engaged. Your body should form a slight diagonal line from your ankles to your head. | Slowly bring your arms towards each other, in front of your chest, while keeping your core engaged and your body in a stable position.

name: TRX Curtsy Lunge
overview: Stand facing away from the anchor point, holding onto the TRX handles with both hands. | Step your left foot behind your right, crossing it behind your right leg, and lower yourself into a curtsy lunge. | Push through your right foot to return to the starting position and repeat the movement with the other leg.

name: TRX Forearm Plank
overview: Lie face down on the ground and place your forearms on the ground directly under your shoulders. | With your feet in the stirrups, kick both feet into the TRX straps and hold the handles above your head. | Tighten your abs, glutes, and legs to form a straight line from your head to your feet.

name: TRX Forearm Side Plank
overview: Lie on your side with your legs straight and your feet resting in the TRX foot cradles. | Prop yourself up on your forearm and engage your core to maintain a straight line from your head to your feet.

name: TRX Glute Bridge
overview: Lie on your back with your feet in the foot cradles of the TRX straps, with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. | Place your arms by your sides with your palms facing down. | Drive your hips up towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes and hamstrings at the top of the movement.

name: TRX Hamstring Curl
overview: Start by facing the TRX straps and positioning yourself in a push-up position with your hands on the ground and your feet in the TRX foot cradles. | Keeping your core engaged and body in a straight line, bend your knees and bring your heels towards your glutes. | Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your legs back to the starting position.

name: TRX Hand Plank
overview: Start by facing away from the TRX straps and placing your feet in the TRX handles with your palms on the ground. | Lift your knees off the ground to begin the set. | Engage your core and maintain this position for the desired amount of time, holding a steady plank.

name: TRX I Raise
overview: Stand facing the TRX straps and hold onto the handles with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. | Keeping your core engaged, slowly raise your arms forward until they are overhead. | Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your arms back to the starting position.

name: TRX Jumping Squat
overview: Stand facing the TRX straps and place your feet shoulder-width apart. | Begin by lowering into a squat position by bending at the knees and hips, keeping your back straight and chest up. | Explosively jump up off the ground, using your arms for momentum if desired. | Land softly back in the squat position, making sure to absorb the impact with your legs.

name: TRX Kneeling Ab Rollout
overview: Begin in a kneeling position with the TRX straps adjusted to mid-calf length. | Grasp the TRX handles with both hands, keeping your arms extended and your shoulders away from your ears. | Keep your abs engaged, roll forward onto your toes, and extend your arms in front of you. | Slowly lower your body down to the ground, keeping your arms straight and your abs engaged.

name: TRX Knee Tuck
overview: Place your feet in the TRX stirrups and get in to a hand plank position. | Pull your knees to your chest and flex your abs.

name: TRX Lateral Lunge
overview: Grasp the TRX handles with both hands and extend your arms straight in front of you. | Step laterally to one side, keeping your arms extended and your core engaged. | Lower your body into a lunge position, keeping your front knee bent at a 90-degree angle and your back leg straight. | Push off your front foot to return to the starting position, keeping your arms extended and your core engaged.

name: TRX Mountain Climber
overview: Start in a plank position with the TRX straps adjusted to mid-calf length. Place your feet in the TRX stirrups. | Keep your abs engaged, and bring one knee towards your chest while keeping the other leg extended behind you. | Switch legs, bringing the opposite knee towards your chest while keeping your abs engaged and your back straight.

name: TRX Oblique Crunch
overview: Place your feet in the TRX stirrups and get in to a hand plank position. | Pull both knees to your right elbow. | Extend your legs back to the starting position, then pull both knees to the left elbow.

name: TRX Pike
overview: Place your feet in the stirrups and get in to a plank position. | Pull your hips straight up toward the ceiling. | Lower your hips until you're back in a plank position.

name: TRX Pushup
overview: Start by setting up the TRX straps to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them. | Stand facing the TRX straps, grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders. | Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line. | Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.

name: TRX Rear Delt Fly
overview: Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands. | Step forward so that your body is in a plank position, with your arms straight and your body in a straight line from your head to your heels. | Keeping your arms straight, slowly lift your arms out to the side, keeping them at the same height as your shoulders. Your body should form a "T" shape.

name: TRX Rear Delt Row
overview: Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands. | Step away so your body is leaning away from the anchor point. | Flex your elbows and pull your elbows straight back behind your body. | Make sure to keep your elbows flared outward.

name: TRX Reverse Curl
overview: Stand facing the TRX straps and grasp the handles with both hands, palms facing away from your body. | Walk back until the straps are taut, keeping your arms straight. | Slowly curl your hands towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.

name: TRX Reverse Lunge
overview: Hold on to the TRX straps and step away until the strap is taut. | Step backwards with one leg in to a lunge position and gently tap your knee to the floor. | Lunge back to the starting position and repeat with the other leg.

name: TRX Rotating Row
overview: Grab the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point until the strap is taut. | Start with an overhand grip. Pull your elbows back and rotate your grip. | By the time your elbows reach your side, your palms should be facing upwards.

name: TRX Single Arm row
overview: Hold the TRX strap with one hand. | Lean back until the strap is taut. Fully extend your elbow. | Pull your elbow behind the body. Make sure to avoid twisting. Try to keep your shoulders even.

name: TRX Skullcrusher
overview: Hold the two TRX straps and lean forward. The straps should be over each shoulder. | Keep your elbows tucked in and then flex and extend at the elbows.

name: TRX Split Squat
overview: Hold the two TRX straps and step away until the straps are taut. Take a split stance. | Bring your back knee to the floor and gently tap the floor. | Use your arms and the TRX to help assist you getting back into the starting position.

name: TRX Squat
overview: Hold the two TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point. | Flex at the hips and knees in to a squat position. | You can use your arms and the straps to assist you back into the starting position.

name: TRX W Raise
overview: Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point. | Pull your elbows back while externally rotating your shoulder joint. Your arms should make a W shape at the back portion of the exercise.

name: TRX Y Raise
overview: Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point until the straps are taut. | Keep both elbows mostly extended and raise both arms out and upwards. | You should make a Y shape with your arms during the back portion of the exercise.

name: Child Pose Arms Extended
overview: Begin in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the ground. | Sit back onto your heels and extend your arms out in front of you. | Rest your forehead on the ground. | Hold for a few breaths and then release.

name: Child Pose Arms Extended Left Right
overview: Begin in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the ground. | Sit back onto your heels and extend your arms out in front of you to one side. | Rest your forehead on the ground. | Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.

name: Child Pose Arms On Side
overview: Begin in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the ground. | Sit back onto your heels and place your arms at your sides with your palms facing up. | Rest your forehead on the ground. | Hold for a few breaths and then release.

name: Table Top Pose Variation 1
overview: Start in a tabletop position on your hands and knees with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips. | Turn your hands so that your fingers are pointing towards the sides of your mat and the tops of your hands are on the floor. | Keep your arms straight and your shoulders away from your ears. | Hold the pose for several breaths or as long as is comfortable.

name: Table Top Pose Variation 2
overview: Start in a tabletop position on your hands and knees with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips. | Turn your hands so that your fingers are pointing towards your knees and the tops of your hands are on the floor. | Keep your arms straight and your shoulders away from your ears. | Hold the pose for several breaths or as long as is comfortable.

name: Table Top Pose Variation 3
overview: Come onto your hands and knees on the mat with your wrists directly under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. | Turn your palms down and spread your fingers wide, with your fingertips pointing towards your knees. | Press into your palms and extend your arms fully to lift your shoulders away from your ears. | Hold the pose for a few breaths, and then release by slowly lowering your hands to the mat and coming back to a neutral tabletop position.

name: Bow Pose
overview: Lie on your stomach with your arms at your sides. | Bend your knees and bring your heels towards your buttocks. | Reach back with your hands and grab your ankles. | Inhale and lift your chest off the ground, pulling your legs up and back with your hands. | Keep your gaze forward and hold the pose for a few breaths before releasing back to the ground.

name: Criss Cross Bow Tie Pose
overview: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides. | Cross your right arm over your left arm, bringing your palms together in front of your chest. | Lower your arms down so that your palms face down towards the ground, and your right elbow is resting on top of your left elbow. | Hold for a few breaths, then switch sides.

name: Cat Pose
overview: Begin on your hands and knees with your wrists directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips. | Inhale and arch your back, lifting your tailbone and head towards the ceiling, while lowering your belly towards the floor. | Exhale and round your spine, tucking your chin towards your chest, and bringing your tailbone towards your knees. | Repeat these movements, flowing smoothly between the two poses, for several breaths.

name: Chair Pose
overview: Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides. | Inhale and raise your arms straight up over your head. | Exhale and bend your knees, lowering your hips as if you were sitting in a chair. | Hold the pose for a few breaths, then inhale and stand up straight.

name: Child Pose Elbows On Block
overview: Place two blocks on the floor, shoulder-width apart. | Kneel in front of the blocks, and lower your torso down so that your elbows are resting on the blocks, and your forehead is resting on the floor. | Relax your arms, shoulders, and neck, and breathe deeply. | Hold for a few breaths, then release.

name: Crescent Moon Pose
overview: Begin in Runner's Lunge pose with your right foot forward. | Slowly lift your torso up and bring your arms overhead, palms facing each other. | Make sure your right knee is directly above your ankle, and your left leg is straight behind you. | Hold for a few breaths before repeating on the other side.

name: Crescent Moon Pose Quad Stretch
overview: Begin in Crescent Moon Pose with your right foot forward and a block nearby. | Place the block at the highest height under your left hand. | Reach your left arm behind you and take hold of your left foot or ankle. | Gently pull your foot towards your buttocks while pressing your left hand into the block to deepen the stretch in your left quad. Hold for a few breaths before releasing and repeating on the other side.

name: Crescent Moon Pose Quad Stretch With Block
overview: Begin in Crescent Moon Pose with your right foot forward and a block nearby. | Place the block at the highest height under your left hand. | Reach your left arm behind you and take hold of your left foot or ankle. | Gently pull your foot towards your buttocks while pressing your left hand into the block to deepen the stretch in your left quad. Hold for a few breaths before releasing and repeating on the other side.

name: Double Pigeon Pose
overview: Sit on the ground with your legs extended in front of you. | Place a block under your left knee, then bend your right knee and stack it on top of your left ankle. | Flex both feet and gently press your knees towards the ground, feeling a stretch in your hips. | Hold the pose for a few breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

name: Downward Dog Toe To Heel
overview: Begin in a downward-facing dog position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart. | Lift your right foot off the mat and place your right toes on top of your left heel. | Press your palms and fingers firmly into the mat and lift your hips up towards the ceiling, deepening the stretch in your hamstrings and calves. | Hold the pose for a few breaths, and then release by slowly walking your hands back out to a downward-facing dog position.

name: Eagle Arms Chin Into Chest
overview: Sit cross-legged on the floor and bring your arms out to the sides at shoulder height. | Cross your right arm over your left, bending both elbows so that your forearms are parallel to the floor. | Lift your elbows towards the ceiling and bring your hands together, then drop your chin towards your chest. | Hold for a few breaths, then release your arms and repeat on the other side.

name: Eagle Arm Pose
overview: Begin seated or standing with your arms at your sides. | Inhale and reach your arms out to the sides at shoulder height. | Cross your right arm over your left arm, bringing your palms to touch if possible. | Hold for a few breaths and then release the arms and repeat with the left arm over the right.

name: Easy Pose Neck Stretch
overview: Begin by sitting cross-legged on the floor. | Slowly drop your chin towards your chest, feeling a stretch in the back of your neck. | Inhale and lift your head up, then exhale and drop your right ear towards your right shoulder. | Hold for a few breaths, then switch sides and repeat the stretch.

name: Easy Seated Twist Pose
overview: Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you. | Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh. | Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling. | Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side. | Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you. | Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh. | Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling. | Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.

name: extended-side-angle-pose
overview: Begin in a lunge position with your right foot forward and your left foot back. | Place your right hand on a block or the ground on the outside of your right foot. | Reach your left arm overhead and then round your spine, bringing your left hand to your right ear. | Look down towards your right foot as you reach your left arm towards the front of the room, feeling a stretch in your side body. Hold for a few breaths and then switch sides.

name: Extended side Angle Pose With Block
overview: Begin in a lunge position with your right foot forward and your left foot back. | Place a block on the outside of your right foot and place your right hand on top of it. | Look down towards your right foot as you reach your left arm towards the front of the room, feeling a stretch in your side body. Hold for a few breaths and then switch sides.

name: Gate Pose Variation Arm Extended on Side
overview: Start on your knees and extend your right leg out to the side. | Raise your right arm above your head and reach towards the left side of the room. | Gently bend your body to the left side and rest your left hand on your left thigh. | Look up towards your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.

name: Gate Pose Rounding Spine Looking Up
overview: Begin in a kneeling position with your knees hip-width apart. | Extend your right leg out to the side, placing your foot flat on the ground. | Reach your right arm overhead and then round your spine, bringing your right hand to your left ear. | Look down towards your left foot as you reach your left arm towards your right foot, feeling a stretch in your side body. Hold for a few breaths and then switch sides.

name: Half Lotus
overview: Sit on a yoga mat with legs straight in front of you. | Bend the right knee and place the right foot on top of the left thigh. Allow the right knee to fall towards the floor. | Bring the left foot onto the right thigh. Keep the spine straight and rest hands on the knees. | Hold for several breaths and then release.

name: Half Monkey Pose
overview: Start in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the floor. | Step your right foot forward, placing it between your hands. | Straighten your right leg and flex your toes towards your face, keeping your hands on the floor for support. | Hold for several breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

name: Half Neck Rolls
overview: Sit cross-legged on the floor and interlace your fingers behind your head. | Drop your chin to your chest and roll your head to the right, bringing your right ear towards your right shoulder. | Slowly roll your head back to center, then over to the left so that your left ear is close to your left shoulder. | Repeat the movement from side to side, keeping your shoulders relaxed and breathing deeply.

name: Happy Baby
overview: Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. | Lift your feet off the floor and bring your knees towards your chest. | Reach inside your knees and hold onto the outside edges of your feet. | Gently pull your knees towards your armpits and rock side to side for a few breaths.

name: Headstand
overview: Begin on your hands and knees with your wrists under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. | Place your forearms on the floor and interlace your fingers. | Place the crown of your head on the floor and tuck your toes under. | Walk your feet towards your head and lift your hips up. | Straighten your legs and find your balance. Hold for several breaths and then release.

name: Lord Of The Dance
overview: Begin by standing tall with your feet hip-width apart. | Shift your weight onto your left foot and bring your right heel towards your glute. | Reach your right arm back and grab onto the inside of your right foot or ankle. | Inhale and lift your right foot away from your glute while extending your left arm forward. Hold for 5-10 breaths before switching sides.

name: Monkey Pose
overview: Begin in a low lunge with your right foot forward and your left knee on the ground. | Slowly slide your left knee back while extending your right leg forward, keeping both legs straight. | Lower your body down to the ground, using your hands for support if needed. | Hold the pose for a few breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

name: Mountain
overview: Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides. | Press your feet into the ground and engage your leg muscles. | Lift your chest and roll your shoulders back and down. | Take a deep breath in, and as you exhale, release any tension in your body and relax your muscles.

name: One Arm Cow Face Pose
overview: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. | Bend your left knee and place your left foot on the floor, close to your right hip. | Cross your right leg over your left leg, stacking your knees on top of each other. | Bring your left arm up overhead, and bend your elbow so that your left hand reaches towards your upper back. Reach your right hand behind your back and try to clasp your left hand. Hold

name: Seated Forward Bend
overview: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. | Inhale and lengthen your spine, then exhale and fold forward from your hips, keeping your spine long. | Reach for your feet or ankles, keeping your elbows straight. | Hold for several breaths, then release.

name: Pigeon Pose
overview: Extend your right leg behind you and place your right ankle on top of your left thigh, with your right knee pointing out to the side. | Sitting up straight, use your hands to gently press down on your right knee while at the same time pulling your left buttock back. | Hold for 5-10 deep breaths, then release and repeat on the other side.

name: Wide Legged Forward Fall
overview: Start standing at the top of your mat with your feet wide apart. | Interlace your fingers behind your back and inhale to expand your chest. | Exhale and fold forward from your hips, bringing your hands up and over your head towards the ground. | Hold for a few breaths and then release the hands and come back up to standing.

name: Puppy Pose
overview: Begin in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the ground. | Walk your hands forward as you lower your chest towards the ground. | Keep your hips over your knees and extend your arms out in front of you. | Hold for a few breaths and then release.

name: Pyramid Pose Blocks
overview: Begin in Tadasana (Mountain Pose) with two blocks at the top of your mat. | Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and place your heel down, keeping your toes pointing forward. | Place the blocks on either side of your right foot at a height that allows you to comfortably place your hands on them. | Inhale and lengthen your spine, then exhale and fold forward from your hips, bringing your hands to the blocks. Hold for several breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

name: Pyramid Pose Calf Blocks
overview: Start standing with a flat and vertical block on the matt | Bend forward, placing hand on vertical block, and front of foot on the flat block. | Press the bottom of your foot towards the ground, and repeat on each side.

name: Pyramid Pose
overview: Begin in Tadasana (Mountain Pose). | Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and place your heel down, keeping your toes pointing forward. | Inhale and lengthen your spine, then exhale and fold forward from your hips, bringing your hands to the floor on either side of your right foot. | Hold for several breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

name: Pyramid Prayer
overview: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and place your hands on a table, chair, or any elevated surface in front of you. | Walk your feet back until your torso is parallel to the ground, and your elbows are resting on the surface. | Relax your head and neck, and breathe deeply. | Hold for a few breaths, then release.

name: Reclining Pigeon Pose
overview: Lie down on your back with your knees bent and your feet on the ground. | Cross your right ankle over your left knee, creating a figure four shape. | Use your hands to gently pull your left knee towards your chest, feeling a stretch in your right hip. | Hold the pose for a few breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

name: Restful Cow Face Pose Legs
overview: Start in a seated position with your legs extended in front of you. | Cross your right leg over your left leg, placing your right foot on the floor beside your left hip. | Cross your left leg over your right leg, placing your left foot on the floor beside your right hip. | Relax your arms by your sides or place them on your abdomen and take deep breaths.

name: Reverse Prayer
overview: Start seated or standing with your arms at your sides. | Bring your hands behind your back and interlace your fingers with your palms facing up. | Inhale and draw your shoulder blades together, lifting your chest. | Exhale and gently press your hands down towards the floor as you continue to lift your chest.

name: Revolved Head To Knee
overview: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. | Bend your right knee and bring your heel towards your perineum. | Place your left hand on the outside of your right knee and twist your body to the right. | Reach your right hand towards your left foot and look up towards the ceiling. Hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.

name: Revolved Side Angle Pose With Prayer Hands Beginner
overview: Begin in a low lunge position with your right foot forward and your left knee on the ground. | Bring your hands together in a prayer position at your heart. | Exhale and twist your torso to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. | Hold for several breaths and then repeat on the other side.

name: Revolved Side Angle Pose With Prayer Hands
overview: Begin in Warrior II pose, with your right foot forward and your left foot back. | Bring your hands together in a prayer position at your heart. | Exhale and twist your torso to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. | Hold for several breaths and then repeat on the other side.

name: Runners Lunge
overview: Begin in Downward Facing Dog pose (Adho Mukha Svanasana). | Step your right foot forward between your hands. | Place your left knee on the ground behind you and slide it back until you feel a stretch in your left hip flexor. | Keep your hands on the ground or lift them to the sky and hold for a few breaths before repeating on the other side.

name: Seated Side Bend Pose
overview: Sit comfortably on the floor with your legs crossed. | Inhale and raise your right arm above your head. | As you exhale, bend your body to the left side and rest your left hand on the ground. | Look up towards the ceiling and hold the pose for a few breaths. Then switch sides and repeat the pose on the other side.

name: Seated Twist
overview: Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you. | Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh. | Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling. | Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.

name: Sphinx Pose
overview: Start by lying down on your stomach on a yoga mat or a comfortable surface. | Place your elbows underneath your shoulders, keeping your forearms parallel to each other. | Press your palms and forearms firmly into the ground to lift your chest up, while keeping your hips and legs relaxed. | Make sure your shoulders are relaxed and away from your ears. Gently roll your shoulder blades down and back to open up your chest. | Lengthen your spine by lifting the crown of your head towards the ceiling, while keeping your chin tucked in slightly.

name: Standing Forward Bend Blocks
overview: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and place a block on the ground in front of you. | Hinge forward at your hips and place your hands on the block. | Allow your head to hang heavy and feel a stretch in the back of your legs. | Hold for a few breaths and then slowly roll up to a standing position.

name: Standing Forward Bend
overview: Stand with your feet hip-width apart. | Hinge forward at your hips, reaching your hands towards the ground. | Allow your head to hang heavy and feel a stretch in the back of your legs. | Hold for a few breaths and then slowly roll up to a standing position.

name: Supine Twist Lying
overview: Lie down on your back with your arms stretched out to your sides. | Bend your right knee and bring it towards your chest. | Slowly twist your body to the left side, bringing your right knee across your body towards the ground on the left side. | Look towards your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.

name: Supported Matsyasana Pose
overview: Sit on the floor with your legs stretched out in front of you. | Place a yoga block behind you, horizontally, at the base of your spine. | Slowly recline over the block, supporting yourself with your forearms, until your back is resting on the block. | Relax your arms at your sides, palms facing up, and breathe deeply.

name: Thread The Needle Hip Over Knees
overview: Start on your hands and knees in a tabletop position. | Slide your right knee up between your hands and place your right foot close to your left wrist. | Take your left leg back and lower it down to the ground, keeping your toes tucked. | Twist your torso to the right and reach your right arm underneath your left arm, threading the needle. Hold for a few breaths, then switch sides.

name: Tree Pose
overview: Start in mountain pose, standing with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides. | Shift your weight onto your left foot and bend your right knee, bringing the sole of your right foot to the inside of your left thigh. | Bring your hands together in front of your heart, or raise them overhead. | Hold the pose for a few breaths, then release and repeat on the other side.

name: Two Arms Cow Face Pose
overview: Begin in a comfortable seated position on your mat, with your legs crossed and your spine straight. | Extend your right arm up toward the ceiling and bend it at the elbow, bringing your right hand behind your head. | Reach your left arm behind your back and bend it at the elbow, bringing your left hand up between your shoulder blades. | Clasp your hands behind your back, trying to touch your fingertips together. If you can't quite reach, you can use a strap or towel to bridge the gap between your hands.

name: Urdhva Dhanurasana Wheel Pose
overview: Lie down on your back with your feet hip-distance apart and your knees bent. | Place your hands on the floor beside your head, fingertips pointing towards your shoulders. | Push your feet and hands into the floor, lift your hips up and straighten your arms. | Lift your chest towards the ceiling and hold the pose for a few breaths before lowering back down.

name: Vajrasana Variation 1
overview: Begin in a kneeling position with your knees together and your shins and feet on the floor. | Sit back on your heels and place your palms face down on your thighs, with your fingers pointing towards your knees. | Relax your shoulders and take deep breaths. | Hold the pose for several breaths or as long as is comfortable.

name: Walk Your Downward Dog
overview: Begin in a downward-facing dog position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart. | Walk your feet towards your hands, bending your knees as needed to allow your heels to touch the mat. | Press your palms and fingers into the mat and lift your hips up towards the ceiling to deepen the stretch in your hamstrings and calves. | Hold the pose for a few breaths, and then release by slowly walking your hands back out to a downward-facing dog position.

name: Warrior One
overview: Start in mountain pose, standing with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides. | Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and turn it slightly inward, while keeping your right foot facing forward. | Inhale and raise your arms overhead, then exhale and bend your right knee, bringing it directly over your ankle. | Hold the pose for a few breaths, then inhale and return to mountain pose. Repeat on the other side.

name: Warrior Three
overview: Start in mountain pose, standing with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides. | Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and raise it off the ground, while keeping your right foot facing forward. | Inhale and reach your arms forward, parallel to the ground. | Exhale and hinge forward at your hips, bringing your torso parallel to the ground and extending your left leg straight back. Keep your arms and right leg straight and hold the pose for a few breaths | inhale and return to mountain pose. Repeat on the other side.

name: Warrior Two
overview: Start in mountain pose, standing with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides. | Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and turn it slightly inward, while keeping your right foot facing forward. | Inhale and raise your arms to shoulder height, parallel to the ground, with your palms facing down. | Exhale and bend your right knee, bringing it directly over your ankle while keeping your left leg straight. | Look over your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths, then inhale and return to mountain pose. Repeat on the other side.

name: Wide Legged Standing Forward Bend Holding Heels
overview: Start standing at the top of your mat with your feet wide apart. | Start standing at the top of your mat with your feet wide apart. | Exhale and fold forward from your hips, bringing your hands up and over your head towards the ground. | Hold for a few breaths and then release the hands and come back up to standing.

name: Wild Thing Pose
overview: Start in a downward facing dog position. | Shift your weight onto your left hand and foot, and lift your right leg towards the ceiling. | Slowly bend your right knee and shift your weight onto your right hand as you open up your chest towards the ceiling. | Look towards your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.

name: Yogi Arm Clock
overview: Stand facing a wall with your arms extended and your palms pressing into the wall at shoulder height. | Slowly begin to walk your feet away from the wall, keeping your arms straight and your hands pressing into the wall. | Walk until your arms are fully extended and your body is at a 45-degree angle to the ground. | Repeat From High to Low Angles starting above the shoulder, and ending below the chest.

name: Cobra Pose
overview: Start prone, hands under shoulders. | Inhale, lift chest, arch back. | Elongate neck, gaze up. Breathe, hold. Release, exhale.

name: Bosu Ball Burpee
overview: Stand on Bosu with feet shoulder-width apart. | Drop into squat position and place hands on Bosu. | Jump feet back into plank, perform a pushup, then jump back to squat.

name: Bosu Ball Calf Raise
overview: Stand on Bosu with feet hip-width apart. | Rise up on toes, squeezing calves. | Lower heels back down to complete one rep.

name: Bosu Ball Feet Elevated Glute Bridge
overview: Lie on back, place feet on Bosu, knees bent. | Lift hips and squeeze glutes. | Lower hips back down to complete one rep.

name: Bosu Ball Forearm Plank
overview: Place forearms on Bosu, elbows under shoulders. | Extend legs, keeping body straight. | Hold the plank position, engaging core.

name: Bosu Ball Forearm Sideplank
overview: Lie on one side, forearm on Bosu, elbow under shoulder. | Lift hips to create a side plank. | Hold the side plank position, then switch sides.

name: Bosu Ball Front Raise
overview: Hold the bosu vertically. | Raise the bosu toward the ceiling while keeping your elbows mostly extended.

name: Bosu Ball Half Burpee
overview: Stand on Bosu with feet shoulder-width apart. | Drop into squat position and place hands on Bosu. | Jump feet back to plank, then jump back to squat.

name: Bosu Ball Hand Plank
overview: Place hands on Bosu, shoulder-width apart. | Extend legs, keeping body straight. | Hold the plank position, engaging core.

name: Bosu Ball Hand Sideplank
overview: Place hand on Bosu, arm straight, facing sideways. | Stack feet and lift hips to side plank. | Hold the side plank position, then switch sides.

name: Bosu Ball Hand Sideplank Hip Abduction
overview: Start in a side plank with hand on Bosu. | Lift the top leg while keeping the body stable. | Lower the leg back down.

name: Bosu Ball Hip Thrust
overview: Sit on Bosu, lean back, hands on the floor. | Drive hips upward, squeezing glutes. | Lower hips back down to complete one rep.

name: Bosu Ball Lateral Lunge
overview: Stand on Bosu, step sideways into a lunge. | Bend knee, keeping the other leg straight. | Push off the bent leg, return to starting position.

name: Bosu Ball Offset Pushup
overview: Place one hand on Bosu, other on the floor. | Lower chest to the ground, keeping the body straight. | Push back up to the starting position.

name: Bosu Ball Pike Pushup
overview: Place feet on Bosu, hips high, hands on the floor. | Lower the head towards the ground, then push back up. | Keep legs straight and hips elevated throughout.

name: Bosu Ball Pike Shrug
overview: Place toes on Bosu, hands on the floor. | Pike hips up, shrug shoulders, engage core.

name: Bosu Ball Plank Glute Kickback
overview: Start in a plank position with Bosu under feet. | Lift one leg back, squeezing glutes. | Lower the leg back down and switch sides.

name: Bosu Ball Pullover
overview: Lie on ground with head and shoulders supported. | Hold a bosu and lower it back over the head. | Bring the bosu back over the chest to complete one rep.

name: Bosu Ball Pushup
overview: Place hands on Bosu, shoulder-width apart. | Lower chest to the ground, keeping the body straight. | Push back up to the starting position.

name: Bosu Ball Reverse Lunge
overview: Hold medicine ball at chest. | Step back into lunge position. | Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.

name: Bosu Ball Row
overview: Hold bosu and hinge forward. | Pull bosu towards chest, squeezing shoulder blades.

name: Bosu Ball Single Leg Elevated Glute Bridge
overview: Lie on back, place one foot on Bosu, knee bent. | Lift hips, squeezing glutes, one leg extended. | Lower hips back down and switch legs.

name: Bosu Ball Single Leg Hip Thrust
overview: Sit on Bosu, lean back, one foot on the floor. | Drive hips upward, squeezing glutes, one leg extended. | Lower hips back down and switch legs.

name: Bosu Ball Situp
overview: Lie on back, bosu elevated toward the ceiling. | Sit up, engaging core muscles. | Lower back down to complete one situp.

name: Bosu Ball Split Squat
overview: Take a split stance. Make sure to keep your chest tall. | Bring your rear knee to the floor or close to it. | Drive through your front heel and your rear foot back to the starting position.

name: Bosu Ball Squat
overview: Stand on Bosu, feet shoulder-width apart. | Squat down, keeping knees aligned with toes. | Push through heels to stand back up.

name: Bosu Ball Superman
overview: Lie face down on Bosu, arms extended. | Lift arms, chest, and legs off the Bosu. | Hold for a moment, then lower back down.

name: Bosu Ball Toe Tap
overview: Stand in front of a low box. | Bring one foot to the edge of the box and alternate as quickly as possible. | Only lightly tap your feet to the box.

name: Bosu Ball Up And Over
overview: Stand next to Bosu, step up and over it. | Repeat, moving laterally side to side. | Keep a steady pace, engaging core muscles.

name: Bosu Ball Walkover Pushup
overview: Place both hands on Bosu, wider than shoulder-width. | Perform a pushup, then walk hands to the other side. | Perform another pushup, repeat back and forth.

name: Bosu Ball Wood Chopper
overview: Hold medicine ball with both hands and arms extended. | Swing ball diagonally across body, engaging core.

name: Vitruvian Arnold Press
overview: Stand tall with your palms facing yourself. | As you press, rotate your arms.

name: Vitruvian Belt Squat
overview: Set up the Vitruvian, including a the provided belt. | Position yourself with feet shoulder-width apart on the Vitruvian | Perform the squat by bending at the knees and hips, lowering your body until thighs are parallel to the ground. | Return to the starting position by extending your knees and hips, pushing through your feet.

name: Vitruvian Bench Press
overview: Lay on the flat bench. | Tuck your elbows slightly, press the handles toward the ceiling.

name: Vitruvian Crunch
overview: Hold the rope attachment and lay flat. | Flex your spine and curl your upper back off the ground.

name: Vitruvian Deficit Lunge
overview: Stand tall with both feet on the platform. | Step backwards and bring your back knee to the floor.

name: Vitruvian Figure Four Hip Thrust
overview: Wear the belt attachment. | Cross one leg over the other, and then press your hips toward the ceiling.

name: Vitruvian Front Squat
overview: Use the bar attachment. | Place the bar over your front delts and cross your arms. | Push your hips back and aim to hit parallel depth.

name: Vitruvian Hammer Curl
overview: Hold a neutral grip. | Flex your elbows until your forearms touch your biceps. | Extend your elbows fully to finish each rep.

name: Vitruvian Hip Thrust
overview: Put your back on the bench. | Place the bar or belt over your hips. | Flex and extend your hips fully on each rep.

name: Vitruvian Kneeling Wood Chopper
overview: Hold the attachment with both hands and take a kneeling position. | Rotate across your body.

name: Vitruvian Lateral Raise
overview: Stand tall with a neutral grip. | Raise your arms to the side and keep your elbows mostly extended.

name: Vitruvian Overhead Press
overview: Hold the handle attachments with your fists to the sky and elbows toward the floor. | Press the handles to the ceiling.

name: Vitruvian Pec Fly
overview: Lay flat on the bench. | Keep your elbows mostly extended and lower your arms toward the floor.

name: Vitruvian Push Up
overview: Use the belt attachment. Take a pushup position. | Have your elbows at a 45 degree angle. Break at the elbows until your upper arm gets to your side. | And then push up.

name: Vitruvian Rear Delt Fly
overview: Grab the two handles and hinge forward. | Keep your elbows mostly extended and raise your arms straight out to the side.

name: Vitruvian Romanian Deadlift
overview: Take an overhand grip. | Keep your knees mostly extended and hinge forward at the hips. | Keep a flat back.

name: Vitruvian Row
overview: Hold bosu and hinge forward. | Pull bosu towards chest, squeezing shoulder blades.

name: Vitruvian Seated Calf Raise
overview: Sit on the bench with the bar attachment over your legs. | Raise your heels up to the ceiling.

name: Vitruvian Shrug
overview: Stand tall and hold the two handle attachments. | Pull your shoulder blades straight up toward the ceiling.

name: Vitruvian Side Bend
overview: Hold one of the handle attachments. | Stand upright, lean to the opposing side of the cable.

name: Vitruvian Single Arm Row
overview: Take a staggered stance and hinge forward. | Grab one of the handle attachments and pull your elbow toward the ceiling.

name: Vitruvian Single Leg Deadlift
overview: Hold medicine ball while standing on one leg. | Hinge forward on one leg, extending other leg behind. | Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.

name: Vitruvian Staggered Deadlift
overview: Place one foot firmly on the ground and one foot behind the other. Bend the knee on your back leg. | Hinge forward until you feel a stretch in your front leg.

name: Vitruvian Standing Calf Raise
overview: Hold the two handles and stand tall. | Raise your heels as high as possible.

name: Vitruvian Windmill
overview: Hold the attachment in one hand and raise your arm over head. | Turn one foot outward and one foot forward. | Lean to the side while reaching for your foot.

name: Toe Tap
overview: Stand in front of a low box. | Bring one foot to the edge of the box and alternate as quickly as possible. | Only lightly tap your feet to the box.

name: Cardio Assault Bike Arms Only
overview: Adjust seat and handlebar height for comfort and proper posture on the assault bike. | Start pedaling with even, controlled motion, maintaining your desired resistance level. Then keep the motion going with only your arms.

name: Cardio Assault Bike
primary_muscle: Glutes, Shoulders, Quads, Chest, Front Shoulders
overview: Adjust seat and handlebar height for comfort and proper posture on the assault bike. | Start pedaling with even, controlled motion, maintaining your desired resistance level. | Monitor heart rate and intensity; increase or decrease resistance for an effective cardio workout.

name: Cardio Band Hammer Curl Jacks
overview: Stand with a band looped under both feet and the band grasped in both hands. | Do a light hop and bring your feet outward while simultaneously flexing the elbows. | Bring both feet back together and extend the elbows.

name: Cardio Band Press Jacks
overview: Stand with the band looped under both feet and the other end of the band in both hands in an overhead press position. | Do a light hop and bring both feet outward while pressing the band overhead.

name: Cardio Band Reverse Fly Jacks
overview: Grab the band with a double overhand grip. Bring both feet outward while performing a little hop. | As you hop, pull the band apart.

name: Cardio Band Seal Jacks
overview: Loop a band around your back. Start with both arms extended at your side. | As you perform the jack. Bring both arms together and make a little clap.

name: Cardio Box Quick Feet
overview: Stay light on your toes and tap both feet to the ground in quick succession. | Move in a square pattern.

name: Cardio Criss Cross Jacks
overview: Perform a jumping jack while crossing the feet.

name: Cardio Diamond Hop
overview: With both feet, leap forward then back, then to the left, then to the right. | Repeat.

name: Cardio Figure Eight Sprint
overview: Perform s sprint in a figure eight pattern. | Make sure to stay low.

name: Cardio Forward Scissor
overview: Do a light hop and split your stance. | Land lightly on your toes, and then bring the opposing leg forward.

name: Cardio In And Out Forward
overview: Bring one leg forward and then the other. | Bring the original leg backwards and then the other.

name: Cardio In And Outs
overview: Intermediate | Push | - | Compound

name: Cardio In In Out Out Shuffle
overview: Start with your feet side by side. | Bring one foot laterally, then the other. | Return the first foot to its starting position, then the other.

name: Cardio Jumping Jacks
overview: Stand with feet together, arms at your sides, ready to jump. | Jump while spreading legs and raising arms overhead. | Return to starting position with legs together and arms at your sides. Repeat.

name: Cardio Karaoke
overview: Stand upright, feet together, facing forward, ready to move laterally. | Move right foot behind left, then step left foot to the side. | Alternate crossing and stepping, increase speed, maintain rhythm and balance.

name: Cardio Knee Taps
overview: Stand straight, feet hip-width apart, engage core. | Lift knees alternately, tap with same side hand. | Continue rhythmically, maintain posture, increase speed as able.

name: Cardio Lateral Quick Feet
overview: Start with a shoulder width stance. | Quickly tap your feet while moving laterally.

name: Cardio Lateral Shuffle
overview: Start with a wide stance. | Shuffle sideways for a specified distance while maintaining a quarter squat position.

name: Cardio Long Jump
