overview: Stand feet shoulder-width, knees slightly bent, arms behind you, eyes forward. | Swing arms backward, squat deeply, loading legs for explosive power. | Swing arms, explode forward, extend legs mid-air, land softly on both feet.

name: Cardio Long Jump Shuffle Back
overview: Stand feet shoulder-width, knees slightly bent, arms behind you, eyes forward. | Swing arms backward, squat deeply, loading legs for explosive power. | Swing arms, explode forward, extend legs mid-air, land softly on both feet. | Shuffle back to the starting position.

name: Cardio Quick Feet
overview: Quickly tap each foot to the ground.

name: Cardio Row Erg Rower Arms Only
overview: Make sure your feet are strapped in tightly. | Without bending your legs, pull the handle to your ribcage. | Fully extend your elbows before initiating the next rep.

name: Cardio Row Erg Rower Four Stroke Sprint Start
overview: Sit on seat, feet strapped in, grip handle with arms extended. | Push with legs, lean back slightly. Do four small pulls with increasing distance on each rep. | Extend arms, lean forward from hips, bend knees to return to start.

name: Cardio Row Erg Rower
overview: Sit on seat, feet strapped in, grip handle with arms extended. | Push with legs, lean back slightly, pull handle to lower ribs. | Extend arms, lean forward from hips, bend knees to return to start.

name: Cardio Row Erg Rower Legs Only
overview: Strap your feet in tightly. | Keep your arms extended while flexing and extending at the hips and knees.

name: Cardio Seal Jacks
overview: Stand with feet together, arms in front at chest level, palms touching. | Spread legs wide, simultaneously swing arms out to sides, palms facing forward. | Jump back to starting position, bringing arms together again quickly. Repeat rhythmically.

name: Cardio Shuttle Sprint
overview: Set up two cones at a specified distance. | Stay low and sprint quickly to the second cone. | Hinge forward and tap the cone, then turn and sprint to the original cone. | Repeat for the desired time or reps.

name: Cardio Single Leg Forward Hop
overview: Pick up one leg off the ground. | Hop forward and backward quickly while staying on your toes.

name: Cardio Single Leg Lateral Hop
overview: Pick up one leg off the ground. | Hop laterally quickly while staying on your toes.

name: Cardio Skater
overview: Stand, balance on right foot, left foot behind, slightly bent knees. | Jump to left, landing on left foot, right foot behind, swinging arms. | Continue leaping side-to-side, maintaining balance and speed, like a speed skater.

name: Cardio Skater To Single Leg Burpee
overview: Leap sideways, land on right foot, left leg behind to the side. | Drop into a single-leg burpee, right leg only, hands to ground. | Return to standing on right, leap sideways to left, repeat with left leg.

name: Cardio Ski Erg
overview: Leap sideways, land on right foot, left leg behind to the side. | Drop into a single-leg burpee, right leg only, hands to ground. | Return to standing on right, leap sideways to left, repeat with left leg.

name: Cardio Sprint In Place
overview: Stand tall, feet hip-width apart, knees slightly bent, ready to move. | Quickly drive knees up towards chest, alternating legs, pumping arms in rhythm. | Gradually speed up, maintaining high knees and arm movement, breathe steadily.

name: Cardio Step Out Jacks
overview: Stand tall, feet together, arms by sides, ready to move. | Step right foot out, simultaneously raise arms above head. | Step right foot in, lower arms, repeat left, maintain rhythm.

name: Cardio Three Step Heismans
overview: Start with a shoulder width stance. | Stay on your toes, step right, tap your left toe to the ground, plant your right foot and raise your left leg. | Then repeat in the opposite direction.

name: Treadmill Jog
overview: Get the treadmill up to a comfortable speed where you are doing a light jog.

name: Treadmill Sprint
overview: Get the treadmill up to a speed where you are doing a sprint.

name: Treadmill Walk
overview: Get the treadmill up to a comfortable speed where you are doing a walk.

name: Treadmill Backwards Walk
overview: Face the opposite direction on the treadmill. | Hold on to the arms to find your balance. | Walk backwards pushing your toes through the front of your shoes.

name: Treadmill Side Shuffle
overview: Face sideways on the treadmill. | Take a quarter squat position with a wide stance. | Shuffle sideways for a specified amount of time, then switch sides.

name: Stationary Bike
overview: Hold the handles and maintain a neutral spine. | Pedal at a moderate pace and try to minimise rocking back and forth.

name: Jump Rope
overview: Hold handles, elbows close, and jump with both feet together. | Rotate wrists to swing the rope over your head. | Jump as it reaches your feet, keeping a steady rhythm.

name: Butt Kick
overview: Stand tall, jog in place, bringing heels toward your glutes. | Keep your core tight and swing arms naturally. | Alternate legs quickly, maintaining a steady rhythm.

name: Elliptical
overview: Step onto the pedals, grip the handles, and start moving your feet in a natural stride. | Adjust resistance and incline for desired intensity while maintaining a steady, controlled motion. | Keep your posture upright, engage your core, and maintain a consistent pace for an effective workout.

name: Smith Machine Drag Curl
overview: Grab the bar with an underhand grip. | Pull your elbows straight back and let the bar drag against your upper body (or very close to it).

name: Smith Machine Glute Kickback
overview: Start on your hands and knees with one foot placed on the bottom of the bar. | Keeping your core braced, your back flat, and your moving leg bent at a 90 degree angle, drive the heel of your working leg up the ceiling while squeezing your glute. | Follow the movement path as you bring your knee back down to the ground beneath your hip, keeping your knee bent to maintain control of the bar. | Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching sides.

name: Smith Machine Hanging Knee Tuck
overview: Put a hip thrust pad on the smith machine bar at neck height. Put both arms over the bar and pull your feet off the ground. | Pull your knees to your chest and flex your abs.

name: Smith Machine Underhand Row
overview: Begin by standing in front of a bar with your feet about hip-width apart. | Bend at the hips and knees to grab the bar with a supinated (underhand) grip, positioning the bar about an inch away from your shins. | Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, use your back muscles to lift the bar straight up towards your chest. | As the bar reaches your chest, pause briefly, and then lower the bar back to the starting position.

name: Smith Machine Sissy Squat
overview: Stand facing away from the machine, positioning your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart to provide a stable base, and then reach behind you to firmly grip the bar with both hands, maintaining an overhand grip. | Initiate the movement by leaning backward, allowing your upper body to incline while simultaneously bending your knees. As you descend, maintain control | drive through your quadriceps while pushing your hips forward, gradually straightening your knees. Maintain a slow, controlled pace

name: Smith Machine Oblique Crunch
overview: Lay on your side with your knees bent. | Hold the bar extended over you. | Lift yourself up by flexing your obliques.

name: Smith Machine Reverse Crunch Hip Raise
overview: Lay flat on the ground. With your feet on the bar. | Lift your hips off the ground.

name: Smith Machine Leg Press
overview: Place your legs on the bar with your feet at shoulder width. | Release the weight and extend your legs fully, without locking your knees. | Lower the weight until your legs are at a 90° angle (but DO NOT allow your butt and lower back to rise off of the floor. This will put your lower back in a rounded position, which is very dangerous.) | Raise the weight back to starting position.

name: Smith Machine Side Plank Up Down
overview: Start by lying on your side with your feet stacked on top of each other and the bar on your hip. | Place your bottom elbow on the ground beneath your shoulder and engage your core to raise your hips off the ground. | Your hips will do all the moving. Think, "hips up, hips down."

name: Smith Machine Situp
overview: Set up the Smith machine bar at an appropriate height. | Lie on your back beneath the bar, gripping it with your hands. | Engage your core, lift your upper body toward the bar, and exhale. | Lower your upper body back down in a controlled manner, inhaling.

name: Smith Machine Single Leg Hip Thrust
overview: Start by lying on a bench with your foot on the ground and a barbell on your hips. | Lift one leg off the ground and engage your glutes to raise your hips up towards the ceiling. | From this starting position, slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.

name: Smith Machine Hip Thrust
overview: Sit on the ground with a bench behind you. Have the bar over your legs just above your hips. | Lean back against the bench so that your shoulders are resting upon it, stretch your arms out to either side using the bench as support. | Raise the weight by driving through your feet and extending your hips upwards. Support the weight with your shoulders and feet. | Slowly extend as far as you can, and then slowly return to the starting position.

name: Smith Machine Seated Calf Raise
overview: Start by sitting on a bench or box with the bar resting on your knees. Your feet should be flat on the ground, about hip-width apart. | Place your hands on the barbell for support, and lift your heels off the ground. | Hold this position for a moment, then slowly lower your heels back to the ground.

name: Smith Machine Skullcrusher
overview: Take a shoulder width grip. Break at the elbows. Try to keep your elbows tucked in. Don't let them flare out. | Stop the bar a few inches from your forehead and extend your elbows back up.

name: Smith Machine Guillotine Bench Press
overview: Lie on the flat bench, grasp the bar at shoulder level with your palms facing forward. | Slowly lower the bar to your chest, keeping your elbows flared out. | Once you feel a stretch in your chest press the weight back up.

name: Smith Machine Close Grip Bench Press
overview: Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. With a narrow grip on the bar, straighten your arms | Lower the bar to your lower-mid chest | Slowly raise the bar until you've locked your elbows.

name: Smith Machine Bench Press
overview: Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. With straight arms unrack the bar. | Lower the bar to your mid chest | Raise the bar until you've locked your elbows.

name: Smith Machine Incline Bench Press
overview: Position the bench between 30 and 45 degrees. | Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. With straight arms unrack the bar. | Lower the bar to your mid chest | Raise the bar (slowly and controlled) until you've locked your elbows.

name: Smith Machine Seated Overhead Press
overview: Sit on a bench with back support. Raise the bar to shoulder height with your palms forward. | Raise the bar upwards and pause at the contracted position. | Lower the weight back to starting position.

name: Smith Machine Bodyweight Skullcrusher
overview: Hold the smith bar and lean forward. | Keep your elbows tucked in and then flex and extend at the elbows.

name: Smith Machine Inverted Row
overview: Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip. | Pull your body straight up to the bar. | Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.

name: Smith Machine Overhand Row
overview: Start hinged forward with a flat back. Make sure your elbows are fully extended. | Pull the bar to your sternum.

name: Smith Machine Upright Row
overview: Take a double overhand roughly shoulder width grip. | Pull your elbows straight up the ceiling. Aim to get the bar to chin level or slightly higher. | lower the bar and repeat.

name: Smith Machine Assisted Pullup
overview: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended. Leave your feet on the floor. | Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar. Use your legs top assist you up. | Lower your body back to starting position.

name: Smith Machine Pushup
overview: Place hands on the bar, in push-up position. | Lower yourself to the bar, maintaining proper form.

name: Smith Machine Side Bend
overview: Stand beside the bar. | Keep your hips and shoulders facing forward, bend to one side slowly | Return to the upright position. | Switch hands and repeat.

name: Smith Machine Calf Raise
overview: Place the bar on your back | Start with feet flat on the ground | Extend your heels upwards while keeping your knees stationary, and pause at the contracted position. | Slowly return to the starting position. Repeat.

name: Smith Machine Sumo Romanian Deadlift
overview: Stance width can vary with a sumo DL. Some prefer toes near the plates. Others prefer a more narrow stance to get more drive off the floor. | Make sure your arms are inside your legs. The bar should be just over your mid-foot. Flatten your back and unrack the bar | Leave your knees mostly extended and flex and extend your hips.

name: Smith Machine Staggered Deadlift
overview: Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time. | Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring. | When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.

name: Smith Machine Romanian Deadlift
overview: Take a shoulder width, double overhand or mixed grip. | Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. | When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

name: Smith Machine Split Squat
overview: Take a large step forward with one leg until your shoulders are under the smith machine | lower your body until your back knee nearly touches the ground. Your front knee should be bent at a 90-degree angle, and your back leg should be straight. | Push through the heel of your front foot to raise your body back to the starting position.

name: Smith Machine Reverse Lunge
overview: Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart, with the bar on your shoulders. Your feet should be slightly pointed outward, and your shoulders should be down and relaxed. | Step backward with one foot, lowering your body until your front thigh is parallel to the ground and your back knee is hovering just above the ground. | Push off your back foot, returning to the starting position.

name: Smith Machine Narrow Stance Squat
overview: Place the bar on top of your traps. Take a narrow stance. | Push your hips back and break at the knees. Push your elbows forward to keep yourself from getting pitched too far forward. | Aim to get your hamstrings to parallel with the floor. | Push your heels into the floor and squat back to a standing position.

name: Smith Machine Squat
overview: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Maintain the natural arch in your back and put the bar on your back. Squeezing your shoulder blades and raise your chest. | Grip the bar across your shoulders and support it on your upper back. Unwrack the smith machine by straightening your legs. | Bend your knees as you lower the weight without altering the form of your back until your hips are below your knees. | Raise the bar back to starting position, lift with your legs and exhale at the top.

name: Hamstring Stretch Supine Glide
overview: Place a theraband around your foot. | Lie back onto the ground. | Raise your leg to stretching point with the aid of the band, keeping a slightly bent knee. | Extend and bend your knee to actively stretch your hamstring.

name: Hamstring Stretch Supine Dynamic Band
overview: Place a theraband or stretch strap around your foot. | Lie back onto the ground. | Raise your leg to stretching point with the aid of the band (strap). | Tug onto the strap on the end of range to dynamically stretch the hamstring.

name: Gastrocnemius Stretch Push Up Position
overview: Get yourself in the pushup position. | Straighten your knees and try to push one heel down towards the ground. | Cross your other leg over the top to apply extra pressure to the stretch.

name: Lat And Shoulder External Rotation Stretch 2 Kneeling Dowel
primary_muscle: Lats, Shoulders, Front Shoulders, Rear Shoulders
overview: Kneel in front of a bench, placing your elbows on with palms facing up while holding the dowel at shoulder width. | Sit your hips back onto your heels, pressing the head in between the arms. | You should feel a stretch in your lats, triceps and deep in the shoulder joint. | You can add movement (bend-extended arms) to mobilise the shoulder joint.

name: Lat And Shoulder External Rotation Stretch 3 Kneeling Dowel
primary_muscle: Lats, Shoulders, Front Shoulders, Rear Shoulders
overview: Kneel in front of a bench, placing your elbows on with palms facing up while holding the dowel at shoulder width. | Sit your hips back onto your heels, pressing the head in between the arms. | You should feel a stretch in your lats, triceps and deep in the shoulder joint. | You can add movement (bend-extended arms) to mobilise the shoulder joint.

name: Core Stability Regression Crosslateral Limb Raise Push Up Position
primary_muscle: Abdominals, Glutes, Shoulders, Obliques, Front Shoulders
overview: Bring yourself to a strict push-up position | Tap the hand of the working arm on the ground to find your balance. Raise opposite limbs till they are parallel to the ground | Hold for a split second and then try to bring your elbow to your opposite knee by driving both towards the centre of the body. | Spine might curve slightly but you should not shift your hips during the movement.

name: Kneeling Quad Stretch
overview: Sit on your heels. | Lean back onto your palms. | To increase stretch intensity lift bum off heels.

name: Glute Hip Rotator Stretch 3 Seated
overview: Sit on a bench. | Cross the ankle of one leg over the knee of the other. | Push your knee away from you and lean forward for a specified amount of time.

name: Towel Knee Extension
overview: Sit on the floor and use your palms to lean back into. | Place a rolled towel under your knee so it is slightly bent. | Try to squeeze the towel between the back of your knee and the ground by extending the leg.

name: Crosslateral Core Stabilisation Unilateral Load Kettlebell
overview: Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart and holding a kettlebell at one side of your body, with your palms facing your thighs. | Hing forward with a flat back and lift the kettlebell. | Hold the kettlebell at your side and make sure to not lean to one side.

name: Seated Doming
overview: Sit on a bench or box. Press the big toe into the ground till you feel the inside part of your foot raise off the ground | The arch of your foot should now look more pronounced. Do not roll your foot out to lift the inside part of your foot | You should perform the exercise bare foot or with socks, but do not wear shoes.

name: Bench Lift Off Active
overview: While seated on a bench, place your palms on the bench by your sides | Palm placement should allow room for the fingers to grip the edge of the bench | Try to lift your bodyweight off the bench by pushing the palms into the bench | Lockout your elbows and repeat or hold isometrically

name: Calf Stretch On Box Bilateral
overview: Stand on a box. From the standing position, shift your weight onto the balls of one foot. | Lower the heels of your feet toward the ground, and hold the position for the duration specified | You should feel your calf stretching.

name: Calf Raise Isometric Unilateral
overview: From the standing position, shift your weight onto the balls of one foot. | Raise your heel off the ground, and hold the position for the duration specified | You should feel your calf working.

name: Ys
overview: Lie on your front with your arms in the "Y" position. Thumbs facing up. | Raise your arms without bending the elbows.

name: Seated Wrist Flexor Stretch
overview: Bring one arm in front of you palm facing up, elbow straight and shoulder relaxed. | With your other hand hold onto the palm and force it into passive extension. | This will stretch your wrist flexors.

name: Seated Wrist Extensor Stretch
overview: Raise one arm keeping your shoulder relaxed. | Hold the back of your palm with the other hand and passively flex the wrist. | You should feel a stretch on the top part of your arm.

name: Wrist Extensor Mobilisation
overview: Kneel by a bench placing the arm you want to mobilise on, palm facing down. | Bring a massage ball to the top of your forearm and move it around applying gentle pressure. | Find the right/sore spot. | You can move your wrist in various directions in order to mobilise your wrist extensors.

name: Wrist Extensor Kneeling Hold
overview: Drape your forearm over a bench. | Hold a dumbbell in a neutral wrist position with your palm facing downwards.

name: Bosu Ball Single Leg Squat
overview: Stand on a bosu ball and balance on one leg. | Try to bend and extend the knee of the supporting leg (single leg squat) while keeping your balance.

name: Seated Upper Trap And Suprispinatus Stretch
overview: Sit on the back of your palm. | Straighten the back and pull the shoulders back. | Lean your head to the opposite side.

name: Ulnar Deviations
overview: Stand up straight holding a dowel/lever/weight in one hand. | Hold the weight so it points behind you and towards the ground. | Squeeze your grip to raise the weight.

name: Thoracic Flexion And Extensions
overview: Bring yourself on all 4's. Push the ground away from you, rounding back and shoulders as much as possible. | To enhance the spine flexion suck the belly button in and tuck the tailbone (coccyx) under. Hold this position for a brief moment | Now do the exact opposite, try to bend the spine backwards. Go back and forth on these positions

name: Shoulder Flexion Thoracic Extensions
overview: Place a tube roller or half tube on the ground parallel to your body. | Lie on the tube making sure your whole back and neck are supported. | Knees bent and on the ground, lower back flat on the tube and chin tucked in. | Bring your arms by you hips and pull shoulders back. | This is your starting position. Raise arms and drop them back towards the ground over your head

name: Thoracic Extensions Foam Roller
overview: Place a foam roller on the floor perpendicular to your body. | Sit and lie back onto it aiming for your mid back to be in contact with the roller. | Gently tilt your hips backward, squeeze glutes and engage core to protect the lower back. | Support head on palms, elbows rotated in. Slightly lift hips off the ground.

name: Laying Ts
overview: Lie on your front, arms outstretched to the side. | Raise head and chest off the ground. | Raise and lower your arms (flapping wings motion) by contracting and relaxing the muscles in between your shoulder blades.

name: Alternating Swipe Around
overview: Lie on your front, arms above head. Squeeze glutes to protect lower back | Raise your chest and arms off the ground. Adduct (bring your arms by your hips) in an alternating fashion. | You can touch down and repeat the whole movement, or remain off the ground and just perform the "swipes."

name: Swipe Around
overview: Lie on your front, arms above head. Squeeze glutes to protect lower back | Raise your chest and arms off the ground. Adduct (bring your arms by your hips) | You can touch down and repeat the whole movement, or remain off the ground and just perform the "swipes."

name: Single Leg Eccentric Box Squat
overview: Stand in front of a bench or box. Lift one leg in front you supporting yourself on the other leg. | Try to sit on the box in a controlled manner. Use both legs to stand back up

name: Single Leg Concentric Squat
overview: From the standing position lower your body into a squat. | Shift your weight onto one leg (the other is still in contact with the ground for balance). | Use the loaded leg to lift your body into standing position.

name: Soleus Stretch
overview: Stand close to a wall on a narrow, staggered stance (toes of the back leg should be at the same level as the heel of the front leg). | Keep your weight on the back leg as you bend your knees. | Hold the position for the prescribed duration.

name: Skydiver
overview: Lie on your front with your arms by your side, palms facing down. | Tense your back muscles to raise both ends of your body off the ground. | Keep your core engaged as you will be supporting your weight on your belly.

name: Skater Squat
overview: From the standing position shift your weight onto the working leg and keep the other one suspended behind you | Tilt at the hips and lean over as you are bending the loaded knee | Bring your back knee close to the ground before standing back up.

name: Box Supported Single Leg Deadlift
overview: Place a box behind you and one foot on it. Keep your chest up and the back straight | Tilt at the hips to perform a deadlift. Use the box for balance and support | Make sure you straighten your back leg when performing the deadlift. | As you get comfortable with the movement, try to lift the leg off the box when you reach the end range of the deadlift.

name: Side Step On And Off Box
overview: Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart. Your feet should be slightly pointed outward, and your shoulders should be down and relaxed. | Place a step or box beside you, and step up onto it with one foot. Then bring the other foot to the box.

name: Dumbbell Pullover Eccentrics
overview: Lie on a bench holding a dumbbell over your shoulder, straight arm. | Slowly lower your arm towards the ground (overhead position). | Pause in the stretched position. | Bend your elbow to return to the starting position.

name: Band Shoulder Y Raise
overview: Hold one end of a band with your arm to the side and behind your body. | Hold the other end in front of your body (overhand grip). | Move your arm away from your body and upward while externally rotating your shoulder. | Finish with your arm over your head and thumb up

name: Dumbbell Service Exercise
overview: Stand up straight and hold a dumbbell in one arm. Perform a bicep curl across your body | Bring the dumbbell to your shoulder and rotate palm and elbow out. | Point the elbow towards the ceiling while the dumbbell remains just over the shoulder. | Extend your elbow to raise the dumbbell over your head. Start lowering your arm to your side as you turn the palm to face down

name: Serratus Activation Cross Punch
overview: Lie on your back with your knees bent and the feet flat on the floor. | Hold a dumbbell over your shoulder with a straight arm. | Form the sign of the cross adding a protraction (punch) on every end of the cross, including the middle position.

name: Bosu Serratus Activation Active Plank
overview: Support your weight on your forearms and toes (plank). | Allow your upper back to sink in between the shoulder blades. | Push your elbows into the ground and slightly forward, and move the shoulder blades away from the spine.

name: Serratus Activation Active Plank
overview: Support your weight on your forearms and toes (plank). | Allow your upper back to sink in between the shoulder blades. | Push your elbows into the ground and slightly forward, and move the shoulder blades away from the spine.

name: Bosu Serratus Activation Plank
overview: Support your weight with your forearms on the bosu and toes on the floor (plank). | Allow your upper back to sink in between the shoulder blades. | Push your elbows into the ground and slightly forward, and move the shoulder blades away from the spine.

name: Serratus Activation Plank
overview: Support your weight on your forearms and toes (plank). | Allow your upper back to sink in between the shoulder blades. | Push your elbows into the ground and slightly forward, and move the shoulder blades away from the spine.

name: Scapular Retraction
overview: From the standing or seated position straighten your back. | Pull the shoulders back but keep them relaxed. | Move shoulders backwards and return to the starting, relaxed position.

name: Scapular Elevation
overview: From the standing or seated position straighten your back. | Pull the shoulders back but keep them relaxed. | Move shoulders towards from your ears and return to the starting, relaxed position.

name: Scapular Depression
overview: From the standing or seated position straighten your back. | Pull the shoulders back but keep them relaxed. | Move shoulders away from your ears and return to the starting, relaxed position.

name: Seated Radial Nerve Tensioner
overview: Bend your elbow bringing your thumb to the centre of your chest. | Extend your elbow to the side with the palm facing back, and wrist flexed | As your extending the arm, lean your head towards the opposite shoulder | Once you reach maximum tension (without pain) hold the position

name: Seated Radial Nerve Slider
overview: From the seated position bring your arm out to the side with the palm facing back. | Flex your wrist at the same time you are leaning your head towards your outstretched arm. | Bend your head away from the the outstretched arm while simultaneously extending the wrist.

name: Seated Quad Stretch
overview: Sit against the wall with one leg slightly bent. | Wrap a stretch strap or towel around your ankle and pull the heel towards the hips.

name: Band Floor Quad Stretch
overview: Lie on your front. Bend one leg, reach back and grab the foot with one arm | Pull the heel towards the glute to stretch your quad. | You can use a band or stretch strap to do the same thing.

name: Foam Roller Quad Mobilisation
overview: Lie on your front placing a foam roller under your thigh. | Roll up and down till you find a tight/sore spot. | Hold this position and start bending and extending your knee to mobilise the quad.

name: QL Mobilisation Floor Foam Roller
overview: Lie on the floor keeping your knees bent and the feet on the floor. | Place a massage ball under your lower back and move around till the ball presses into a tight/sore spot. | If you use a foam roller you would have to be seated and leaning back into the roller.

name: Prayer Stretch 2 Roller
overview: Sit on your heels and reach out your arms on a box or foam roller while pressing the chest towards the ground.

name: Seated Hip Flexion Hold
overview: Sit on a bench without back support. | Keep an upright back and your shoulders back. | Raise one leg and maintain the position for the specified duration.

name: Band Glute Kickback Hold
overview: Attach a band to a fixed point. Wrap the loose end of the band around your ankle. | Face the attachment point. Shift you weight onto one leg (use balancing aids if needed). | Extend your working leg and maintain the position.

name: Hip Extension Into Side Flexion
overview: Start on the 4 point position (on all fours). | Straighten and raise one leg till it is parallel to the ground. | Make sure your spine remains in a neutral position. | If you feel your lower back stiff or sore when performing this exercise, ask a trainer or therapist to guide you through.

name: Prayer Stretch 1
overview: Sit on your heels and reach out your arms on the floor while pressing the chest towards the ground.

name: Prayer Stretch Side Bend
overview: Sit on your heels and reach out your arms on the floor while pressing the chest towards the ground. | Bend your spine towards one side and reach over with your arms. | Do the same on the opposite side.

name: Prone Single Leg Hip Extension Hold
overview: Lie on your stomach. | Secure your lower back by tilting your hips backwards. | Raise one leg and hold the position for the specified duration.

name: Hip Extension External Rotation Pulses 4Pt Position
overview: Start on the 4 point position (on all fours). | Straighten and raise one leg till it is parallel to the ground and externally rotate the leg (knee aims out). | Perform small upward movements while maintaining the externally rotated position of the knee. | Make sure your spine remains in a neutral position.

name: Hip Extension External Rotation 4Pt Position
overview: Start on the 4 point position (on all fours). | Straighten and raise one leg till it is parallel to the ground. | Maintain the position but externally rotate the leg (knee aims out) | If you feel your lower back stiff or sore when performing this exercise, ask a trainer or therapist to guide you through.

name: Hip Extension 4Pt Position Hold
overview: Start on the 4 point position (on all fours). | Straighten and raise one leg till it is parallel to the ground. | Make sure your spine remains in a neutral position. | If you feel your lower back stiff or sore when performing this exercise, ask a trainer or therapist to guide you through.

name: Hamstring Stretch Supine Static
overview: Place a theraband or stretch strap around your foot. | Lie back onto the ground. | Raise your leg to stretching point with the aid of the band (strap). | Tug onto the strap on the end of range to dynamically stretch the hamstring.

name: Hamstring Stretch Static Standing Single Leg
overview: From the standing position, bring one leg slightly forward. | Raise your toes and lean over towards them. | Maintain the position.

name: Seated Plantar Flexions
overview: Sit on the floor using your palms or elbows to lean back onto. | Attach one end of a band around your toes and hold onto the other. | Point and flex the toes against the resistance.

name: Hamstring Stretch Seated Single Leg Isometric
overview: Sit against a wall. | Bend one leg and tuck the foot by the straight leg's knee. | Dynamically reach forward towards your toes and return to starting position.

name: Hamstring Stretch Seated Single Leg
overview: Beginner | Hold | - | Isolation

name: Hamstring Stretch Dynamic Supine Alternating
overview: Lie on your back with straight legs. | Perform a posterior pelvic tilt and maintain the position. | Kick one leg up to feel a stretch in the hamstring.

name: Hamstring Stretch Dynamic Standing Bilateral
overview: Standing, split stance. | Dynamically kick your back leg forward and up. | Return to starting position.

name: Hamstring Mobilisation Seated Lacrosse Ball
overview: Place a massage ball on a bench. | Sit on the ball with your hamstring. | Move around till you find a tight/sore spot. | Extend and bend your knee to mobilise the hamstring.

name: Standing Neck Side Flexions
overview: Pull your shoulders back and away from the ears and straighten the back. | Lean your head to the side (bring your ear to your shoulder) without shrugging your shoulder or leaning the spine to the side.

name: Standing Neck Rotations
overview: Pull your shoulders back and away from the ears and straighten the back. | Rotate your head from side to side without rounding your shoulders.

name: Standing Neck Flexions
overview: Pull your shoulders back and away from the ears and straighten the back. | Tuck your chin in and drop your head forwards without rounding the back.

name: Standing Neck Extensions
overview: Pull your shoulders back and away from the ears and straighten the back. | Lean your head back trying to keep the front of the neck straight. | Point your chin to the ceiling.

name: Glute Piriformis Mobilisation 1 Floor Seated Lacrosse Ball
overview: Sit on a massage ball distributing your weight between feet, palm and glute. | Lean to the side and try to find a tight/painful spot while wiggling on the ball. | Follow the pain as it shifts around your glute.

name: Glute Hip Rotator Stretch 2 Seated
overview: Sit on a bench. | Cross the ankle of one leg over the knee of the other. | Pull your knee toward  you and hold for a specified amount of time.

name: Glute Hip Rotator Stretch 1 Seated
overview: Sit on a bench. | Cross the ankle of one leg over the knee of the other. | Press the knee of the crossed leg outwards.

name: Glute Hip Rotator Stretch Supine
overview: Lie on your back with bent knees and feet on the floor. | Cross the ankle of your one leg over the knee of the other. | Reach in between your legs, grabbing the thigh of the leg that is still on the ground. | Pull that leg towards your chest.

name: Glute Stretch Knee Pull Dynamic Standing
overview: Stand up straight with a good form. | Alternate between pulling your knees towards you chest. | Make sure you maintain an upright posture throughout the movement.

name: Standing Neck Mobility Circumductions
overview: Pull your shoulders back and away from the ears and straighten the back | Circumduct the head both clockwise and anti-clockwise making sure you  are working on the end range throughout the movement.

name: Glute Stretch Static Unilateral
overview: Lie on your back. | Bend one knee and pull it towards your chest. | Maintain the stretch for a few seconds before swapping legs.

name: Gastrocnemius Stretch Unilateral On Box
overview: Stand on the edge of a box, knees extended. | Bend one leg while allowing the weight to push the heel of your straight leg towards the ground. | You should feel your calves being stretched.

name: Gastrocnemius Stretch Unilateral On Wall
overview: Stand by a wall but not too close. | Place the palms on the wall and extend one leg behind you, while slightly bending the front leg. | Push the wall in order to drive the heel of the extended leg into the ground till you feel a stretch in your calf.

name: Gastrocnemius Stretch Bilateral On Box
overview: Stand on the edge of a box, knees extended. | Let your weight push your heels towards the ground. | You should feel your calves being stretched.

name: Femoral Nerve Mobilisation
overview: While standing, bend your knee and grab your foot. | Bring your knee forward while tucking your chin (head forward). | Pull the leg back while tilting your head backwards (look up).

name: Eversions
overview: Sit on a step or low box, preferably with a back support. Extend both legs and wrap the band around the balls of the working foot | Pass the band around the other foot as shown in the video. Hold the end of the band with the opposite arm of the working foot | The ankle should be at 90° and turned inwards (inversion) before you start the movement. Turn the ankle out, without moving the rest of the leg.

name: Elbow Extensor Mobilisation Kneeling Lacrosse Ball
overview: Kneel in front of a bench and place a massage ball on it. | Place your tricep (back of the arm) on the ball with the elbow bent. Try to find a tight, painful spot. | Once you have found it, apply gentle pressure on the ball. | Once you get comfortable with the pain extend and bend your arm.

name: Elbow Extensor Isometric Seated Overhead Dumbbell
overview: Sit on a box or bench without any back support. | Raise the weight over your head and extend your elbow. | From there, bend the elbow 1/4 of the way. | Hold isometrically for the prescribed amount of time.

name: Dorsal Flexion Hold
overview: From the standing position, raise your toes and balance on your heels for the given duration. | Maintain a good upper body form.

name: Wall Supported Dorsal Flexion
overview: Lean against a wall, raise your toes and balance on your heels for the given duration. | Maintain a good upper body form.

name: Standing Doming
overview: From the standing position press the big toe into the ground till you feel the inside part of your foot raise off the ground | The arch of your foot should now look more pronounced. | Do not roll your foot out to lift the inside part of your foot.

name: Deadlift Bounces Stretch
overview: Stand up straight with a good form. | Send your hips back and start tilting the upper body. | Maintain a straight back as you aim for your toes. | Your range depends on your hamstring flexibility.

name: Bodyweight Deadlift
overview: Stand up straight with a good form. | Send your hips back and start tilting the upper body. | Maintain a straight back as you aim for your toes. | Lower the bar to the floor by bending your knees and keeping your back straight.

name: Dead Bugs Same Side
overview: Lay on your back. Extend your straight arms above the chest and raise your bent knees till they are over your hips. | Lower limbs of the same side towards the ground. You can feel the ground but do not rest on or tap off of the ground. | Maintain a flat lower back throughout the movement (lower back should be in contact with the ground).

name: Dead Bugs Cross Lateral
overview: Lay on your back. Extend your straight arms above the chest and raise your bent knees till they are over your hips. | Lower opposite limbs towards the ground. You can feel the ground but do not rest on or tap off of the ground. | Maintain a flat lower back throughout the movement (lower back should be in contact with the ground).

name: Lumbar Rotation 5
overview: Lie on your back with your knees bent and the feet flat on the ground. | Drop your knees towards one side and add a kick at the end of range. | To increase the intensity of the stretch you can reach up with your arms.

name: Core Stability 5 Crosslateral Limb Raise Into Knee Elbow Tuck Push Up Position
primary_muscle: Abdominals, Glutes, Shoulders, Obliques, Front Shoulders
overview: Bring yourself to a strict push-up position | Raise opposite limbs till they are parallel to the ground | Hold for a split second and then try to bring your elbow to your opposite knee by driving both towards the centre of the body. | Spine might curve slightly but you should not shift your hips during the movement.

name: Lumbar Rotation 3
overview: Lie on your back with your knees bent and the feet flat on the ground. | Drop your knees towards one side then place your ankle on the opposite knee. | To increase the intensity of the stretch you can reach up with your arms.

name: Core Stability 4 Crosslateral Limb Raise Push Up Position
primary_muscle: Abdominals, Glutes, Shoulders, Obliques, Front Shoulders
overview: Bring yourself to a strict push-up position | Maintain a toe placement roughly at shoulder width (the wider the leg stance the easier the exercise - the narrower the stance the more difficult it becomes. | Tap your opposite shoulder with your fingertips. | Do not tilt or shift your hips. Do not round or arch your back.

name: Core Stability 2 Opposite Shoulder Tap 4Pt Position
primary_muscle: Biceps, Abdominals, Shoulders, Triceps, Obliques, Front Shoulders
overview: Bring yourself to the 4 point position (on all fours). 90° angles at hips and shoulder and neutral spine. | Lift your knees slightly off the ground supporting your weight on palms and toes. | Maintain a toe placement roughly at shoulder width (the wider the leg stance the easier the exercise - the narrower the stance the more difficult it becomes. | Tap your opposite shoulder with your fingertips.

name: Lumbar Rotation 4
overview: Lie on your back with your knees bent and the feet flat on the ground. | Cross your legs. Drop your knees towards one side before moving towards the other. | To increase the intensity of the stretch you can reach up with your arms.

name: Lumbar Rotation 2
overview: Lie on your back with your knees bent and the feet flat on the ground. | Drop your knees towards one side before moving towards the other. | To increase the intensity of the stretch you can reach up with your arms.

name: Core Stability 1 Crosslateral Limb Raise 4Pt Position
primary_muscle: Abdominals, Glutes, Shoulders, Obliques, Front Shoulders
overview: Bring yourself to the 4 point position (on all fours) | 90° angles at hips and shoulder and neutral spine | Raise opposite limbs till they are parallel to the ground | Hold for a split second and bring back to starting position

name: Lumbar Rotation 1
overview: Lie on your back with your knees bent and the feet flat on the ground. | Keep your knees and ankles together. Drop both knees towards the same side. | Stay in this position and breathe deep and slow. | To increase the intensity of the stretch you can reach up with your arms.

name: Cobra Stretch 2
overview: Lay on your front placing your palms under your shoulders | Keep the elbows bent and close to your body | Lift your upper body off the ground supporting your weight on your palms | Keep the hips on the ground

name: Cobra Stretch 1
overview: Lay on your front placing your palms under your shoulders | Keep the elbows bent and close to your body | Lift your upper body off the ground supporting your weight on your forearms | Keep the hips on the ground

name: Clock Taps
overview: Balance on one leg | Try to tap your targets with the toes of your suspended leg | The goal is to maintain balance while moving your leg towards the target and back

name: Floor Knee Pull Bilateral
overview: Lie on your back with bent knees. | Hug your knees and pull them towards your chest. | Feel your lower back come off the ground. | You can add a you can add an abduction to target the hips as well.

name: Lumbar Extensor Mobilisation Supine Bent Knees Peanut Tool
overview: Lie on your back with your feet on a bench. Place a peanut tool under your lower back. | Adjust pressure by pressing your heels into the bench. Roll back and forth or side to side | Maintain a neutral lower back (do not tilt the pelvis).

name: Lower Back Extensions 4
overview: Lie on your front and bring your arms in the "I" position, thumbs pointing the ceiling. | Squeeze your glutes and tilt your hips backwards (flattens the front of your hips against the ground). | Raise your chest off the ground and lower it without resting on the ground before the next rep.

name: Lower Back Extensions 3
overview: Lie on your front and bring your arms into the "W" position. | Squeeze your glutes and tilt your hips backwards (flattens the front of your hips against the ground). | Raise your chest off the ground and lower it without resting on the ground before the next rep.

name: Lower Back Extensions 2
overview: Lie on your front leaning your forehead on the back of your palms. | Squeeze your glutes and tilt your hips backwards (flattens the front of your hips against the ground). | Raise your chest off the ground and lower it without resting on the ground before the next rep

name: Partner Lower Back Extensions
overview: Lie on your front leaning your forehead on the back of your palms. | Ask someone to hold your ankles or secure them under a supportive structure. | Squeeze your glutes and tilt your hips backwards (flattens the front of your hips against the ground). | Raise your chest off the ground and lower it without resting on the ground before the next rep.

name: Clamshells 4 Side Lying Resisted
overview: Lay on your side with knees bent and a loop band around them. 90° angle at hips, knees and feet. | Externally rotate the top knee without dropping your hip back | Hold for a split second (or as indicated by therapist/trainer) and return to starting position without resting on the under knee

name: Clamshells 3 Internal External Rotations Side Lying
overview: Lay on your side with knees bent. 90° angle at hips, knees and feet. | Lift your top leg a few centimeters off of the under leg (15-20cm) | Externally rotate the top knee without dropping your hip back. | Hold for a split second (or as indicated by therapist/trainer) and then internally rotate the knee

name: Clamshells 2 Side Lying
overview: Lay on your side with knees bent. 90° angle at hips, knees and feet. | Lift your top leg slightly so no support is coming from the under leg. | Externally rotate the top knee without dropping your hip back | Hold for a split second (or as indicated by therapist/trainer) and return to starting position

name: Floor Incline Leg Raise
overview: Sit on the floor and lean back into your palms or on your elbows. | Raise a straight leg a few centimeters off the ground and hold the position for the specified duration.

name: Clamshells 1 Side Lying
overview: Lay on your side with knees bent. 90° angle at hips, knees and feet. | Externally rotate the top knee without dropping your hip back | Hold for a split second (or as indicated by therapist/trainer) and return to starting position without resting on the under knee

name: Leg Lowers
overview: Lie on your back. Raise your legs but bend your knees | Keep a 90° angle at hips and knees. Lower your toes to the ground without bending your knees | Make sure you maintain a flat lower back against the ground throughout the movement.

name: Seated Lateral Line Stretch
overview: Start from a seated position with an upright posture. | Cross your right leg over the left and raise your right arm over your head. | Lean towards your left and reach with your right arm as far to the left as possible. | Repeat on the opposite side by crossing the left leg over the right. | You can do the same exercise against a wall or by holding onto a pull-up bar.

name: Lat Mobilisation Floor Foam Roller
overview: Sit on the floor next to a foam roller. | Lean in such a way that the foam roller is under your lat. | The arm of that side should ideally be raised. | Roll your lat up and down the foam roller to mobilise it.

name: Lat And Shoulder External Rotation Stretch 1 Kneeling Dowel
primary_muscle: Lats, Shoulders, Front Shoulders, Rear Shoulders
overview: Kneel in front of a bench, placing your elbows on with palms facing up while holding the dowel at shoulder width. | Sit your hips back onto your heels, pressing the head in between the arms. | You should feel a stretch in your lats, triceps and deep in the shoulder joint. | You can add movement (bend-extended arms) to mobilise the shoulder joint.

name: Lat And Lateral Line Stretch
overview: Start from the standing position with an upright posture. | Cross your right leg over the left and raise your right arm over your head. | Lean towards your left and reach with your right arm as far to the left as possible. | Repeat on the opposite side by crossing the left leg over the right. | You can do the same exercise against a wall or by holding onto a pull-up bar.

name: Standing Knee Raise Hold
overview: Stand up straight and with a good posture. | Shift your weight onto the supporting leg while driving the other knee. | Your thigh should be parallel to the ground.

name: Calf Raise 3B Soleus Bias Unilateral
overview: From the standing position, bend your knees till you get to a squated or semi-squated position. Be close to a pole or squat rack to use for balance | Maintain the squat while shifting your weight onto the working leg and raising the other off the ground | Raise your heel off the ground | Hold the position for a split second before lowering your heel again | Do not rest at the bottom. As soon as you feel your heel touch the ground, repeat the movement

name: Knee Pull And Lumbar Rotation
overview: Lie on your back and flatten you lower back against the ground | Pull one knee towards your chest and then across your body till it forces your lower back into a rotated position.

name: Calf Raise 3A Soleus Bias Bilateral
overview: From the standing position, bend your knees till you get to a squated or semi-squated position | Maintain the squat while raising both heels off the ground | Hold the position for a split second before lowering your heels again | Do not rest at the bottom. As soon as you feel your heels touch the ground, repeat the movement

name: Knee Extension Seated Partial
overview: Sit on a box or bench, but make sure that your upper leg is supported. | Extend your leg fully but bend 1/3 of the way back down. | Perform as many partial reps as indicated on your training program.

name: Calf Raise 2D Unilateral From Box
overview: Use the edge of a step to place the balls of one foot on | Raise the heel, before lowering it below the level of the step, or until you feel a stretch in the calf | Try pausing on both ends of range for a split second

name: Towel Knee Extension Hold
overview: Sit on the floor and use your palms to lean back into. | Place a rolled towel under your knee so it is slightly bent. | Try to squeeze the towel between the back of your knee and the ground by extending the leg.

name: Calf Raise 2C Eccentric Unilateral From Box
overview: While standing on the edge of a step, use both legs to raise your heels, before shifting your weight onto the working leg | Hold the top position for a split second and then very slowly lower your heel below the level of the step or until you start feeling a stretch in the calf | Try to avoid muscular (calf) contraction while raising the heels and then exert muscular contraction on the eccentric phase

name: Band Knee Extension
overview: Attach a band to a fixed point and wrap the loose end around your knee. | Start in the standing position, facing the anchoring point and with the band already under tension. | Allow the working knee to bend (the band will pull the knee), while shifting your weight onto the supporting leg. | Shift your weight back onto the bentleg and fully extend the knee (pull the kneecap up)

name: Calf Raise 2B Unilateral Floor
overview: From the standing position, shift your weight onto onto one foot | Raise the heel of the working leg off the ground, before lowering it back to the ground | Do not rest at the bottom. As soon as you feel your heel touch the ground, repeat the movement | You should feel your calf working

name: Calf Raise 2A Eccentric Unilateral Floor
overview: Raise both heels off the ground, shift your weight onto the working leg while the opposite leg is suspended. | Hold the top position for a split second and then very slowly lower your heel to the ground | Try to avoid muscular (calf) contraction while raising the heel and then exert muscular contraction on the eccentric phase

name: Calf Raise 1E Bilateral Isometric Floor
overview: From the standing position, shift your weight onto the balls of your feet | Raise the heels off the ground, and hold the position for the duration specified | You should feel your calves working

name: Jump On And Off Box
overview: Start from the standing position. Lower your body into a semi-squatted position | Push off the ground with two legs to perform the jump and land on the box. Jump off the box in the same manner | Land on one leg, on the ground, making sure to absorb the impact by bending the knee as much as needed. | Absorb the impact by bending the knees when landing. Try to maintain your balance

name: Calf Raise 1D Bilateral From Box
overview: Use the edge of a step to place the balls of your feet on | Raise the heels, before lowering them below the level of the step, or until you feel a stretch in the calves | Try pausing on both ends of range for a split second | You should feel your calves working

name: Jump Off Box Single Leg Landing
overview: Start from the standing position on a box. Lower your body into a semi-squatted position | Push off the box with two legs to perform the jump. | Land on one leg, on the ground, making sure to absorb the impact by bending the knee as much as needed.

name: Calf Raise 1C Bilateral Eccentric From Box
overview: While standing on the edge of a step, shift your weight on your toes while quickly raising the heals | Hold the top position for a split second and then very slowly lower your heels below the level of the step until you start feeling a stretch in the calves | Try to avoid muscular (calf) contraction while raising the heels and then exert muscular contraction on the eccentric phase | Pause on both ends of range

name: Calf Raise 1B Bilateral Floor
overview: From the standing position, shift your weight onto the balls of your feet | Raise the heels off the ground, before lowering them back to the ground | Do not rest at the bottom. As soon as you feel your heels touch the ground, repeat the movement | You should feel your calves working

name: Calf Raise 1A Bilateral Eccentric Floor
overview: Beginner | Push | - | Isolation

name: Jump Into Single Leg Landing
overview: Start from the standing position. Lower your body into a semi-squatted position. | Push off the ground with two legs to perform the jump. | Land on one leg, making sure to absorb the impact by bending the knee as much as needed.

name: Calf Mobilisation Seated Floor Roll
overview: Beginner | Hold | - | Isolation

name: Calf Isometric On Step
overview: Stand on the edge of a step (on the balls of your feet) | Support your weight in this position for the given amount of time | You should feel your calves working

name: Band Seated Inversions
overview: Sit on a step or low box, preferably with a back support. Extend both legs and cross the working leg over the non working leg. | Wrap the band around the balls of the working foot. Pass the band around the other foot as shown in the video. | Hold the end of the band with the same arm as the working foot. The ankle should be at 90° and turned outwards (eversion) before you start the movement | Turn the ankle in, without moving the rest of the leg.

name: Big Toe Dorsiflexion
overview: Sit on a bench with your bare foot on the ground. | Raise your big toe as far as it can go, without moving the rest of the toes.

name: Big Toe Abduction
overview: Sit on a bench with your bare foot on the ground. | Slightly raise your big toe before trying to move it towards the opposite side (abduction). | Expect he range of motion is very limited and the movement to be very difficult. | It helps a lot having your toe on a line as benchmark.

name: Bench Lift Off Static
overview: While seated on a bench, place your palms on the bench by your sides | Palm placement should allow room for the fingers to grip the edge of the bench | Try to lift your bodyweight off the bench by pushing the palms into the bench | Lockout your elbows and hold isometrically

name: Single Leg Bosu Ball Balance 2
overview: Place the supporting leg on the middle of a bosu ball. | Keep the knee of the suspended leg slightly bent. | Try to maintain your balance on the bosu ball while bouncing a tennis ball off the wall.

name: Standing Inversions Hold
overview: Stand up straight with a relatively narrow stance. | Roll your feet out and balance. | Make sure you do not roll out excessively or you are risking re-injury.

name: Infinity Loop Standing Hip Mobility
overview: From the standing position raise one knee till the thigh is parallel to the ground. | Bring the knee to your side without rotating the hips. | The knee drives the movement and the ankle lags slightly behind.

name: Single Leg Balance 2
overview: Stand upright with a braced core. | Choose the supporting leg and shift your weight on that, while lifting the other slightly off the ground. | Try to maintain your balance while bouncing a tennis ball off the wall or ground.

name: I's Prone
overview: Lie on your front with your arms extended and above your head. | Point the thumbs up. | Try to raise your arms off the ground keeping them straight.

name: I Into W
overview: Lie on your front with your arms extended and above your head. | Point the thumbs up. Try to raise your arms off the ground keeping them straight. | Bend your elbows to the side and form the letter "W" with your arms. | Extend to the "I" position but do not rest on the ground

name: Alphabet
overview: Sit on a box or bench | Keep one foot off the ground by pulling onto your knee, or by crossing one leg over the opposite knee. | Try to form the letters of the Alphabet with your foot.

name: Band Hip Thrust
overview: Attach a band to an anchor point and face away from the anchor point. | Loop the other end of the band around your hips. | While keeping your knees extended, shift your hips back, then forward against the band.

name: Adductor Stretch Seated Bilateral Static
overview: Sit against a wall and bring your feet together, letting the knees spread | Once you reach the end of your range, allow gravity to do the work | If you feel that gravity isn't enough, you can apply gentle downward pressure on your knees with your palms | Try to maintain a straight back while performing the exercise

name: Hip Openers
primary_muscle: Glutes, Shoulders, Chest, Front Shoulders, Rear Shoulders
overview: From the standing position perform a walkout (use to palms to "walk" into the push up position). | Bring your leg to the side and place the foot by your palm. | Rotate towards the ceiling and then towards the ground, pressing the hips towards the ground.

name: Adductor Stretch Seated Bilateral Dynamic
overview: Sit against a wall and bring your feet together, letting the knees spread | Once you reach the end of your range, bounce the knees to feel a gentle stretch deep in your groin | Try to maintain a straight back while performing the exercise

name: Adductor Stretch Dynamic Unilateral 4 Point Position
overview: From the 4 point position (all fours), extend one leg to the side, placing the foot on the ground. | Start rocking your hips back and forth. | You should feel your adductors and hip joint being stretched. | Try to maintain a neutral spine

name: Hip Flexor Stretch Kneeling Lunge 3
overview: Bring yourself to kneeling lunge position. Keep a 90° angle at knees. | Back foot should be elevated (the higher the elevation the more the hip flexor/upper quad will stretch). | Slide the front knee forward while gently leaning back. | Squeeze the glute on the side of the leg that's to the front to avoid lower back complaints.

name: Adductor Stretch Dynamic Standing Alternate
overview: From the standing position, use a chair/bench/box for support | Transfer your weight towards one leg by bending the knee, while keeping the opposite leg straight and the foot on the ground | Feel a stretch on the inside of the thigh (adductor) of the straight leg

name: Hip Flexor Stretch Kneeling Lunge 2
overview: Bring yourself to kneeling lunge position. Keep a 90° angle at knees. | Slide the front knee forward while gently leaning back. Raise your arm diagonally backwards | Squeeze the glute on the side of the leg that's to the front to avoid lower back complaints.

name: Adductor Raise Side Lying Short Lever
overview: From the side lying position, bend your upper leg and place it on a bench | Raise your hips off the ground by pressing your leg into the bench

name: Adductor Raise Side Lying Long Lever
overview: From the side lying position, place your upper leg on a bench | Raise your hips off the ground by pressing your leg into the bench

name: Hip Flexor Stretch Kneeling Lunge 1
overview: Bring yourself to kneeling lunge position. Keep a 90° angle at knees. | Slide the front knee forward while gently leaning back. | Squeeze the glute on the side of the leg that's to the front to avoid lower back complaints.

name: Band Straight Leg Hip Flexions
overview: Attach a band to a fixed point. | Wrap the loose end of the band around your ankle. | Face away from the attachment point. | Raise your working leg against the resistance.

name: Adductor Leg Raise Side Lying Isometric
overview: Stabilise yourself in the side lying position, using your upper arm and leg | Raise your under leg and hold isometrically for the specified amount of time

name: Adductor Leg Raise Side Lying
overview: Stabilise yourself in the side lying position, using your upper arm and leg | Raise and lower your under leg for the specified amount of reps/or sets

name: Standing Mini-Band Hip Flexion
overview: Wrap a loop band around your feet. | Drive a knee upwards till your thigh is parallel to the ground. | Pause for a moment and then return to the starting position. | Try to maintain balance and a good posture when raising the knee.

name: Abductor Leg Raise Side Lying Isometric
overview: Stabilise yourself in the side lying position, using your upper arm and under leg | Raise your upper leg till it is parallel to the ground and hold isometrically for the specified amount of time. | Feel your bum (glute med) and the lateral line of your leg worked

name: Abductor Leg Raise Side Lying
overview: Stabilise yourself in the side lying position, using your upper arm and under leg | Raise your upper leg till it is parallel to the ground. This is your starting point. | Raise your leg and lower back to parallel for the specified amount of reps and/or sets | Feel your bum (glute med) and the lateral line of your leg worked

name: Inchworm
overview: Stand tall, hinge at hips, and reach hands to the floor. | Walk hands forward into a plank position. | Walk feet towards hands and repeat the motion.

name: Wall Angels
overview: Stand against a wall with your back flat, arms at 90° by your sides. | Slowly raise arms overhead, keeping elbows and wrists in contact with the wall. | Lower arms back down to starting position, maintaining constant wall contact throughout.

name: Ankle Circle
overview: Sit or stand, lift one foot slightly off the ground. | Rotate your ankle in a circular motion. | Complete the allotted amount of reps, then switch directions and repeat on the other foot.
